loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es: Martha Alejandra S. es madre soltera de tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar lo cual lleva muchos gastos, en este momento uno de ellos quiere irse a estudiar a otra ciudad para tener una profesión lo cual solicita del apoyo para poder cubrir estos gastos. Martha desea darle un buen estudio a su hijo para que en un futuro se un gran profesionista y salga adelante por si mismo. Ella trabaja como cocinera en una guardería,  para tener más ingresos vende comida y  ropa usada,  para poder sostener los gastos. Con este crédito ya seria 5 los que tendría en esta institución lo cual ha manifestado tener una buena cultura de pago.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra S. is a single mother with three school-age children, which means she has many expenses. Currently one of them wants to further his studies in another city, which is why she is applying for the loan. Martha wants to provide a good education for her son so that in the future he can be a successful professional and improve his life. She works as a cook at a daycare center, and to earn extra money she sells food and used clothing. This will be her fifth loan with this institution, and she has been very reliable with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay child's tuition

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. es una mujer joven de 27 años quien era integrante de un grupo solidario el cual se separó por la decisión de sus socias de ya no seguir con los créditos de manera grupal; así ella tomó esa misma decisión pues “no podía confiar en cualquiera para formar un grupo”. Ella inició hace 5 años una pequeña pulpería la cual no ha crecido mucho, sin embargo ella no pierde las esperanzas de convertirla un día en una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
María Isabel R. is a 27-year old woman who was part of a community bank group, which broke up when they decided to no longer seek group loans. So María decided that she "could not trust just anyone when forming a group." Five years ago she started a small grocery store, which has not grown too much. She still hopes to one day become a larger distributor of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Lupe Irene

texts.es:
La Señora. Lupe Irene L. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Pichacay que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente  que es muy amable y cálida,  se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, este sector tiene un clima frio.

Doña Lupe tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene  un niño de 12 años de edad que este año ingresa al colegio, su esposo es negociante de ganado, esta actividad más el trabajo de su esposa les ha permitido construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Lupe Irene y su esposo se dedican al negocio de compra y venta de ganado, venden los días de feria y ya tienen varios años en este negocio.

Es nuestra socia hace 8 años y los créditos le han servido mucho en su hogar y también en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para seguir creciendo con su negocio.

Su meta es comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lupe Irene L. is a partner in the Unión Progresista community bank. She lives in the town of Pichacay, which is part of the parrish of Santa Ana. This parrish is known for its warm and kind people, though it has a cold climate. She works raising animals and crops. Lupe is 42 years old and is married with a 12-year old son who is starting high school this year. Her husband works in the cattle business, and his business along with her work have allowed them to build their own house. She has been a community bank partner for eight years and the loans have helped her business and her home. She will use the loan money to purchase cattle and thus continue growing her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 32 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su hija, sus padres y hermanas. Hace más de 5 años, se dedica en la venta de ropa masculina, en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su distrito. Es entonces que atiende a su clientela, desde las 9:30 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, previo a su actividad lleva primero a su hijo al jardín y al medio día  también lo recoge para luego continuar con la venta en compañía de él. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que la mercadería no se pierde y con el tiempo recupera la inversión, además que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. En adelante planea ampliar su negocio abasteciéndose de prendas femeninas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en cumplir con responsabilidad en sus pagos, ya que quiere contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito solicitado, desea comprar prendas de vestir y de ese modo incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 32, is a very hard-working mother. She lives in her parents’ house with her parents and sisters. She has been selling men's clothing at a stand located in her district market. She waits on her customers from 9:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Before she starts works she takes her son to nursery school. At midday she goes to get him, and she then continues selling while he is with her. What she likes most about her business is that you do not lose the merchandise. In time you recuperate the investment. Also, it generates good income, which helps her cover the family expenses. Later she plans to expand her business and stock it with women’s clothing. This is her first loan with MFP. She pledges to responsibly make her payments because she wants to have future help. She will use the requested loan to buy clothing. That way she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on clothing to increase her earnings

loans.name: Luz Ernestina

texts.en:
Luz Ernestina G. M. is 31 years old and lives in common-law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 5 children aged 17, 11, 9, 7, and 3.

Luz is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector.

Luz also works in agriculture and earns on average $150 monthly. She purchases her supplies and sells her products in the nearby town of Matilde.

Luz plans to use this loan to build a house. Her dreams are to finish building the house, to buy a car, and to see her children get a good education.

In her free time Luz likes to spend time with her children and watch television.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Mayra Soray

texts.es:
Mayra de 41 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado),  ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que su esposo solo tiene trabajos por contratos y no tiene muchos ingresos, trabaja desde hace 5 años atrás desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mayra, 41 years old, lives in the Guayaquil Perimeter (outer-suburban zone, at its outskirts is the salty estuary). She sells Yambal products (a company that offers enterprising women to start up their own independent sales). She began working just to be able to help with household expenses, as her husband only has contract work and does not have much income. She has worked for the past five years, from early on offering the products to her neighbours and friends, selling perfumes, creams, deodorants, clothing. With the loan, she wants to purchase Yambal products such as perfumes, creams, deodorants. In the future, she would like to finish construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, creams, shampoo.

loans.name: Angela Coronado

texts.es: Ángela Coronado Antón V. es una mujer madura de 50 años de edad, quien vende frutas en el mercado oriental, ella en ocasiones incluso consigue la venta completa de la cosecha alguna de las frutas que ella siembra. Ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta labor y es su pareja quien le ayuda y le apoya en estas actividades.
texts.en:
Ángela Coronado Antón V. is a 50-year-old woman who sells fruits in the eastern market. From time to time, she manages to sell the whole harvest of fruits that she has grown. She has been doing this for the last five years. Her partner helps and supports her in these activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of goods

loans.name: Marta Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: María Teresa De Jesús Ramírez cuenta con su negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años donde manifiesta vender ropa de buena calidad y de diferentes tallas, lo cual requiere de un préstamo para comprar más mercancía; como ya se aproxima la temporada de frio quiere estar preparada. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad para apoyar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
María Teresa De Jesús Ramírez has been selling used clothes for 10 years. She sells high-quality clothes of many different sizes. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise so that she will be ready for the cold season. Her husband works as a security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchadise

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Apolonia M. tiene una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Miscelánea Karen” que ya tiene 6 años, la señora nos cuenta que desde que llego a esta ciudad ella inicio con su negocio en lugar de trabajar en maquiladora y ganar el mínimo; sobre todo para estar con sus 3 hijos al cuidado de ellos. Apolonia pide el apoyo para pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos que próximamente entraran a la escuela y así tener una buena preparación académica.
texts.en:
Apolonia M. has run a grocery store called "Karen's Mix" for the last 6 years. She tells us that she started this business when she arrived in this city instead of earning minimum wage at a sweatshop and so as to be able to take care of her three children. Apolonia is asking for help to pay her children's school fees because she wants them to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Aracely Guadalupe

texts.es:
Aracely tiene 53 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Jucuapa, departamento D. Usulután, es casada, tiene dos hijos mayores los cuales son independientes, vive son el esposo, ella se tiene venD. carne D. res y cerdo.
Ella aprendió del negocio D. la edad D. 14 años gracias a la madre quien le enseño el oficio, ella posee su propio negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado D. municipal D. Jucuapa, el cual lo atienD. en un horario D. 6:00 am-4:00 pm, actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. compra D. cerdos para vender las carne, chorizos, hueso, costilla, grasa D. cerdo, frito, esto le permitirá crecer el negocio, para generar ganancias y mejorar las condiciones D. vida, riesgo D. préstamo es que la  persona se enferme. 
Los sueños son ser una gran empresaria, con muchos clientes, que le permitan mejorar las condicione D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Aracely is 53 years old and lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután. She is married and has three adult children. She lives with her husband, and she sells beef and pork. She learned this traD. when she was 14, thanks to her mother, who taught her. She has her own business in Jucuapa's municipal market. She works from 6 am to 4pm. She is asking for a loan to buy pork so she can sell meat, sausages, marrow, suet, and fried pork. This will enable her to increase her business so as to generate more money and improve her quality of life. The only risk for the loan is that someone could get sick. She dreams of being a big businesswoman, with many clients, so she could improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Amalia del Carmen P. V. es una mujer joven de apenas 26 años, pero el hecho de ser joven no significa falta de experiencia pues ella desde hace 8 años ya que vende productos de panadería y repostería de manera ambulante, una gran parte de sus clientes son personas a las que les brinda crédito y le cancelan los mismos de manera semanal o quincenal. En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su conyugue quien trabaja también en la elaboración del pan que ella vende.
texts.en:
Amalia del Carmen P. V. is a young woman of just 26, but her years of experience belie her age. For the last eight years she has been working as a street vendor selling sweet and savoury bakery products. Many of her customers make their purchases from her on credit and then repay her on a weekly or fortnightly basis. Her husband supports her business by baking the bread that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Rosa Arcila

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Arcila V. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Zhimbrug que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente la que es muy amable y cálida, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, este sector tiene un clima frio.
 
La Señora Rosa Arcila es socia del banco comunal hace un año, y ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar de su hijos, también aprovecha el tiempo para criar chanchos, cuyes y gallinas ya que este es su negocio.

Doña Rosa tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 23, 22, 20, 15 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y estudian en el colegio, su cuarto hijo  estudia en la universidad y también trabaja, su quinta hija estudia en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su propio bus, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de los útiles escolares de su hija y también para el alimento de sus chanchos.
 
Su meta es tener un kiosco en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Arcila V. is a member of the community bank Unión Progresista. She lives in the Zhimbrug community which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. The parish is characterized by its warm and kind hearted people who work in agriculture and raise animals in a cold climate. Rosa Arcila joined the community bank one year ago, and since then she has formed a great friendship with all of her fellow bank members. She works at home bringing up her children and caring for the house, taking advantage of her time by also raising pigs, guinea pigs and chickens which she uses to run her business. Rosa is 45 years old, married and has six children of 24, 23, 22, 20, 15 and 4 years of age. Her first three children work and study at school, her fourth child studies at university and also works and her 15 year old daughter studies at school. Her husband works as a driver and has his own bus; with his income they have been able to build their own house. Rosa’s loan will go towards purchasing school supplies for her daughter and feed for the pigs. Her dream is to run a kiosk from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies and feed for pigs

loans.name: Vicente Adalberto

texts.en:
Vicente Adalberto S. N. is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Vicente is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector.

Vicente also works in the agriculture sector, earning on average $150 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde.

Vicente plans to use the loan to grow cacao (used to make chocolate).  This year, pests have destroyed much of his cacao crops. 

Vicente’s dream is to have his own house and a car. In his free time he likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Griselda Esmeralda

texts.es: Griselda Esmeralda R. M. es una mujer trabajadora de 29 años que buscó como ganarse la vida desde muy joven, ella es costurera y fabrica delantales los cuales vende, con ayuda de su esposo, en el mercado municipal de Masaya y en el departamento de Rivas. El esposo se dedica a la agricultura pero le da una mano para que ambos puedan salir adelante. Su sueño es que el negocio le sea fructífero y les ayude con todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Griselda Esmeralda R. M. is a hardworking woman of 29 who has been working to earn her living from a very young age. She is a seamstress and makes aprons which she sells with the help of her husband in the municipal market of Masaya and in the department of Rivas. Her husband works in agriculture but he lends her a hand so that both of them can make a life for themselves. Her dream is for her business to be fruitful and support them in all their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus parientes, en compañía de sus 2 hijos. Durante la semana, trabaja en una central telefónica como recepcionista, atendiendo denuncias y reclamos de los usuraos de teléfonos fijos, mediante las llamadas y los fines de semana prepara buffet criollo, siendo pedido por parte de clientes que desean celebrar matrimonios, bautizos, quince años y demás acontecimientos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos de buena posición y algunas son  los profesores del colegio de sus hijos. Los 6 años que lleva en este negocio; le han pagado todo aunque con un poco de demora; es por ello que ahora cobra antes de dar el servicio. En adelante piensa ampliar y diversificar su negocio, con la repostería, por ello va hacer cursos de esta índole, para que sus ingresos aumenten. Para Silvia, es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo,  y agradece a los de su grupo por integrarla. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, fideos, asimismo comprará ollas ya que los que tiene están deteriorada, de ese modo continuar su negocio de los buffets.
texts.en:
Silvia is 39 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her two sons at some relatives' home. During the week she works in a call centre as receptionist, taking calls about complaints and other claims by land-line phone users. At the week-end she prepares creole buffets for clients celebrating weddings, christenings, fifteen-year old birthday parties and other events. Her clients are well-off neighbours and some of them teach at her sons' school. She has been in this line of business for 6 years. She has always been paid, although with some delays, and hence she now asks to be paid before providing the service. She plans to expand and diversify her business by also providing confectionery, so in order to increase her income she's going to take a course on the subject. This is Silvia's first loan with MFP and she is committed to repaying it on time. She would like to thank the members of her loan group for welcoming her. With the loan requested she will buy rice, noodles and pots because the ones she has are in a poor condition. This will enable her to continue with her catering business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products for her catering business.

loans.name: Angelita Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Angelita Rosario Domínguez es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Pichacay que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente  que es muy amable y cálida, se dedican a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura, este sector es de clima frio.
 
Doña Angelita Rosario tiene de 62 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos todos  mayores de edad, tres de ellos ya son casados y viven independientemente con sus nuevas familias, dos de sus hijas son madres solteras y su último hijo es quien trabaja siendo su mayor apoyo en su hogar, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Angelita Rosario se dedica a cuidar a sus nietos, también cría animales como: vacas, chanchos, etc.
 
Es socia de la fundación Espoir hace 6 años,su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, su meta es tener muchos animales y así crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Angelita Rosario Domínguez is a member of the Unión Progresista loan group. She lives in Pichacay, a community in the the parish of Santa Ana. The people who live in the parish are very friendly and warm, and work in animal breeding and agriculture. The weather in the region is cold. Angelita Rosario is 62 years old and married. She has three children, all of them adults: three of them are married and live independently with their new families, two daughters are single mothers and the youngest son works and is her main support at home. Her husband works in agriculture. With both their work they have managed to build their own home. Angelita Rosario looks after her grandchildren and she breeds animals such as cows, pigs, etc. She has been a member of the Espoir loan group for six years. She is going to invest the new loan in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to own many animals and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Ayme Yanina

texts.es:
Ayme tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermano en el sector Huaca Partida, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace dos años. Ella nos comenta que aprendió del negocio de su madre y luego empezó a criar sus propios animales. Ayme cria sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa y estos también buscan su propio alimento en los alrededores, ya que la zona en donde vive es zona rural y las casas están rodeadas de bosques secos y campos de cultivo.

Ayme cria aves de corral y cerdos para luego venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente recorren la zona donde vive. Ella había tenido un préstamo financiado por Kiva y gracias a el su negocio ha ido creciendo con el transcurrir de los meses, actualmente Ayme necesita adquirir mas animales para poder seguir adelante con su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ayme es una joven responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo sigue siendo hacerse conocida en el negocio y crecer poco a poco como empresaria. Ella se encuentra contenta y muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a traves del programa Kiva.
texts.en:
Ayme is twenty-one-years-old and lives with her parents and brother in the Huaca Partida, a rural area in the district of Pitipo, located forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has made her living raising and selling young animals. She tells us that she learned the business from her mother and then started raising her own animals behind her house. Ayme lives in a rural area where the houses are surrounded by dry forest and crop fields, so the animals search around the area for their own food Ayme raises barnyard fowl and pigs to sell to businesspeople who typically travel around her area. She had gotten a loan financed through Kiva, and thanks to that, her business had been growing as the months went by. Now she needs to get more animals so she can get ahead in her business and bring in more profit. The loan she is seeking at this time, through Edpyme Alternativa, is for 1000 soles, which will help her reach her goal. Ayme is a responsible and hard-working young woman. It continues to be her greatest wish to be known for her business and to grow as a businesswoman little by little. She is happy and really appreciates the people who work with her through the Kiva program.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barnyard fowl and pigs so she can grow her business raising and selling young animals.

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Milagro se encuentra conformado por Margarita del Carmen Gómez de 38 años, Ana María López López de 35 años y Brígida de la Concepción Mejía V. de 23 años; tres mujeres jóvenes y deseosas de salir adelante.

Margarita, coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de accesorios de uso personal como cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, prendas, perfumes y otros, ella inició hace 6 años vendiendo solamente ropa, luego decidió vender también perfumes y así poco a poco fue introduciendo más productos. Ana María, vende ambulante perfumería y accesorios por catálogos en especial productos de AVON y ZERMAT, el negocio lo inició su mamá pero al no poder dedicarle el tiempo necesario ella se hizo cargo. Por último Brígida, quien es la menor del grupo tiene apenas 1 año de dedicarse a la venta por catálogo de los productos AVON y su deseo es poder ser más autosostenible para poder trabajar también con otras empresas como ZERMAT, ORIFLAME y JAQUELIN CAROL.
texts.en:
The community bank Milagro (Miracle) consists of Margarita del Carmen Gómez, who is 38 years old, Ana María López López, who is 35, and Brígida de la Concepción Mejía V., who is 23. They are three young women who want to advance. Margarita, the coordinator of the group, sells personal accessories such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, perfumes, and other items. She began this business six years ago, selling only clothing. Then she decided to also sell perfumes, and thus, little by little, she introduced more products. Ana Maria makes door-to-door sales of perfume and other catalog accessories, especially Avon and Zermat products. Her mother began the business, but when she was not able to dedicate the necessary time to it, Ana Maria took over. Finally, Brígida, the youngest of the group, has barely one year of working in catalog sales of Avon products. Her wish is to be more self-supporting and to also work with other businesses such as Zermat, Oriflame, and Jaquelin Carol.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell

loans.name: Wilson Mardoqueo

texts.en:
Wilson Mardoqueo S. G. is 47 years old. He is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has three children, 25, 22, and 18 years of age. Wilson farms, earning $130 on average per month. He buys and sells his produce in the nearby town of Matilde. In his free time he likes to watch television and listen to music. His favorite community festival is the fiesta of San Francisco.

Wilson is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector. Wilson plans to use his loan to maintain his house. His dream is to buy a new house and a plot of land.

loans.use: To maintain his house

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, es padre soltero tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad el cual depende económicamente del trabajo de Oscar, el negocio es  venta de CD, DVD.
El negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante por las calles de mayor comercio de Gotera, no tiene horario fijo, trabaja todos los días de la semana, el necesita un préstamo para compra de mercadería para continuar con el negocio, compra de CD y DVD. El riesgo que corre es que los precios de los productos bajen.
Las aspiraciones de Oscar son apoyar a su hijo con los estudios, ya que el no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, trabajar para darle mejores condiciones de vida a pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old. He lives in the town of Jucuapa, in the Usulután district. He is the single father of a 10-year-old son, who depends economically on Oscar's work. Oscar's business is selling CDs and DVDs. He carries out his business as a walking vendor in the shopping districts of Gotera. He does not have a fixed schedule, but he works every day of the week. He needs a loan to buy merchandise, CDs and DVDs, to continue his business. He takes the risk that prices of these products will go down. Oscar's hopes are to support his son with his studies, since he himself was not given the opportunity to go to school, and to work to give better living conditions to his little son.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (CDs and DVDs)

loans.name: Israel Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Israel lo integran Liseth María Z. de 38 años, Hellen Haideé F. C. de 25 años y Juana Verónica D. de 40 años. Liseth, su coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados de segunda mano desde hace 2 años en el mercado Israel Levites de Managua, sin embargo en sus inicios hace 8 años ella vendía únicamente ropa de manera ambulante en los barrios de Managua. Hellen, tiene una sala de belleza en el mismo mercado, anteriormente ella trabajaba a domicilio pero recogió dinero y con la oportunidad que encontró en los créditos logró hacerse de un tramo en el mercado donde actualmente trabaja. Juana al igual que sus socias tiene un tramo en el mercado, el local de ella era anteriormente un comedor donde vendía también licores y por el motivo que parecía más una cantina que un comedor decidió suspender la venta de estos productos y ahora sólo vende comida.

Estas mujeres utilizarán el crédito para la compra de productos e insumos para sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Israel" has 3 members: Liseth María Z., 38, Hellen Haideé F. C., 25, and Juana Verónica D., 40. Lisbeth, the coordinator, has sold used clothing and footwear for 2 years in the Israel Levites market in Managua. When she started out 8 years ago she worked as a street vendor selling only clothing in the neighborhoods of Managua. Hellen has a beauty salon in the same market. Previously she worked as a domestic, but she gathered together some money and with the opportunity that she encountered with these loans she managed to get herself a stall in the market where she currently works. Juana, along with the other members, has a stall in the market, which was previously a restaurant that used to also sell liquor, but since it seemed more like a bar than a restaurant she decided to suspend the sale of those products and now sells only food. These women will use the loan to buy products and supplies for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina de 59 años, vive con José de 64 años y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años tiene una tienda, vendiendo golosinas, negocio al cual lo tiene instalado en el interior de su casa. Marcelina comienza su jornada diaria a las 7 de la mañana y culmina al término del día. Ella se siente contenta con su negocio, pues le genera la ganancias que necesita para mantener a su familia, además ha logrado ganar buenos amigos, pero por otra parte también le resulta muy cansada su actividad pues debe viajar regularmente hasta el mercado mas cercano para abstenerse de sus productos. En el futuro tiene pensado aperturar una librería donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de útiles escolares y así mejorar sus ingresos. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que será puntual en cada uno de sus pagos ya que tiene en mente sacar otros créditos que le ayuden a seguir creciendo en su negocio. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería para abastecer mejor su tienda y así ofrecer mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 59 years old and lives with José who is 64 years old with their three children in their own house. For over three years she has had a store out of her home where she sells candies. Marcelina starts her workday at 7 am and finishes at the end of the day. She is happy with her business and generates the necessary income to provide for her family. She also has managed to earn good friends, but then is also very tired because she travels regularly to the nearest market to stock up on products. In the future she has planned to open a library where she can offer all kinds of school supplies and improve their income. This is the 5th loan with MFP, and she states that she will be punctual with each payment since she has other loans in mind that will help her to continue growing her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her store better and offer greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Las Aliadas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Aliadas se encuentra integrado por Elena Francisca Rodríguez, Esther del Carmen Gómez A. y Amada Julia O. Calero. Elena, coordinadora del grupo, trabaja de conserje pero también vende los días domingo donas, fritangas y tortillas, en sus inicios ella vendía cajetas de manera ambulante. Esther vende repochetas, refrescos, enchiladas, sandias y otros rubros y Julia en su casa de habitación vende gaseosas, panes, helados y chiverías, en sus inicios sólo vendía gaseosas y panes. Ellas utilizaran el crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The Los Aliadas solidarity group has three members: Elena Francisca Rodríguez, Esther del Carmen Gómez A. and Amada Julia O. Calero. Elena, the group leader, works as a secretary but also has a business selling donuts, fried snacks and tortillas on Sundays. In the beginning she sold caramels as a street vendor. Esther sells repochetas [similar to quesadillas], soft drinks, enchiladas, watermelon and other items.Julia sells sodas, bread, ice cream and snack foods from her home. In the beginning she only sold sodas and break. The borrowers will use the loan to purchase more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor de 45 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado) el tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Cuando el era pequeño su papa vendía panes pero cuando el creció, decidió comenzar vendiendo arroz, bebidas y otros víveres para poder mantener a su hijo y esposa que le ayuda en el negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h45am hasta las 21h00pm. Vende bebidas, granes y otros vives. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y cemento para mejorar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is 45 years old and lives on the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a suburban zone surrounded by a salt marsh). He has a small store in the front part of his house. When Victor was young, his father sold bread, but when he grew up he decided to start selling rice, drinks and other basic grocery items in order to support his son and his wife, who helps out with the business. He works each day from 6:45am to 9:00pm selling drinks, grains and other groceries. With this loan, Victor wants to buy drinks and cement to fix up his home. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and offer a wider variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: To purchase cement, concrete blocks and bricks

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lluvia lo conforman Lorena del Socorro Calderón de 37 años, Flor de María U. y Martha Lorena M. Sáenz. Lorena del Socorro, es la coordinadora de este grupo, en su casa tiene una tortillería, es ahí que vende también frijoles cocidos, cuajadas y otros rubros. Flor, vende hielo, chocobananos y frijoles cocidos, ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de materia prima y desea añadir en su negocio la venta de leña. Martha Lorena es dueña de un cafetín en el cual tiene muchos productos como chiverías y golosinas y con el crédito desea mejorarlo invirtiendo más en gaseosas y refrescos.
texts.en:
The members that make up the Lluvia Solidarity Group are Lorena del Socorro Calderón (37 years old), Flor de María U. and Martha Lorena M. Sáenz. Lorena del Socorro is the group leader. In her home she has a tortilla restaurant where she also sells cooked beans, curds, and other items. Flora sells ice, chocolate-covered bananas and cooked beans. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and also wants to start selling firewood. Martha Lorena is the owner of a small café in which she sells many products like snack foods and candy. With this loan she will improve her business by investing in more sodas and other drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Jannina Ysabel

texts.es:
Jannina tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en Batangrande, un centro poblado situado en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, es una comunidad de agricultores, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de medicinas y diversos productos farmaceuticos y quirurgicos en una botica ubicada en la vivienda donde reside, tiene mas de diez meses en el negocio y durante este tiempo ha sabido hacerse conocida y tener un grupo estable de clientes, el negocio ha ido creciendo también, ya que es uno de los pocos que existen en la zona y siempre tiene demanda.

Jannina desea adquirir mas productos para que su negocio pueda crecer y para quepueda satisfacer la demanda que posee, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jannina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En la zona se ha vuelto una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus clientes y vecinos.
texts.en:
Jannina, 30, is single and lives with her family in Batangrande, a small town located in the Pitipo district in the Ferreñafe province. It is a farming community that is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells medicines and a variety of pharmaceutical and surgical products in a drugstore located in the house where she lives. She has had this business for more than 10 months, and during this time she has become well known and has developed a group of regular customers. The business has also grown, since it is one of few that exist in the area, so she always has demand. Jannina wants to acquire more products so that her business can grow and so that she can satisfy the demand that she has. To do this, she is requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles. Jannina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her main wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman so that she can improve her quality of life and her family's standard of living. In the area she has become well-known and respected by her customers and neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicines and surgical instruments to expand her pharmacy

loans.name: El Valle (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Valle está formado por 9 personas entre hombres y mujeres, viven en la parroquia del Valle y la mayoría de su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, su gente más joven va a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo y también han migrado a otros países del mundo para ofrecerles a sus familias una estabilidad económica. Nuestras socias son personas que trabajan en diferentes actividades pero con un fin en común, que es  llevar el pan de cada día a sus hogares.

La Señora Gloria Esperanza A. vive en la comunidad de La Victoria Baja que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, es su primer crédito y fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de una casa en la cual labora hace 5 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de chanchos. 
Doña Gloria es muy joven  tiene 21 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 10 meses de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la misma casa en donde labora. El  dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

La Señora María Barbarita C. vive en la comunidad de El Paraíso que pertenece a la parroquia de El Valle, tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 17, 16, 14, 12, 5 y 1 año de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del  hogar, su cuarto hijo pasa en casa ya que no estudia, su quinto hijo este año ingresa a la escuela, su esposo trabaja como esquibador (cargador), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa que les ha prestado un conocido.
La Señora María Barbarita trabaja como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a sábado de 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., realiza esta actividad hace un mes y también se dedica a la cría de pollos. Es su tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación y le han beneficiado mucho en su hogar, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus pollos. Su sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank El Valle is made up of 9 people, men and women. They live in the parish of Valle and most of population work in agriculture and cattle farming. The younger people go to the city in search of better jobs and also have moved to other countries in the world to offer their families economic stability. Our members are people who work in different activities but with a common purpose, which is to bring the daily bread to their homes. Mrs. Gloria Esperanza A. lives in the community La Victoria Baja, belonging to the parish of Valle. It is her first loan and she was invited by her sister to form part of this group of hardworking women. She does household chores in a house where she has worked for 5 years. She works Monday-Saturday from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. She also raises pigs. Doña Gloria is very young she is 21 years old. She is a single mother to a 10 month old baby boy. She does not own her own home so she lives in the house she works. She is going to invest in the purchase of pigs with the money from the loan. Her dream is to have her own house. Mrs. María Barbarita C. lives in the El Paraíso community belonging to the parish of El Valle. She is 33 years old, married and has 6 children ages 17, 16, 14, 12, 5, and 1. Her three oldest children work and help around the house. Her fourth child lives at home and does not study. Her fifth child started school this year. He husband works as a loader. They do not own their own home, so they live in a house that they borrow from an acquaintance. Mrs. María Barbarita works as a domestic employee. She works Monday-Saturday from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. She has been doing this for over a month and she also raises chickens. This is her third loan with Fundación and they have greatly benefitted her and her home. She is going to purchase food for her chickens with this loan. Her dream is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and food for chickens

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío El Sandial, una zona rural situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a labores agrícolas, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, especialmente en el cultivo de maíz, en su vareidad amarillo duro. El cuenta con un terreno de sembrío donde suele instalar este cultivo hasta dos veces por año. Adicionalmente se dedica a criar y vender animales menores, con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades el sostiene la economía de su familia y trata de sacarlos adelante.

Estas actividades son muy importantes para el y siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para poder sacarlas adelante y obtener buenas cosechas. Actualmente el necesita adquirir algunos fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales piensa brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, de modo que pueda obtener una buena producción. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Edilberto es un padre responsable y bastante entregado asu familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive el es  una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a 29 year old father that lives with his wife and their three children in the settlement of El Sandial, a rural area located in the Pítipo district in the province of Ferreñafe. The residents here work mainly in agriculture. It is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Edilberto works in agriculture, focusing on the cultivation of the hard, yellow variety of corn. He has a plot of farm land where he usually plants his corn twice a year. In addition, he raises and sells small animals. He supports his family with his earnings, trying to help them to get ahead. These activities are very important to him and he works very hard to make a go of it so that he will have a good harvest. Currently, he needs to buy fertilizers and pesticides which he plans to use to maintain his crops so that they will produce well. In order to acheive this goal he has decided to request a loan for 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). This will be his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. Edilberto is a responsible father and is very dedicated to his family. His greatest desire is to continue working so that he can give them a better quality of life. In the area where he lives he is quite well-known and is highly regarded by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his crops

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad con bastante movimiento comercial y de transporte es conocida como “La Ciudad de la Amistad”, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a brindar servicio de diseño gráfico en un local ubicado en la zona comercial de la ciudad, el ofrece servicio de diseño de volantes, afiches y todo tipo de material publicitario a diversas empresas e instituciones de la ciudad. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio tiene un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su establecimiento y le recomiendan con sus conocidos. El utiliza los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia en su sostenimiento económico.

Marco Antonio desea brindar mantenimiento a la computadora que utiliza en su trabajo, asimismo desea adquirir material para realizar sus impresiones, por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su obejtivo.

El es muy responsable y bastante trabajador. En la zona donde vive es bastante estimado y sus clientes le tienen mucho aprecio. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 36, single, and lives with his family in the city of Chiclayo. Chiclayo is a city bustling with commerce and transportation and is known as the "city of friendship;" it is also the capital of Lambayeque. Marco Antonio has been working as a graphic designer for the past five years in a business district of the city. He designs fliers, tags and all kinds of advertising materials to various businesses around town. Due to his business history he has a faithful group of clients who come to him regularly and recommend him to others. He uses the income from his business to pay his personal expenses and to help support his family. Marco hopes to do some maintenance work on his work computer as well as to buy some printing materials. That is why he has requested a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goals. He is very responsible and hardworking. He is well respected in the neighborhood around his business and beloved by his clients. He has had a previous loan with our institution and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and the purchase of materials for a graphic design and print shop.

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: MI AMIGO JESUS 
Marina M. C. de 73 años de edad, viuda con 05 hijos  independientes, participa recientemente en la ALCANCIA COMUNAL “MI AMIGO JESUS”, el resto de los siete integrantes son personas muy emprendedoras como lo demuestran cuando se reúnen para efectuar sus pagos, día a día se esfuerzan mucho para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Tal es el caso de Marina quien  tiene  un kiosko en su casa, donde vende gaseosas, galletas, panes, frutas, asimismo alquila baños públicos a los viajeros de la zona de Corcona,  por la edad que tiene Marina se le es difícil caminar por lo que cuenta con la ayuda de un bastón,  pero a pesar de ese impedimento se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de ella y  seguir trabajando, 
El sueño de la señora es seguir ahorrando su dinero para terminar de techar y construir su casa, ya que en la actualidad su techo es de calamina.
 Con el anterior crédito la señora compro mercaderia y mejoró sus ventas, es por ello que la Marina confía en la institución EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD,  porque le ha  ayudado a mejorar su economía,  ahora forma parte de esta alcancía el crédito que necesita es para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas.,.
texts.en:
Alcom: Mi Amigo Jesus Marina M. C. is 73, widowed and has 5 independent children and participates regularly in the Mi Amigo Jesus community bank. The other seven members are hardworking people as shown when they get together to make payments. They strive every day to improve their families' quality of life. Such is the case with Marina who has a small shop in her home where she sells soda pop, cookies, bread and fruit. She also rents public bathrooms to the travelers in Corcona. Due to her age Marina has a hard time walking and does so with the help of a cane. Despite this obstacle she gives her best and keeps on working. Her dream is to save up some money to finish building and roofing her home, since currently she has a roof made of aluminum sheeting. With her previous loan she bought merchandise and improved her sales which is why Marina trusts EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, and since they helped her improve her income. Today she is part of the community bank she needs a loan to buy candy, cookies, soda pop etc.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy cookies and soda pop

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman L. M. is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Nyoman L. M. is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Asri Lestari (PK-10251).

Ni Nyoman L. M. is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Ni Nyoman L. M. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Nyoman L. M. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Nyoman L. M. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Nyoman L. M. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Nyoman L. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Pou Choem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pou C. was born in 1981 and is a mother of two children who are attending school. She and her husband, Mr. Pheap Mut, live in Pou village in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell; moreover, she is a pig breeder while her husband owns a plow machine.

Pou was selected to be the village’s bank president by the other thirteen members of the bank who will each use their portion of the loan in different ways to improve their families’ lives. Pou’s current problem is that she does not have enough rice seed to grow. So to improve production, Mrs. Pou C. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, gasoline and pig feed.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, gasoline and pig feed

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., 37, is a mother of six children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are enrolled in a local school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sam Oun Tet, is a construction worker. They live in Pou village in Takeo province. Sokhom is also the leader of a loan group selected by five members. Each member will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their current businesses.

Sokhom’s problem is that her field is ready to grow rice, but she does not have enough rice seed. So to improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy more rice seed and fertilizer and to rent a machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to rent a plow

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Central province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a doorman in a local secondary school, and earns 200,000 MNT per month.

Tungalag operates a shoe trading business at a rented stall in her town market. She started her business in early 2010, specializing in shoes and boots retailing. She has made progress with her business for such a short period of time, and has found much success. Today her earnings are stable and her husband continues to help with her business as well. Tungalag is focused on the future and is working hard to keep up with her fast growing customer base. She is a hard working and modest woman, who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more shoes and boots at wholesale prices and resell at retail for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and boots.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya Y. is 50 years old and lives with her two children in Central province of Mongolia in a ger - a traditional nomadic housing tent. She has lived in the town for twelve years. She is a handicapped woman who gets a 81,000 MNT pension every month.

Enhtuya operates a milk trading business at a local market in her town with the help of her children. She started her business in 1994 and has managed it by herself for the last few years. She has worked hard and today enjoys a stable business operation. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a car.

Enhtuya is a very hardworking businesswoman and she has many plans for the future. She hopes to continue to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. She says, "I would like to expand my business and create a more intensified cow farm". Enhtuya is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more hay and forage for her cows and store for upcoming winter usage.

loans.use: To purchase more hay and forage for her cows.

loans.name: Ishdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Ishdorj is 29 years old, and lives with his wife, 5 year old daughter, and 4 month old son, in his mother's house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city.

He owns a small car, and has been running a taxi business for five years. His wife looks after the kids. Since 2001, Ishdorj’s parents have been raising cows. Currently, they have 14 cows, and 6 of them are female. Every day they milk them and sell the milk in the local market. Ishdorj’s main goal is to continue and extend his parents' business.

He is a very hard working person. His taxi and farming businesses keep him busy all day long. The reason he is asking for this loan is he wants to buy some special breed cows which give more milk, and to improve the barn, and both of these uses will increase his business profit. He will also buy some feed for the cows.

loans.use: To buy some special breed cows and fix the barn.

loans.name: Mrs. Siv Ea Lay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who live in Pou village in Takeo province have selected Mrs. Siv Ea L. as their village bank president. She was born in 1947. All the village bank loan members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses.

Mrs. Siv Ea L. is a clothes washer in the local village, where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Khea Heng, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her washing business does not have enough water to use. So to improve her business, Mrs. Siv Ea L. is applying for a loan to buy a pump machine to use to support her business. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg C. is 36 years old and lives with her son in Central province of Mongolia in a rented apartment. Her son attends a local primary school.

Narantsetseg has been working as a notary - a person who is legally empowered to witness and certify the validity of documents - in her town since March, 2010 after arriving in Central province. She used to work as a solicitor and has gained a lot of knowledge and experience working in the legal sector. She was able to purchase a small car with her permanent earnings.

Narantsetseg hopes to continue and maintain her work successfully. She says, "I want to save enough money to support my children's education." She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a personal computer, printer and copier for her operation.

loans.use: To purchase personal computer, printer and copier for notary business.

loans.name: Mall

texts.en:
Mrs. Mall U., age 40, sells chickens at a large market some considerable distance from her village. By selling at market, she is able to earn a good profit in order to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Oll Eou (pictured here with his wife), is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell for a living. He is also a construction worker. 

Mrs. Mall U.'s primary problem is that she must transport her chickens to market on an old, unreliable, and uncomfortable motorcycle. To solve this difficulty, Mrs. Mall U. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle in order to replace her old one for the transportation of her chickens. 

She is the mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others attend school as well as helping their parents in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for transporting her chickens to market

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol L. is a 28 year old woman from the green farm place of Laua-an, Antique Province in the Philippines. She is married to a tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) driver, Phelim L., who is 35 years old. They are blessed with two children: the eldest child, Peejay, is 5 years old and in grade school; the youngest son, Philjune, is a 3 year old baby. The couple is working hard to raise their family and give her children a better living.

Sol joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner, in the Philippines to secure working capital to start a good livelihood. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in buying and selling vegetables, and later expanded the business with more vegetables. 

Now on her second loan, she has requested 9,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders from her. 

She dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her vegetables, fund the educational needs of her children until complete college, and have a successful business that can provide them with a good life that is far away from poverty.

loans.use: For additional working capital for her business.

loans.name: Tsedendamba

texts.en:
Tsedendamba C. is 63 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He and his wife are retired, however, they are still capable of managing their own small business.

In 1995, the couple began their business with a slight amount of working capital, and since then the two have made a lot of progress in the business. Now they sell the products at their own store.

All of his four children live separately. Tsedendamba is a very hardworking entrepreneur and has very good character. He is focused on operating his business sustainably. Tsedendamba is proud that all his children have already established businesses of their own, so Tsedendamba and his wife can operate their food retail business for themselves only. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his current business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Koem Sream

texts.en:
In Doung Khpos village, Takeo province, lives a person named Mrs. Koem Sream L., who was born in 1979. She is a pig breeder; moreover, she is a rice-wine maker who can earn a large profit to support her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Ra Im, is a farmer who owns a 1.7-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support his famiL.. 

Her problem is that she does not have a motorcycle for transportation. So to improve this problem, Mrs. Koem Sream L. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to use to support her current businesses. 

She is the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school, while the youngest one is 5 years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Tsonhio

texts.en:
Tsonhio M. is a 51-year-old widower who lives with his three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger -- a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Besides operating a dairy products trade business, Tsonhio manages a small food shop near his home. He sells a variety of food products to customers in his neighborhood. Tsonhio started his business in 2000. He also grows crops on a 2-hectare plot of land and produces flour for selling. 

Tsonhio has found success in his operations and his shop is well established in his community. As a single father, he is a very caring person who is responsible for his children's future. Tsonhio has gained much business experience over the years and is currently planning to expand his business by managing a meat retailing business as well. He is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more dairy products and meat in order to expand his business line.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz G. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 27 years old. Beatriz is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed lives in a small city called Borewala, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She is a housewife and spends all of her time in her home to do her household responsibilities. She lives in a two-room brick house and has no child yet.

Her husband runs a small hotel (restaurant) in the nearby market where he sells Punjabi food such as Nan kabab and Biryani and serves tea as well. His hotel is the busiest one in the market because he has been running it for the last 16 years. He has not only earned good income but also a good reputation among his customers. He serves his customers quality food and takes care of them with good a seating arrangement and excellent service, serving food without any delay.  

Fatima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy required items such as spices, cooking oil, rice and potatoes in larger quantity for his hotel. 

Fatima is hopeful that her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business and increase his income. She is sure that with this investment, his business conditions will become better and more customers will come to his hotel and enjoy quality food. 

She is in her second loan cycle and is a very responsible loan user of Asasah. In the previous year of loan experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: Purchase required items for hotel (restaurant) business

loans.name: Gulibada

texts.en: Gulibada R. is 42 years old and lives with her four children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her younger child attends a local middle school, and the elder two children are students. Gulibada operates a needlework business where she sews many different household products. She started her business in 2004 after she had worked as a quality examiner for a local wool manufacturer until she became redundant. Since Gulibada has started her own business, her quality of life has been improved noticeably. She says, “My goal is to expand my business and create workplaces for my children so I can help them improve their own lives.” Gulibada is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to import needlework materials from nearby Tashkent, a border city of China.

loans.use: To import needlework materials

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin C. (in the photo), is 41 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Khim Sean, who is 40 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are in school.

Mrs. Sophoin has been a silk weaver for 26 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer; he grows green beans and bitter gourds on his farmland in the village. He does not have enough capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm, and so Sophoin is requesting her first loan of 400 USD to provide her husband with capital.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal P. (in the photo), is 44 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Nun, 43 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have two sons who are attending school.

Sophal and his wife buy fish from Prek Phnao market, located on other side of the Mekong River and transport it to sell in their village and nearby villages. Their motorbike is old and breaks down often, which costs them a lot of money for repairs. They cannot manage their income to support their family, therefore, Sophal is asking for his first loan of $300 to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase new motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran helps to support her family through her work as a seamstress. She receives orders from her neighbors and relatives, and earns between 100 and 150 PKRs for each dress she makes. This allows her to pay for her family's utility expenses.
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah in order to help her husband, a private entrepreneur with a fruit-vending cart business. He visits different streets of the city with his cart, selling his wares. With this loan, he will buy seasonal fruits in bulk. Manzooran is hopeful that by adding more seasonal fruits to his cart, her husband will be able to increase his income and, as a result, improve the family's standard of living.
  
Manzooran is in her fourth loan cycle and is a very responsible Asasah borrower. She has paid all her installments on time and has never missed any meetings.

Manzooran lives in the city of Borewala, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. For the past 30 years, she has lived in a three-room brick house with her husband and their two sons, who for financial reasons were unable to complete their educations and help to support the family financially. Her eldest son is a street hawker who sells edible items such as nimko and chips, and the younger son works in the manufacture of furniture.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits for sale

loans.name: Amanbek

texts.en:
Amanbek S., age 23, operates a transportation business. He began his business in 2007 with a Russian brand car, and he drives between Hosh Agash, a Russian border region, and Ulgii, the center town of Bayan-Ulgiy, twice a week, transporting up to six passengers. He charges transportation fees of 15,000 MNT per passenger. With his business earnings, Amanbek has been able to afford to build a house for himself and his wife. Amanbek hopes to see his business expand and develop over time. 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of products in Russia and to re-sell these at retail prices. Primarily, he hopes to be able to afford to purchase a bus for his business. He also needs to devote some of the loan money to his brother's medical expenses in Khazakhstan. 	

Amanbek lives with his wife and parents in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger,' which is a traditional nomadic housing tent. He and his wife were married a year ago and his parents are retired.

loans.use: To purchase a bus for his transportation business

loans.name: Monaliza's Group

texts.en:
Monaliza V., age 38, is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loans of her fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

To make a living, Monaliza runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Monaliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Monaliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Monaliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Monaliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Monaliza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

Monaliza is married and has two school-aged children. The family lives in the village of Dicoyong. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S., age 48, is a silk fabric seller. Her husband, Mr. Soeurn Kong (pictured here with his wife), is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support the family. The family lives in Doung Khpos village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Ny S.'s problem is that the soil in her husband’s rice field has become infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Ny Sen is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan she plans to buy a number of piglets and pig food in order to start a new beeding business. 

She is the mother of three children. One is an iron welder, one is employed in a private company, and the youngest attends school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as to buy piglets and pig food to start a breeding business

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth M. (pictured), age 42, and her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Hai, 43, have been married since 1989. They have two sons and four daughters. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers outside the city.

Sareth and her husband are vegetable farmers. The couple struggles with considerable transportation costs as they do not own their own transportation for commuting. For this reason, Sareth is asking for her first loan in the amount of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean M., age 23, owns and operates a general store. She is just getting started in her business and sells food and daily-use products in her village, Villa Concepcion in Cauayan City, Isabela. 

Jean joined ASKI this year in order to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jean from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena M., age 36, owns and operates a general store in the village of Calamagui, San Paublo, where she sells a variety of different products. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Filomena joined ASKI last year in order to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Filomena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Filomena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. Filomena and her husband have three school-aged children.  

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en: Mr. Edilberto G. is from the barangay (village or neighborhood) of Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years of age and married to Marosa G.. They were blessed with two children, both of whom are now working. To make a living, he operates a sari-sari (general) store and a little eatery business with his wife as his business partner. He is also receiving monthly support from one of his children, who is working abroad. He’s been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years already and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Just this year, Edilberto joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
