Betty N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Betty has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and clothes for herself.  In the future, Betty hopes to own a big shop.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Gladys Ene Nkalayiai

texts.en:
Gladys Ene Nkalayiai Punywa is 25 years old and she supports three members of her family.

She has been farming wheat for the last three years successfully, due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for the product in her area.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members of Kadet in her area of residence. This is her first loan, and she is planning to spend the twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for the growing wheat.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to  expand her wheat farming to large scale farming by hiring a bigger piece of land for wheat farming.

Her hopes and dreams are that she will become a large scale farmer, be able to educate her children, and attain financial independence.

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her target.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for her growing wheat

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta C. is a 42-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a fish vending business. She lives in San Vicente, Brgy. Poblacion, Daanbantayan, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. 

Antonietta is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Antonietta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Dorothy resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include house rent, electricity bills, and food.

Dorothy is a tailor in Lugala Masanafu Lubaga Division Kampala District, working on all types of clothes but mainly women's clothes. She has been in the tailoring business for six years. She buys clothing materials from Kiyembe shops in Kampala city where clothing materials are mostly sold.  She goes for shopping once a fortnight and uses public transport to and from shopping.  She sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and defaulters.

She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials and thread. She aspires to see her business grow big and to start making bridal wares.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and thread

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia lives with her family in Lahore which is famous for its history and culture. Lahore is the capital of Punjab province and the second largest city of Pakistan. 

She is 43 years old, the mother of five daughters and two sons. All of them are getting their education and studying in different classes. 

Aasia does embroidery work. She has contracts with different boutiques and women's ready-to-wear garment stores. She supplies the embroidered clothes to them and generates a good profit. 
 
Her husband does a private job, driving a van to pick up and drop off college students.  He started this business two years ago and it is going well. He purchased the van on installments. Aasia has applied for her 1st loan from Asasah for her husband. The loan will help her husband pay the remaining installments on his van. so it will become his own property and he will be free to use it. 

Aasia is very confident that taking out the loan will be proven to be a good decision for her family, which will benefit her husband and family in the long term.

loans.use: Pay off the remaining installments of a van

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza I. is a common law wife who lives in Prk. Lunas, Barangay Kawit, Medellin, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: General Store, Food Vending and Livestock Vending businesses. Her common law husband Serafio Mondejar, who is 53 years old, works as a electrician to earn his living.  She has six children who are between 18 and 33 years old. 

Esperanza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Esperanza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $360, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Esperanza I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Ruto

texts.en:
Ruto is 30 years old and married with one 6-year-old child. His child is currently attending school. Ruto is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and has employed one farmhand. His main products are milk and tea which he sells locally.

Ruto has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 20,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that with the extra income from the sale of milk he will be able to pay school fees for his child.

In the future, he would like to build a dairy unit for his dairy cows. He is happy with the work of Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of three children who are attending school. She has ten years of experience working as a farmer. She has been running her own farm since 2004. She uses plastic tents to grow her products. These tents also allow her to better monitor product quality as well as grow her products for more months of the year. She works independently in her business. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.en:
A. Abdullojon is 45 years old and married with two children. Currently Abdullojon does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family by trading. Abdullojon has been running his business for about fifteen years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of appliances. His business is the family's main source of income. 

As a rule Abdullojon travels to the neighboring town to purchase the goods he sells. Abdullojon is trying to have a wide range of goods of high quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today, Abdullojon is requesting a loan of $3000. This is the 6th time that he has asked for a loan through IMON. 

The loan money will be used to buy more appliances for his shop in order to increase the range of his inventory. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new appliances to increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been operating his mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley Kenya for ten years. His main products are tea and milk, which he sells to the local market. He depends on the income from his farming activities to provide for the needs of the family.

Paul is 32 years old. He is married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 6. Both children attend school.

Paul has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

In future, he would like to have a dairy cow, which can produce at least 20 litres of milk daily. He would like to request Juhudi to help him acquire good quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kenja

texts.en:
N. Kenja is 43 years old. He and his wife, who is currently in labor migration in Russia, are raising 3 wonderful kids. For more than 12 years Kenja has been repairing furniture to earn a living. At the same time, he is involved in the production of office furniture for sale. For these years, Kenja became the real expert in his business. Since he has a lot of clients, the business is very successful and brings astable and significant income, allowing Kenja to improve the living conditions of his family. Today he requests $1200 US Dollars towards purchasing planks, glue, nails, screws and the lathe for production and repair of the furniture. Kenja would like to thank and assure everyone supporting him that he will pay the loan on time.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of planks, glue, nails, screws and the lathe for production and repair of furniture.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan in a three-roomed house with her family. She is a 45 year old married lady who has three sons and three daughters. All of the children are getting an education, except the eldest one who left his education after 8th and started to work in an automobile workshop.

Shagufta herself is illiterate, but she knows the importance of education very well. She wants her children to complete their education and for that purpose, she works very hard. She makes and sells artificial flowers sets. She has business contacts with different gift shop owners and supplies them with flowers on order. She also makes decoration pieces from Plaster of Paris. She is very skillful in her art. Her husband does a private job on a monthly wage. 

Shagufta has applied for a loan from Asasah to improve her artificial flower-making business. With the loan money she will buy raw material such as artificial flower petals, plastic sticks in bulk to make flowers in larger quantity and supply them to make a larger income. She hopes that this investment will put a positive impact on her business and she will be able to get good results from it. 

She is in her 3rd loan cycle and is a very responsible loan user of Asasah. She has maintained good credit behavior in the previous two years of loan experience and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for her making artificial flowers business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is an active member and treasurer of Kelelwa Socham Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She has been practising mixed farming for 5 years and has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces pinneapples, which she sells to the local market.

Agnes is 32 years old and a single mother of 2 children, ages 5 and 8. Both children attend school.

Agnes has requested this loan, from Juhudi Kilimo, of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge has been lack of good market and the unpredictable prices in the market.

In future, she would like to purchase a car for transport. She is grateful to Juhudi for the support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mrs. Nem Trok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village loan group in Boeng village, Takeo province, consists of nineteen people. They have selected Mrs. Nem T., who was born in 1949, as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose so as to improve their business in the current year.

Mrs. Nem T. is a Khmer noodle seller in her village where she earns a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sinoeurn Neang, is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land that he uses to cultivate rice, not to sell but to support his family.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they earn less income than needed. So, to make more money and improve this condition, Mrs. Nem T. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

Mrs. Nem T. is the mother of two children who are both seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en:
Philiph is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 20 years and has employed three people from his community. His farm produces tea and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Philiph has requested this loan, from Juhudi Kilimo, of 30,000 Kenyan Shilliings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children. His biggest challenge has been lack of good markets and poor prices for his products.

Philiph is 45 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 5 and 17. All of the children attend school.

In five years time, he hopes to acquire two pure breed dairy cows. He says that Juhudi loans have improved the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold K. is 43 years old and lives with his younger brother in Uvs province, a western part of Mongolia, in their own ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent. The younger brother of Ganbold manages a small ice-cream manufacture in his town. Ganbold opeartes a successful transportation service using his own middle-sized van. He began his business in 1996, and has gained much experience in driving and providing transport services to his passengers. His transportation service is also specialized by loading construction materials such as wood, stone and soil as well as transporting out the rubbish, from which he earns 200,000 MNT, on average, per month. Ganbold and his brother are now expanding their business by producing a variety of ice cream at a rented workplace in the town. For the future, he wishes to continue expanding his business as well as creating his own workplace. Ganbold is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase parts and tires for his van so that he can keep it in good running condition.

loans.use: To purchase parts and tires.

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon has been practising mixed farming, for the past 6 years, in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has employed one farmhand. His main products are milk and tea, which he sells locally. He is a happy farmer since he has been able to provide for his needs with the income from his farming activities.

Hesbon has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He, however, faces the challenge of poor markets for his products. He would like to have a pure breed of animals in the future.

Hesbon is 27 years old and single. He is grateful to Juhudi for the good work.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Olmakhon

texts.en:
Olmakhon comes from a humble family who worked very hard to get her ahead in life. She is 44 years old, married and has three children. For 15 years already Olmakhon has dedicated herself to raising and selling cattle, a job that brings economic stability to her family. Her family is the reason for working and struggling day in and day out. Her husband helps her with the business. She’s asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to invest in her business, that will allow her to save enough money in order to improve her livingconditions. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards purchasing cattle for expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tavakkal

texts.en:
Tavakkal is 44 years old and he is the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. Tavakkal is a hard working person and he has been providing taxi services for more than 3 years. The most important goal to him is for his children to finish school so that they may have a bright future. Tavakkal wishes to keep his taxi business growing. For the expansion of this taxi business, he needs to have his working tools in good working order. Tavakkal needs to buy spare parts to improve the condition of his taxi and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work, Tavakkal has been able to stabilize his quality of life.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Towards purchasing spare parts for repairing his car.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya lives in the historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. 
Suraiya lives in a three room brick house with her family near cantt area. She is a 34 year old lady and mother of two sons: fifteen year old Bilawal, who reads in the 10th standard and eleven year old Salman who is studying in 3rd standard. Her husband sells ready-made garments on order and supplies them to Lahore’s famous shopping malls like PACE & LIBERTY etc. 

Suraiya lives in a combined family system where her brother in law also lives. He works in a factory on a monthly wage. Suraiya makes decoration pieces on order and supplies them to different gift shops and decoration stores. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. The loan amount will help him to buy ready-made garments in large quantities and to fulfill larger orders on time. She is very hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business by making an investment in his business. He has 18 years of experience in this field and knows the ups and downs very well. 

Suraiya is a new loan user of Asasah. She has not previously borrowed from any MFI ever and wants to build a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: Towards the purchase of ready-made garments to fulfill larger orders on time.

loans.name: Gordiano

texts.en:
Hard working B. Gordiano has, over years, been operating a cattle fattening farm in Mpundo, Ibanda. He sells cows to earn a living, from the periodic markets that take place around the area in western Uganda. In this business he directly purchases the livestock and then raises them for some time on his farm. When the livestock is ready for market, he supplies to butchers, hotels and other customers in the periodic market. 

His main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable price on the market and low capital input. With hard work and efficient customer care skills, he has managed to keep his business going for over 10 years. In a month, he makes profits in the neighborhood of 250,000 Ugandan shillings. 

His future plans are to fully expand the transactions and to do farm restocking, which will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s education requirements. With this loan, he anticipates great strides in achieving this dream and restocking more cattle heads for sale.

loans.use: Towards purchase of more cattle and farm restocking.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn Q. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business preparing and selling snacks to the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she has for sale. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are between the ages of 12 and 21. Four of the children are currently in school.

David has been farming for the last 30 years in the town of Nyamira in Western Kenya. He has employed two people from his community. His farm produces milk, tea, beans and tomatoes, which he sells locally. He also earns income from his lumber business.

David has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will assist him in paying school fees for his children and to improve the living standards of his family. Her biggest challenge has been pests and diseases which affect his crops and animals.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been practising mixed farming for fifteen years in the town of Nyamira in Western Kenya. He has employed one farmhand. He sells his milk, tea, maize and beans locally. He also earns income from his lumber business.

Andrew is 54 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are now between the ages of 19 and 38. Five of the children are currently attending school.

Andrew has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from this loan will help him to buy fertilizers, that will increase his production, and to pay the school fees for his children.

His biggest challenges have been animal diseases, lack of enough animal feed and fertilizers. He hopes to purchase more land and at least 7 dairy cows in the future. He says that Juhudi has the potential of improving the lives of people from the grassroots.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sandalhan

texts.en:
Sandalhan U. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia in a ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent. Two of her children are students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Sandalhan works as a cleaner in Tirlik- the biggest market of the province. Her husband manages his clothing retailing business at the same market. Their net income reaches 320,000 per month. The two sell a variety of different clothing items. They began their business in 2006 with the loan of 500,000 MNT. This product expansion has proven to be a very profitable decision in that they were enabled to pay their children's tuition fees. 

Sandalhan is a modest and hardworking woman. For the future, she says, "My husband and I are working for our children and having them become good people in the future. We hope to see one day their care after graduating the universities". Sandalhan is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items from Tashkent- a border city of China, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the city of San Jose Santiago. She is 54 years old. Carmelita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business selling watermelon. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people located I. Boeng village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. L. S., who was born I. 1959, as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan I. a different way to support their business I. the current year.

Mrs. L. S. owns a general store I. the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her famiL.. She is also a chicken breeder.

Since both her businesses are going well, Mrs. L. S. wants to expand them. So, to achieve this goal, she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to sell and more chickens to breed.

Mrs. L. S. is a widow with six children, three of whom are seamstresses I. a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell and chickens to breed

loans.name: Kossiwa Mélanie

texts.fr: V. Kossiwa Mélanie est née en 1966 à Grand-Popo au Bénin. Mariée à ATIOGBE Emile, Mélanie est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Atrokpocodji dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Mélanie partage avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Mélanie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Mélanie vend du poisson frit et divers condiments de sauce (piments, oignons, tomates fraiches, épices, etc.) à son domicile. Mélanie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Comè au Mono. C'est la première fois que Mélanie sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kossiwa Melanie V. was born in 1966 in Grand-Popo, Benin. Married to Emile ATIOGBE, Melanie is the mother of three children, all in school. In addition to their own children, the couple has another child in their care. They all live together in the neighborhood of Atrokpocodji, in the Abomey Calavi commune. Melanie and her husband provide together for the needs of the family. Melanie did not attend school. In order to support herself and her children, Melanie sells fried fish and various sauce condiments (peppers, onions, fresh tomatoes, spices, etc.) from her home. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and also in Comè, located in Mono. This is Melanie’s first time seeking a loan from ALIDé to strengthen her business and increase her customer base.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four baskets of tomatoes, two baskets of peppers, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a young farmer from the town of Nyamira, in Western Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for four years. His main products are milk, maize and beans, which he sells locally. He is also a carpenter and makes an income of at least 6,000 Kenyan Shillings per month.

Peter has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from the sale of milk will help him to pay school fees for his children and to buy fertilizers and pesticides for better production.

Peter is 23 years old and married. He says that in five years time, he would like to buy more cows that will increase his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hairhan

texts.en: Hairhan H. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgiy Province, in Western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Since 2000, Hairhan has been running a special order home furnishing making business with the help of his elder son. After several years of sustainable business, Hairhan succeeded in creating his own workshop where he produces the quality wooden products that he supplies his customers with. He is well known for his products among his clients and customers in his town and in that length of time Hairhan has gained a lot of experience and knowledge. Hairhan says, “My dream is to pass my skills on to my elder son which would be his income source for his further life.” He is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 in order to purchase a large amount wood and other materials used for producing more doors and windows.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount wood

loans.name: Aaster

texts.en:
Aaster Perveen lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the capital city of Punjab Province. It is also known for its history, gardens, culture, and food.

Aaster lives in Nishat Colony which is near the Cantt area. She is 42 years old, and married to I. G., who is an electrician by profession. He not only does electrical repair work but also operates a shop in the market where he sells electrical supplies to his customers. His business is doing very well and he earns a good income every month.

Aaster lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and five children: three girls and two boys. All of them are getting their education. The two eldest children have completed their school education and are now studying in college, while the other three are still in school and studying in the 9th, 4th, and 2nd standard, respectively.

Over the years Aaster has proved herself to be a great mother and housewife, who not only takes care of her children very well, but has also made her house into a home with her good management skills. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery for her neighboring clients. She gets regular orders due to her reputation of as an expert dress embroiderer.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, who wants to expand his electricity business by putting more electric supplies, such as tube-lights, wires, and switches etc. to his shop. He also has a plan to hire an electrician to provide electrical repair services to his customers on a timely basis because sometimes he can’t handle emergencies alone.

Aaster is a regular loan user of Asasah. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has maintained a good credit history and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase electrical supplies for resale

loans.name: Muminiso

texts.en:
Muminiso B. is 39 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Muminiso is the market vendor. For the last 14 years she has been selling cottonseed oil in the local market. Her daughter helps Muminiso with the business. In the traditional Tajik cuisine the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil. Especially our national dish “Oshi palov” needs a lot of cottonseed oil in order to be delicious. So the goods that Muminiso is selling are of popular demand among the population. Today Muminiso is planning to increase her business. For this reason she requests 6500 Somoni. The loan will be used to purchase cottonseed oil in order to increase the range of goods for sale. Muminiso is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing cottonseed oil in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zinatmo

texts.en:
Zinatmo N. is 48 years old and is married. She and her husband live in their own house, with the basic necessities. They have three children. Zinatmo has been the owner of a small general store for about 17 years. She sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as: rice, flour, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets, and etc. Zinatmo runs her business from her home, and her children help her. The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. Larger goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help her family. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Sanabarhan

texts.en:
Sanabarhan C. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Sanabarhan is 42 years old and married. She has raised four daughters and a son. Two older daughters help their mom to grow rice, and the other children study at school. Sanabarhan has been growing rice for thirteen years, while her husband works as a taxi driver to earn money. Selling part of her rice harvest, Sanabarhan makes 6000 KGS per month. The profit made it possible for her to improve the living conditions of her family, repair the house, and save money to purchase a vehicle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase 1.5 tons of mineral fertilizers for growing the rice. In the near future Sanabarhan plans to purchase some land, expand her business, and save money to contribute to her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Imamidin

texts.en:
Imamidin M. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. He is 40 and married. He has three sons and two daughters. His oldest son works in a factory, his older daughter studies at a university, and the other children are at school. Three years ago with an initial investment of 3000 KGS, Imamidin and his wife began selling clothes at the market. They make 5000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, Imamidin wants to purchase school uniforms, because the demand for them will be high in autumn when the school season begins. In the future he plans to open a sewing workshop and build a store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a member of the Embande Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years. His farm produces maize, milk, tea, beans and sorghum, which he sells to the local market. He is also a driver with a Public Service Vehicle.

Jeremiah has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says that the income derived from this loan will improve the living standards of the family and pay school fees for his children. However, he faces the challenge of animal diseases.

Jeremiah is 48 years old. He is married and has six children who are between the ages of 1 and 15. Four of the children are attending school. 

Jeremiah would like to buy more agricultural land in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tilla

texts.en:
Tilla E. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 63 and married. She has a son who is 31, married and lives separately with his family. Tilla and her husband are retired; they own 1.3 hectares of land and grow rice and tobacco to make money. They have been involved in farming since 1995, when the collective farms broke up. Tilla earns 4,600 KGS per month selling tobacco and part of the harvest. This profit made it possible for her to save money to purchase a vehicle and cows to increase the number of cattle. With money received from this loan, Tilla wants to purchase 1.5 tons of mineral fertilizers which are needed for farming. In the future, she plans to build a shed for cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Buularhan

texts.en:
Buularhan S. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 40 and married. She has three daughters and a son; the older daughter studies at university and the other children are at school. When the collective farms broke up in 1995, Buularhan and her husband were given 1.7 hectares of land, so they have been growing rice and tobacco for fifteen years. Buularhan earns 5,000 KGS per month selling part of the harvest. This profit made it possible for her to save money to purchase cattle for breeding. Buularhan wants to use the money received from this loan to purchase fertilizers for growing tobacco and to cover family expenses. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cattle, start selling dairy products and save money to contribute to her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul E. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39 and divorced. She has raised two sons; the older son went to work in Russia and the second helps his mom with housework. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Jumagul started to grow rice and is involved in retail sales of rice, earning 5,000 KGS per month. This profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase cattle for breeding.  With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing rice and to purchase 200 kg of rice in the village in order to resell it on the market at a higher price.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and 200 kg of rice

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif K. is 52 years old. He is married with four children. He and his family live in the Spitamen region. Sharif owns a minivan and offers transportation services. His business is the main source of income for the family. At the same time, he raises cattle and sells them in the market. Sharif has been in this business for 20 years and has gained rich experience in driving. Now Sharif is planning to repair some parts of his car and also purchase young cattle. That’s why he requested a loan of 6,000 Somoni. loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for his minivan and buying cattle

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years. His farm produces maize, beans, tea and milk, which he sells locally. He is also employed as a teacher. His biggest challenges in farming have been diseases and pests that attack his crops and animals, an inadequate market and high competition.

Evans is 30 years old. He is married with three children who are now between the ages of 2 and 10. Two of the children are attending school.

Evans has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and purchase manure for his crops. He says that he will also be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption.

He plans to purchase more agricultural land and a truck to supply his produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Latifa

texts.ru:
Latifa G. 40 let. Latifa yavlyayetsya IDP pesonom, Ona pereselenec iz okkupirovannix teritoriya AZerbaydjana Djabrail, seychas ona projivayet v Absheron regione.

Latifa uje 7 let kak rabotayet partnixoy. Etomu biznesu nauchila yeyo sosedka kotoraya toje partnixa i po yeyo sovetu ona nachala rabotat. Latifa seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi  kupit novuyu shveynuyu mashinu yeyo mashina isportilas i ona ne mojet rabotat a zakazov mnoqo ,potmu chto ona ochen okkuratno shyot i ochen lubit svoyu rabotu.
texts.en:
Latifa G. is 40 years old. Latifa is an internally displaced person (IDP). She relocated from the occupied territory Azerbaydjana Djabrail, and now lives in the Absheron region. Latifa has been working for seven years as a seamstress. She learned this line of work from her neighbor who is also a seamstress and with her advice she began to work. Latifa now needs a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine. Her old machine is broken and she is not able to work many orders , because she sews very accurately and loves her work very much.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To but a new sewing machine

loans.name: Muhitdin

texts.en: Muhitdin K., since he was very young, has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock. He is married and a father with the necessity of supporting his children who no longer need his help to complete their studies. His children help him with the business. Muhitdin is faced with the need is to purchase calves. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Muhitdin comes to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit to purchase them and in this way continue to maintain his dear home. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old. He is married with one child, aged 5 years. His child is currently attending school.

Francis has been been practicing mixed farming for four years in the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. His main products are maize, tea, sorghum and milk, which he sells locally.

Francis has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will go toward the education of his son. In five years time, he plans to buy t3 acres of land and own at least four dairy cows and a shop. 

His biggest challenge has been the fluctuation in market prices. He says that his biggest issue is lack of a market and he hopes that Juhudi will enhance it somehow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela lives in a historic city called Lahore, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is also known as the heart of Pakistan. She has given birth to three children: two daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter studies in 10th standard and her youngest daughter is in 5th standard, while her son reads in 9th standard.
 
A very talented lady, Shakeela is involved in a boutique business where she specifically prepares bridal dresses. Bridal dresses have a high demand, particularly in marriage season, and a very good profit potential.

She purchases cloth and bridal material from Faisalabad, which is famous for its textile industry, and books the orders from different boutiques. She has hired some workers who do the stitching work for her. 

Her husband lives abroad; he works there and sends money every month for the financial survival of his family here. 

Shakeela has applied for a loan from Asasah for her business. With the loan amount, she will buy material such as cloth, beads and tassels in bulk and improve her business condition. She will also hire another worker, which will help her in fulfilling larger orders on time.  

She is very optimistic that she will be able to successfully upgrade her business and increase her income with the help of this loan investment. She has five years of experience in this field and she is very confident about her success. She is a second year loan user of Asasah. In her first year loan, she paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: Purchase embroidered material for preparing bridal dresses for her boutique business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac T. is a 37-year-old married father of six boisterous schoolchildren. To shoulder his responsibility of providing for them, he has been operating a general merchandise retail shop over the course of the last two months in the Nyakabungo Trading Centre, Rukungiri District. His business has not been without setbacks since he began; he has had to bear myriad challenges, such as the lack of steady income inflows. In a way, however, his business has remained active. This principally he attributes to the good working chord he has struck with his clientele and the produce sales business that he has always had. 

In a month, Isaac says he makes more than 220,000 Ugandan shillings; a figure he admits will not substantively make his business see the light of day in the near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to lend countenance to his business so that he is able to do restocking for his shop.

loans.use: Purchase more stock into the business for resale

loans.name: Turdikul

texts.en:
U. Turdikul is a successful entrepreneur, father and dedicated husband. He has four children who are giving him the strength to work hard. Turdikul began a small grocery store many years ago with a little capital he saved. He was assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Turdikul is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.       
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
