Basereke Hirally’s philosophy has always been never to let negative thinkers pull her down to their level. This has been to her advantage for the last year as she has operated her non-governmental child care organization. What spawned the idea of taking care of orphaned and disadvantaged children was their pathetic plight. Before she began this organization, she had stumbled upon many people who had tried to dissuade her from lending a hand in this cause. 

She has been lauded for her public spirited and socially responsible nature on several occasions. Hirally also makes chairs and has rentals from which she makes profits amounting to as much as 250,000 shillings, and the profits help in taking care of her children. Hillary is a divorced mother of six children. With this loan she wants to buy materials to finish up the office block which will also be the property of her organization.

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish up the office block of her child care organization

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K. is currently in the business of selling bread, ice cream and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Alice is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has two children, both of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is very determined and cool, and trades in used clothing and food items.  Her stall is located at Savage Square Makeni, and she has ten years experience in business. She is married to a trader and they have two children. She initially accessed funds from her husband to kick start her business.

She needs a loan to buy more used clothing and food items, and hopes to use her proceeds to educate her children and construct a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and food items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth K., age 29 and unmarried, sells school supplies such as exercise books, pens, pencils, and sharpeners at her shop. She is requesting a loan so that she can expand her offerings to include textbooks, boxes of chalk, markers, and similar items.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop by stocking more scholastic materials like mathematical instruments.

loans.use: To stock textbooks, boxes of chalk, markers, and other such supplies in her store

loans.name: Mutai Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
M. Sulaiman, age 50, is the head of this group loan. He has a milk and charcoal sales business in Jinja. He is a true entrepreneur and has tried his hand at several kinds of businesses over the years, including firewood sales and animal husbandry. He offers his wares to both lower- and middle-class people in the area, and this allows him to bring in 200,000 shillings a month from his business. He sells from his home and also offers delivery services. 

With this loan he wants to buy more bags of charcoal and milk preserving containers.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal and milk preserving containers

loans.name: Sabena

texts.en: Sabena O., age 51, offers medications for sale at the local medical clinic. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more drugs and other medical necessities like bandages for sale. Sabena is a widow and has eight children, three of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to employ a doctor for minor surgery.

loans.use: To stock more dugs and other medical necessities like bandages for sale

loans.name: Friend Forever Group

texts.en:
Turker D. (pictured holding the sign) is the leader of this group of five borrowers. The group is called Friend Forever. 

Turker is 32 years old and describes himself as an earnest man. He and his wife have six children whose ages range from two to 17 years old. He also cares for one sibling. He himself was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 10 years, he has been selling cooking oil, soap, candles, and toothpaste in Thinkers’ Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. His goal is to improve his business and continue to be financially able to assure the education of his children.

He plans to use his portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollars group loan (his portion is 6,000 Liberian dollars) to buy more cooking oil, soap, candles and toothpaste for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, soap, candles, and toothpaste for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice J., age 29, sells bedsheets, trousers, and dresses at her small shop. She would like to expand her offerings to include earrings and necklaces, and she is requesting a loan for that purpose. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine.  

Alice's husband is a builder. They have one child who is as yet too young to attend school.

loans.use: To buy and stock earrings and necklaces for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia K., age 30, sells charcoal from her home. She is requesting a loan in order to be able to stock more bags of charcoal. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she will be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos vive en la localidad de el Torno, Barrio 6 de Mayo,  domicilio de sus padres, distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa cruz, su actividad es el servicio de transporte de persona, desde el Torno a la ciudad de Santa cruz, es soltero en busca  de formar un hogar solido económicamente, por tal motivo trabaja desde su corta edad, hoy en día tiene un lote de terreno donde piensa construir su casa; el destino del crédito es para comprar de llantas y realizarle una reparación total a su vehículo y así brindarle un buen servicio a sus usuarios, se siente agradecido con la institución porque fue la primera que le abrió las puertas para financiamiento de un vehículo  para realizar transporte de pasajeros(taxi) urbano y así esta creciendo en su economía.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos lives in the town of el Torno, Barrio 6 de Mayo, in his parents' home, 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz. He works in the transportation sector taking people from el Torno to the city of Santa Cruz. He is single and is looking to make an financially sound home. It is for this reason that he is working at such a young age. Currently he has a plot of land where he plans on building his house. He wants to use this loan to buy wheels and to carry out a full repair of his vehicle in order to provide a good service to his customers. He is thankful for this financial institution because this was the first time he opened the doors for financing for his urban taxi service and because of it he is increasing his savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheels and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam sells charcoal in Owino market seven days a week. She uses public transport to and from home but at times she must walk to her business when she is unable to raise enough money for transport. Prior to starting her charcoal business, she sold second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her primary business challenge is the transportation of bags of charcoal from Ndeeba to her stall in Owino market. She chose to join MCDT because they offered timely loans.

Mariam's husband is a radio mechanic. They have three children, all of whom attend school. She aspires toward educating her children up to university level so they can eventually find good jobs and have higher standards of living. The family lives in a rented one-roomed house in Najjanankumbi along the Entebbe road in the Lubaga division of Kampala District. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kabowa Mixed Farmers Group - Jinja

texts.en:
Bashiri B. has been in a commercial motorcycle business for six years. He has relied on profits from this business to shoulder most of his family’s responsibilities. On the basis of that, he has no regrets on why he began this business. As of now, he is only looking at ways of getting or buying more motorcycles, which he envisions will bring him more profits. 

With this loan, Bashiri, who is a single father of six, is optimistic his dreams will come to pass. With more motorcycles, he says he will be able to add onto the 100,000 shillings he makes in a week with just one bike. He says that before this business, he was a security guard and it is because of his hard work and determination that he is where he is right now.

loans.use: The purchase of an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil, more bags of rice and pepper

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos vive en la localidad de el Torno, Barrio Libertad, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, distante a 39 km, su actividad es el transporte de pasajeros, también se dedica a la educación en colegios de la localidad, es profesor hace 10 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres, con una hermana, después de la muerte de sus padres, el se quedo administrando la casa y se encarga también de los gastos del hogar, el crédito solicitado es para comprar un motor para su motocicleta,  el es el que se quedo como padre de su hermanos, por tal motivo tiene que trabar duro para sacar adelante a su familia y así mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Señor Santos lives in the town of El Torno in the Libertad neighborhood, 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz. He works transporting passengers and has also been a teacher in the schools in his town for 10 years. He is single and lives in his parent's house with his sister. After his parents died, he stayed to manage the house and took over the household expenses. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a motor for his motorcycle. He is all that remains as a parent to his siblings. It is for this reason that he works hard to provide for his family and improve the quality of life for all of his loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor for his motorcycle

loans.name: Plumkor Group

texts.en:
Assatuma S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Plumkor Group. Assatuma is 39 years old, married and has five children who range from 11 to 21 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. She cares for five siblings.

For 15 years, she has been selling rice and cold water in Jorkpen Town Market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 40,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of cold water.

She describes herself as a jovial woman. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of cold water

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El Sr. Dionicio vive en la localidad de el Torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Barrio 27 de Mayo, esta casado y vive con su familia  tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, por tal motivo ella le ayuda en la economía de su hogar con la venta de pollo frito, en el mercado campesino; tienen su domicilio compartido con su Padres es decir una parte es dueño el y la  de otra su Padre, el destino del crédito es para comprar una motocicleta, y así tener mas ingreso y por ende  hacer estudiar a sus hijos; su actividad principal es el servicio de moto taxi en la zona urbana, perteneciente a la asociación de motos "19 de junio", en la época que no hay pasajeros el se dedica a la construcción civil (albañil); el se siente agradecido con la institución ya que es con la cual el comenzó a trabar financieramente.
texts.en:
Dionicio lives in the 27 de Mayo neighborhood of El Torno, a town located 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He’s married and lives with his family. He has 4 school aged children. For this reason, his wife helps him meet family expenses selling fried chicken in the farmers market. They share their home with his parents, in other words he owns part of it and his father owns the other part. The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle in order to have more income so that he can afford his children’s schooling. His main activity is providing urban mototaxi services; he belongs to a mototaxi association called “19 de junio.” During times of low passenger demand he works in construction as a bricklayer. He is grateful to the institution because it’s the one he stared to work with financially.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced with one daughter. She sells chicken meat at open markets in the Stryi area. Svetlana has been in this business for 12 years. When she started, she just had one location. Today, she's got three business locations, employs two people and has plans to develop this business further.

Svetlana would like to borrow 12,000 Grivnas to purchase more inventory in bulk. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory in bulk

loans.name: Ketty

texts.en:
Ketty is married with three children and all her children go to school; she also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a stall selling raw food at her home in Kanyanya Kawempe Division in  Kampala District.   She sells foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes, onions and tomatoes. She has been in this food business for seven years. 

Ketty  buys foodstuffs from Kalerwe market and uses public transport to and from Kalerwe. Ketty goes for shopping twice a week.  She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale, and works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and defaulters.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and getting enough profits to buy a plot of land.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital to boost her business. 

Ketty resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes and onions

loans.name: Miguel Wilfredo

texts.en:
Miguel Wilfredo N. V. is 26 years old. He is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has two children named Darcia and Maria, ages 4 and 2 years old. 

Miguel is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members of the group, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Miguel also works in the agricultural sector. He earns around $140 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Miguel plans to use the loan to grow cacao. Once he is able to sell his cacao, he will advance in agriculture. His dream is to own a house and a car. This year, he has struggled in agriculture due to the lack of fertilizer for his crops. 

In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball and indoor soccer. His favorite community tradition is the festival of San Francisco.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Rosa Natividad

texts.en:
Rosa Natividad N. R. is 50 years old. She is married and lives in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has three children, ages 30, 17, and 15. 

Rosa is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. The group consists of 15 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Rosa also works in agriculture and earns on average $160 per month. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy farm animals. Her dream is to have her own plot of land. She has struggled with many of her cattle dying due to the lack of food. 

In her free time, she likes to watch television and listen to music. Her favorite community tradition is the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: David Carlos

texts.es: El Sr David vive en la ciudad de la Paz, en la zona de Pasankeri sur, la casa donde vive fue heredado por los padres como terreno, en la actualidad tiene una construcción de dos plantas que fue fruto del  trabajo del cliente, tiene un  1 niño de 4 años de edad vive con su esposa la Sra.  Virginia  que apoya a don David en todas sus actividades impulsándolo en las malas y en las buenas. El Sr. Se dedica a la construcción de ataúdes para muertos, Cuenta con 10 años en este rubro mismo que fue adquirido como ayudante del tío durante su juventud. El crédito será utilizado para comprar una maquina cortadora de madera que el cliente la denomina cierra circular sin fin, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo, en la foto el Sr se encuentra en compañia de su esposa.
texts.en:
David lives in the Pasankeri Sur area of La Paz. Both the house he lives in and the lot it’s on were passed down to him from his parents. He currently has a two-story house that he got through his own efforts. He has a one-year-old son and lives with his wife, Virginia, who supports all David’s efforts inspiring him both in good times and bad. David manufactures coffins. He has been in this line of work for 10 years having learned the trade as a young man working as his uncle’s assistant. He will use the funds to buy a band saw that he calls a “never ending circular saw.” He is very grateful to the institution for the support. His wife is pictured with him in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a band saw.

loans.name: Irene Amarilis

texts.en:
Irene Amarilis S. N. is 25 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has three children, ages 6, 3, and 2 years old. 

Irene is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members of the group, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Irene also works in agriculture. She earns on average $150 per month. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Irene plans to use the loan to invest in the business of raising pigs. Her dream is to have her own plot of land and to own a car. Her business struggles when her animals occasionally die. 

In her free time, she likes to watch television and listen to music. Her favorite community tradition is the festival of San Francisco.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Dolores Imelda

texts.en:
Dolores Imelda S. G. is 41 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has six children, ages 12, 10, 8, 5, 3, and 1. 

Dolores is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. The are 15 members of the group, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Dolores works in agriculture, earning $150 monthly. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde. She plans to use the loan to buy cattle. She will be able to advance in her business through the growth of the cattle that she is raising. Her dream is to own a car and a house. 

In her free time, Dolores likes to rest and watch television. Her favorite community festival is the festivities around Christmastime.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.en: Madame Adjowoa D. sells 'pagnes', colorful wax-printed cloth that is worn and used by the majority of Togolese women. Madame D. has been selling 'pagnes', walking through the streets and carrying them on her head, since 1990. She has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more stock. This is her first time taking out a loan. Madame D. is a widow and she has one child.

loans.use: To purchase 'pagnes' to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava

loans.name: Edgar Estuardo

texts.en:
Edgar Estuardo M. H. is 38 years old. He lives in a common-law-marriage in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has six children, ages 12, 10, 8, 5, 3, and 1. 

Edgar is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members of the group. The majority of the members work in agriculture. 

Edgar works in agriculture. He earns around $140 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Edgar plans to use the loan to raise cattle. He hopes to move forward in his business as his cattle grow. His dream is to have a plot of land, a car, and a house. Sometimes his cattle die due to lack of food or disease. 

In his free time, he likes to listen to music and watch television. His favorite community festival is the festivities of Christmas.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca, cliente que vive en la ciudad D. la paz, en la Zona D. Villa San Antonio Alto es casa alquilada, no cuenta con hijos dependientes ya que todos sus  hijos son mayores y tienen su profesión. Vive con su esposo el Señor Melitón que tiene como actividad el servicio D. gastronomía cuenta con 14 años D. experiencia en el negocio   se menciona que el crédito será invertido en la compra D. chompas del desaguadero y soleras D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz que están D. oferta por la época, la Sra.  Es muy trabajadora, su esposo le ayuda en su actividad le acompaña en lo viajes,  y ambos se hacen compañía, la  Sra. Cuenta que su orgullo es haber sacado a todos sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
The client, Francisca, lives in the city of La Paz in the Villa San Antonio Alto area. She lives in a rented house, and she has no dependent children. All of her children are adults and have their professions. She lives with her husband, Melitón. His activity is food service, and he has 14 years of experience in the business. She mentions that the loan will be used to buy sweaters from Desaguardero and sleeveless tops, which are on special for the season, from Santa Cruz. She is a very hard-worker. Her husband accompanies her on the trips, and they keep each other company. She says that she is proud to have gotten all of her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters

loans.name: Olmedo Luis

texts.en:
Olmedo Luis M. P. is 65 years old. He is divorced and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has six children. 

Olmedo is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members of the group, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Olmedo also works in agriculture, earning on average $135 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

He plans to use the credit to build a house. His dream is to have a car and to start his own business. 

In his free time, he likes to watch television and listen to music. His favorite community tradition is the Chirstmas festivities.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Sirina

texts.en: Madame Sirina M. sells plastics, dishes, and other cooking utensils at her stall in the Adidogome Market in Lome. She also sells them by carrying them on her head while walking through the streets of her neighborhood. Madame M. has been engaged in this activity since 2000. She normally purchases her merchandise here in Lome, and this time she has asked for a loan of 400,000 CFA in order to help her make her purchases. She is 44 years old and married to a chauffeur. They have one child together.

loans.use: To purchase plastic dishes and other items

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a married with two children; neither of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a charcoal stall in Mengo Mackay selling charcoal.  She buys bags of charcoal from Natete market and so uses public transport to and from shopping. She plans to use this loan of 200000/= to buy more sacks of charcoal.   

Prima has been in  this business for six years. She sells to all people around the area but mainly retail. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and buying a delivery van.

Prima decided to join MCDT because of low interest charged.  She  resides in and rents  a house which has electricity and  piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food, rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Faithful Business Group

texts.en:
Jacob J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Business'. Jacob is 32 years old, married, and has two children, 5 and 9 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. He cares for one sibling.

For 10 years, he has been selling  dishes (breakable and plastic bowls) in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 53,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more dishes. He describes himself as an earnest man.

His goal is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more dishes ( breakable and plastic bowls)

loans.name: Wabulungu Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
38-year-old I. Betty is a nice lady. She often flashes smiles at her customers, like in the photo. Unwittingly, this has benefited her 5-year-old local brew sales business, even without her making this deduction. It’s not only Betty who is oblivious to this fact. Many other business people don’t know that certain small things like a smile for your customers does that trick of getting into their good graces.  

Betty is a mother of four and with 100,000 as profits; she has gotten into a steady but reliable stride. 100,000 shillings is small money by any standard in a fast-paced and rapidly expanding metropolis like Jinja. Betty was at first an agriculturist.  She feels she will be empowered by this loan to buy more molasses that she uses to make local brew.

loans.use: The purchase of more molasses to make more local brew

loans.name: 11Th Street United Brothers Group

texts.en:
K. S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called '11th Street United Brothers'. K. is 32 years old, married, and has one child who is two years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. For 2 years, he has been selling milk, butter, bread, rice, cooking oil, etc. on 11th Street, Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 56,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more milk, butter, bread, rice, cooking oil, etc. He describes himself as a jovial man.

His dream is to improve his business, build a house, and educate his child.

loans.use: To buy more milk, butter, bread, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for ten years. During this time she has obtained many repeat customers who come again and again to buy clothing from her.

There is a high demand for this type of goods, so Zoya is going to continue developing her business. She has got enough energy and enthusiasm for this. Zoya also hopes that two her sons will continue this business in future.

Zoya would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal clothing. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Kafunjo United Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard-working B. Ruth, married with seven children of her own to take care of, knows that she has her responsibility cut out for her. This reality has looked her in the face for the past 6 years as she goes about her trivial retail shop business selling general merchandise, especially for home use, that she does alongside her banana sales from Ibanda town. 

With her monthly earnings amounting to 160,000 Ugandan shillings, she has faced long odds in providing for all her family’s needs and principally catering for her children’s welfare as her husband seems not to be so productive. 

Ruth wants to improve on the status quo of her family with the acquisition of this loan as she wants to give this business an improved lease on life in terms of expansion. Restocking her shop with a vision of making it a wholesale business will make her earn more sales revenue and be able to pay up the education bills for her orphaned grandchildren.

loans.use: restocking with more sugar, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado),  tiene una tienda de vivieres en la parte delantera de su casa.  

Su esposo le ayuda en la tienda y tienen un hijos. Debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, ellos decidieron invertir sus ahorros hace 4 años y comprar víveres y legumbres para vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h45am hasta las 21h00pm. 

El quiere el préstamo para poder mejorar la casa cemento, blosques, pinturas y así ampliar la tienda, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y comprar mas mercadería para cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55 years old, lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil (suburban area bordered by a salt water stream). She has a general store on the front of her house. Her husband helps her with the store. They have one son. Due to their small income, four years ago they decided to invest their savings and purchase groceries and vegetables to sell to their acquaintances. Little by little their efforts made it possible for them to open a small store on the front of their house. She works from 6:45am to 9pm. She requests the loan to improve their home (cement, blocks and paint) and so be able to increase the size of the store. In the future, she want to finish her house and purchase more inventory to meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, blocks, paint

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more lappas (a traditional dress for woman), milk, and sugar

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: El señor Rudy  es un cliente que ya saco dos secuencias su crédito en la institución y demostró responsabilidad, es un cliente con buena actitud, el es de profesión odontólogo tiene su consultorio en la ciudad de el alto específicamente en la zona 16 de julio, el trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus colegas de la universidad así le sale mas barato el pago del local de su consultorio, el cliente conto con la gran ayuda de su hermana que le ayudo mucho par que el estudie como también sus padres, en la compra de la silla quirúrgica como también sus instrumentos el financiamiento lo realizo con la ayuda de su hermana y también la de sus padres como también al sacar crédito en emprender para compra de material para las curaciones , el actualmente es soltero pero quiere en un futuro forma una gran familia, el destino del crédito es la compra de instrumentos quirúrgicos para su consultorio.
texts.en:
El señor Rudy handled his two prior loans responsibly. He is a customer with a positive attitude. He is a dentist and has his office on the top floor in the "16 de Julio" zone. He works with one of his colleagues from the university; this helps reduce office expenses. The customer received a great deal of support from his sister and his parents when he was in school and also with the purchase of his surgical chair and instruments. His family also helped him obtain loans in order to commence purchasing dental supplies. He is currently single but wishes to have a large family. This loan will be used to buy dental instruments and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dental supplies

loans.name: Evening Light Group

texts.en:
Joel F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Evening Light. Joel is 34 years old, single and has one child who is 6 years old.  He is currently in college. 

Joel has been selling used clothes in Fiamah Market in Monrovia, Liberia for five years.  He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 43,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes.  He describes himself as a hard-working man.  His goal is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Ismelda Esther

texts.es: Ismelda Esther R. R. de 25 años tiene un tramo en el mercado Oriental de la ciudad de Managua en el cual vende toallas, cortinas, ropa de camas, etc. Ella inició hace 4 años con la ayuda de su esposo y desde entonces alquilan el local en el que se encuentran, su sueño es que dicho local sea propio y más grande y que sus hijos de 7 y 3 años lleguen a ser profesionales y gocen de todas las cosas que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ismelda Esther R. R. is 25 years old and has a space at the Eastern Market in the city of Managua where she sells towels, curtains, bedding, and other products. She started this business four years ago with the help of her husband. Since then, she has rented the space that she occupies. Her dreams include having her own space that is much larger, seeing her children (ages 7 and 3) become professionals, and enjoying all the things she never had.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: N Towor Group

texts.en:
J. S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called N Towor. J. is 54 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 10 to 25 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 15 years, he has been selling building materials such as shovels, zinc, paint, nails, etc. in West Point, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 30,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 105,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more building materials.  J. describes himself as a kind man.  His goal is to grow his business and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Carla  Lizete

texts.es: La Sra. Carla  tiene  35 años de edad,  con tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, casada hace 11 años, viven en anticrético hace 5 años en  el barrio 21/ de Enero de la  zona de  Guaracachi , La Sra. Carla es masajista y también realiza tratamientos estéticos haces mas de 10 años  ya que para ella es un ingreso para el hogar y asimismo ayuda a su esposo  en los gastos familiares  ,su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodoméstico .El crédito que se le otorgo es  para la compra de camillas y ponerse un salón de masajes  en su vivienda  los señores esta muy agradecidos por el trato que recibieron y la  amabilidad de que lo atendieron al otorgarle su crédito.
texts.en:
La Señora Carla is 35 years old. She has three school-age children and has been married 11 years. Her family has leased a house via the "anticrético" system (where the tenants pay the full amount of the lease in advance and receive all the money back when they move out) for 5 years in the neighborhood "21/de Enero," Guaracachi zone. La Señora Carla is a masseuse and also performs aesthetic treatments. This work has been her source of income for 10 years, and she uses this income to help her husband pay household expenses. Her husband buys and sells household appliances. This loan will be used to purchase massage tables and set up a message room in their home. She and her husband are very grateful for this loan and the kind attention they received when they applied to our office.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of message table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more ladies bags

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo de 27 años de edad, es  soltero,  Vive en casa familiar con su madre y  hermana,   en el B/21 de Septiembre zona radial, la profesión del sr. Eduardo es de   preparador físico,  pero hace Siete años   que se dedica al trabajo de  mecánico electricista, Actividad que aprendio de su Padre, ahora le va bien a el tiene muchos clientes El  Sr. Eduardo se le otorgo el crédito para cancelar el saldo de su vehículo. EL señor esta muy agradecido y sorprendido por la rapidez del crédito y la facilidad del pago, es una persona responsable y muy trabajador, uno de sus deseos es el de poder tener un taller mecanico bien equipado y con mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 27, is single and lives in the family home, located at 21 de Septiembre Boulevard, Radial Zone, with his mother and sister. Eduardo trained to be a physical trainer but has worked as an electrical mechanic for the last 7 years, a skill he learned from his father. He has many customers now. Eduardo was granted a loan to pay off his vehicle. He is very grateful and surprised by the speed with which the loan to pay off his vehicle was granted. He is a responsible, hard working person. One of his wishes is to have a well-equipped machine shop with lots of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off his vehicle.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Martha Beatriz R. García de 53 años es una mujer trabajadora que ha dedicado toda su vida a la lucha por superarse y subsistir, ella ha desempeñado muchas actividades de comercio en el pasado pero hace 7 años decidió iniciar una pulpería con algunos cuantos productos, hoy en día, además de tener dicho negocio, también vende ropa, cosméticos, vende fritanga de jueves a domingos y elabora pasteles por encargo. En sus distintas actividades le ayudan 3 de sus 8 hijos los cuales tiene las edades de 25 (mujer), 14 y 12 años (varones). Su objetivo con el crédito es surtir más el negocio y su meta es hacer mejoras en la casa.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz, 53 years old, is a hardworking woman who has dedicated her life to the struggle of supporting herself and making a better life for herself. She has been involved in many different commercial activities in the past but seven years ago she decided to open a local convenience store to sell a few products. Today, besides having her business she also sells clothing, cosmetics, "fritanga" (a local type of restaurant that sells assorted fried foods) from Thursday to Sunday and bakes cakes by the order. Three of her eight children help her in her different activities. They are 25 (daughter), 14 and 12 (sons) years old. Her goal for this loan is to diversify her business. Her aspiration is to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a used goods trader. She sells her wares at a stall in the busy Campbell Street of Makeni. She is married to an active trader and has four dependents. She was initially financed by her husband nine years ago to commence trade in used clothing. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 to buy additional used clothing to sell.

She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children to university level as well as to support her husband in his efforts to build a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her stall

loans.name: Kossi Gakpo

texts.en: Monsieur Kossi S. works as a tailor at his shop, which is called Ets Godwin. He is an experienced tailor and has been working in this business since 1995. Monsieur S. is married to a hairdresser and they have two children. Kossi has experience taking loans with WAGES: this will be his third loan of 300,000 CFA, which he needs in order to purchase materials for his business such as fabrics and soles. He knows that this investment will help his production and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad, vive a lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos pequeños en su casa propia. Hace más de dos años se dedica en la venta de productos naturales, pues vio la gran demanda que había en su vecindario y más dentro de su familia. Desde entonces se ha dedicado este trabajo, y procurando conocer todo relacionada sobre las enfermedades y de los productos que ayudarían a contrarrestar tales males.  Le gusta mucho su trabajo y ha logrado convertirse en una gran curadora naturista por todo su barrio, es por ello que desea mejorar su negocio, comprando más mercadería. Para el futuro anhela poner un establecimiento, para acomodar sus productos y hacer más llamativa su mercadería. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos naturales para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives with her life partner and their two small children in her own home. For over two years she has sold natural products since she realized the great demand that there was in her neighborhood and within her family. Since then she has been in this line of work striving to learn everything about illnesses and the products that help treat them. She likes her work very much and has become a well known natural healer throughout her neighborhood. For this reason, she wants to improve her business buying more merchandise. For the future she’d like to set up an establishment to display her products in a more attractive manner. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. The requested funds will be used to buy larger amounts of natural products to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on natural remedies.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 20 et 35 ans. A la fin des ses études en classe de terminale  par manque de moyen, elle se lance dans le commerce, elle ouvre une petite unité de fabrique de maniocs, ou elle a une capacité journalière de  80 a 100 maniocs par jour.
Elle achète des sacs des tubercules rouis et fait toutes les opérations nécessaires pour faire des maniocs, du pétrissage à la cuisson 
Pour le pétrissage elle utilise un pétrin en bois et une meule, toutes ces opérations de fabrication prennent 3 jours, ses meilleurs clients sont les restaurateurs, des familles, le manioc est l’aliment de base au congo.
Avec ce prêt elle va acheter  20 sacs de maniocs de 50kg, des feuilles, des fils d’attaches et une grosse marmite pour la cuisson.
A l’avenir elle pense acheter 3 autres pétrins  et créer une coopérative de femmes pour la fabrication des maniocs en quantité énorme.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 54-year old woman who is the mother of three; her children are now between 20 and 35 years old. Ending her studies after the last year of high school, due to lack of financial means, she has started a small business preparing manioc [cassava], and has a daily capacity to prepare 80 to 100 manioc tubers. She purchases macerated tubers in bags and performs all the necessary steps to process them, from mashing to cooking. For mashing she uses a wooden mortar and a pestle. All these steps take three days to complete. Her best customers are owners of diners and families as manioc is a staple food in Congo. With this loan she plans to purchase twenty 50-kg bags of manioc, leaves [for wrapping the manioc paste in], thread to attach the leaves and a big pot for cooking. In the future she would like to purchase three additional mortars and create a women’s cooperative in order to process manioc in large quantities.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 10 bags of macerated manioc tubers, leaves & thread

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is married and has four children who go to school. He established a soft drinks shop in 1990. Kissim also sells, alongside the drinks, articles such as soap, salt, sugar, milk, etc. His shop is located in the Rogbaneh market in Makeni. Kassim established this shop with the aim of getting enough income to support his family.

Kassim has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to help him buy more drinks and other articles such as sugar, milk, toothpaste, etc., from Guinea. He intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate his children to university level and build a house for his family. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for his shop

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo Manuel de 40 años y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en diversos oficios, ya que su principal prioridad es sacar adelante a sus hijos. Actualmente se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, siendo estos productos ofrecidos a sus amigas y vecinos de su barrio y durante los fines de semana debe madrugar para preparar tamales, platillos que son llevados a vender en las afueras de una panadería. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la comunicación con sus clientes, además que le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar. En adelante tiene planeado poner un negocio más estable, por lo que ha pensado poner un  puesto de venta de ropa en algún mercado de la ciudad. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en cosméticos y también  comenzará a comprar ropa para la temporada que se acerca.
texts.en:
Nelly, 40, lives with her husband, Manuel, 40, and their three children in her own home. From a very young age she has worked at a variety of jobs because her main priority is to see her children get ahead. She currently sells beauty products to her friends and neighbors. On weekends, she gets up at dawn to make tamales which are taken to be sold in front of a bakery. What she likes best about her work is communicating with customers in addition to her good profits that help her meet household expenses. For the future she plans to establish a more stable business; she has thought about setting up a stand to sell clothing in one of the city’s markets. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her repayments. The loan requested will be used to buy large amounts of cosmetics and also to start buying clothing appropriate for the upcoming season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on cosmetics.

loans.name: Ignacio Juana

texts.es:
Ignacio de 51 años, ella tiene un puesto de venta de batidos y frutas en la calle del Suburbio porque aun no tiene un local para su negocio. 

Desde el momento que se divorcio ella tuvo que conseguir dinero para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar frutas para hacer batidos y venderlos en las calles, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 16h00pm. 

Ella quiere compara frutas para hacer batidos de duraznos, frutillas, moras etc. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un negocio de batidos y desayunos.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 51, has a stand where she sells blended fruit drinks and fruit in a street in Suburbio because she doesn’t yet have a locale for her business. From the moment she was divorced she had to earn money to support her two children. With effort and dedication she managed to buy fruit to make blended drinks to sell in the streets. She works from 6am until 4pm She wants to buy fruit to make peach, blackberry, strawberry, etc. drinks. In the future, she’d like to finish building her house and have a business selling blended fruit drinks and breakfasts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frutas

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es casada con Francisco,ella trabaja en San Martin Jilotepeque,se dedica a la vanta de maiz por quintal
Y, por libra en el mercado Municipal, y parte de eso realiza blusas tipicas borda solo lunes y miercoles los jueves y domingo vende en el mercado, por ahora no tiene quien la ayude pero piensa colocar una trabajadora. Solisita el credito para comprar maiz por mayor,telas. Agradece a fape por el apoyo brindado, sueña con tener otro negocio de maiz, para ayudarce ella y al mismo tiempo ayudar a su esposo con sus hijos ya que estan en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Rosario is married to Francisco. She works in San Martin Jilotepeque, selling corn by the quintal [100-pound sack] and by the pound at the municipal market, and creating traditional blouses. She embroiders only on Mondays and Wednesdays, and on Thursdays and Sundays she sells at the market. At present, she has no one to help her, but she is thinking of employing a female worker. She is requesting the loan to buy corn and fabric on a wholesale basis. She is grateful to FAPE for the support provided to her. She dreams of having another corn business, so that she can gain resources for herself and help her husband to support their children, who are already of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies to make clothing, and also corn

loans.name: Karin

texts.es: Karin tiene 31 años de edad, es separada, pero vive con sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a atender su puesto de venta que es una cevicheria, donde ofrece diferente productos marinos y bebidas, en el mercado de Ventanilla uno de los más concurridos de su localidad. Para suerte suya, trabaja con su hermana, juntas trabajan en este negocio, teniendo cada uno su propio negocio. Karin atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, tiempo en el que ya termina por vender todos sus platillos. En un futuro quiere tener una gran cevicheria en alguna zona muy concurrida donde pueda ofrecer con mayor tranquilidad sus ricos platillos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una congeladora que le permita tener su mercadería en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Karin, 31, is separated but lives with her two small children in her own home. For the last 6 years she has had a ceviche (marinated fish cocktails) stand where she sells various seafood items and beverages in the Ventanilla Market, one of the busiest in her area. Fortunately for her, she works with her sister. They run the business together although each has her own business. Karin works from 8am until 5pm which is when she stops working because all her dishes have sold out. In the future, she’d like to have a ceviche stand in some other very busy area where she can offer her delicious dishes in a more carefree manner. This is her first loan request with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her repayment. She will use the requested funds to buy a freezer so that she can keep her merchandise in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
Olga de 59 años, ella tiene un local de venta de pescados, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad que le ayudan en el negocio. 

Ella empezó vendiendo encebollados (plato típico del Ecuador, llena pescados, cebolla) en una carreta recorriendo las calles de las Orquídeas, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo alquilar un local para su negocio. Ahora ella trabaja vendiendo encebollados desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pescados y cebollas para hacer mas encebollado en su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener otro local  y tener empleados fijos.
texts.en:
Olga, 59, sells fish. She lives in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil. She has two adult children that help her with the business. She started out selling “encebollados” from a cart along Orquídeas’s streets. (The base of this seafood soup is called “sofrito” and is a pungent mix of tomatoes, onions, cumin, chili and cilantro. The protein element and foundation for the stock is tuna. The starch element is yuca a starchy root vegetable that requires time to cook down the coarse threads found within its stalk. The result is a delicious aromatic savory and spicy soup that is traditionally topped with pickled onions and tomatoes.) Gradually, with much effort, she was able to rent a locale for her business. She is now open for business selling encebollados from 7am until 6pm every day. She wants to use the loan to buy fish and onions to make more encebollados and in the future would like to have a second locale and to have permanent employees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and onions.

loans.name: Delfina De La Luz

texts.es:
Doña delfina de la luz nos cuenta que tiene 52 años de edad es casada actualmente su esposo vive en los  ESTADOS UNIDOS desde hace 4 años, delfina tiene 5 hijos  son casados y tiene un hijo de 17 años ue estudia actualmente.

Ella vive en villa lobos de guatemala, tiene un negocio de tortilleria y prouctos de catalogo, la tortilleria la tiene desde hace 8 años y la venta de productos por catalogo desde hace 3 años.

Doña delfina dice que durante el tiempo que a tenido su negocio le ha ido bien pero desea crecer como comerciante y para poder lograr  su objetivo nesecita comprar una plancha para su tortilleria, ya que la que tiene es muy pequeña y no le es suficiente con los clientes que tiene.

Espera en Dios poder salir adelante con el credito que le brinde Fape y Kiva ya que es su unico apoyo economicamente.
texts.en:
Delfina De La Luz reports that she is 52 years old and married. Her husband has lived in the United States for the past 4 years. Delfina has 5 children who are married, and one 17-year-old son who is currently studying. She lives in Villa Lobos, Guatemala, and she has a business selling tortillas as well as products from a catalog. She has run the tortilla business for 8 years and the catalog sales for 3 years. Delfina says that during the time that she has had her business, it has gone well for her, but she would like to grow as a businessperson, and to achieve this objective, she needs to buy a grill for her tortilla business. The tortilla grill she has is very small, and it is insufficient for the number of customers she has. She says she has faith in God that she will be able to get ahead with the loan provided to her by FAPE and Kiva, since this is her only source of economic assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a tortilla grill

loans.name: Mariscal Caceres Group

texts.es:
La señora Eulogia tiene 50 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 20 años, su domicilio está ubicado en la Coop. Andrés Avelino Cáceres, distrito de  Ate - Vitarte, departamento de  Lima, se dedica al negocio de venta de jugos, desde hace 5 años, se inicio en este negocio porque quería ayudar a sus hijos en su educación y con los ingresos en su casa, además también realiza la venta de cosméticos por catalogo. Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desde hace 9 años, actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta de la  alcancía comunal “MARISCAL CACERES” la cual está integrada por 14 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: comercio y servicios.
Su reciente préstamo será utilizado en la compra de mercadería como: gaseosas, frugos, frutas para  seguir fidelizando y abasteciendo a sus clientes.
En el futuro anhela poder hacer  crecer su negocio implementándolo para tener una mejor posición en el mercado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eulogia, 50, is married and has two children who are 18 and 20 years of age. Her address is located at Andrés Avelino Cáceres Coop, Ate-Vitarte district, Lima department. She has sold juices for the past 5 years. She started out in this business because she wanted to help pay for her children’s education and with household expenses. She also sells catalogue cosmetics. She has collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 9 years and is currently acting as President of the “MARISCAL CACERES” communal bank which has 14 members who are involved in a variety of commercial and service oriented activities. Her latest loan will be used to buy merchandise like: soft drinks, Frugos brand fruit juices, fruits in order to continue to meet customer demand. In the future she wishes her business to grow so that it will have a better market positioning thus improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: soft drinks, Frugos brand fruit juices, fruits.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, impulsada por financiamiento de Afodenic, el cual a través de los préstamos ha logrado el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, a si como frutas y verduras.
Para lograr otros ingresos hace nacatamales los fines de semanas, ya que por su salud gasta mucho en medicamento ya que es diabética, no ha sido fácil, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijo y su  esposo, el cual trabaja como albañil.
Su necesidad es poder reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que se le esta pasando el agua y no cuanta con el dinero suficiente para la reparación a si como la compra de dos puertas para mejorar las condiciones de seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Thanks to loans from Afodenic Silvia has been a merchant for several years. The loans have helped her small grocery store, where she stocks a variety of products as well as fruits and vegetables, to grow. To earn extra income she makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) on the weekend because, being diabetic, she spends a lot on medicines. It hasn’t been easy for her but she can count on help from her children and her husband, who works as a bricklayer. She needs to repair her roof because it’s leaking and she lacks the necessary funds to do so. She also needs to buy two doors to improve her family’s security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for roof repair and to buy two doors.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Simeona ; ella tiene 49 Años de edad y tiene 4 hijos. La socia alterna sus actividades con su negocio de restaurante, ella vende diferentes platos, desde hace 8 años atrás, La socia es casada y ella misma elabora los diferentes platillos; La socia desea implementar su restaurante y comprar vajillas e invertir en diferentes cosas relacionadas a su negocio de comidas.  La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurante.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Simeona, 49, is a member of the “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal bank which is located in Huanchac district, Cusco Province, Cusco department. She is married and has four children and she combines her household chores with running a restaurant. She has sold a variety of home made dishes for the last 8 years. She’d like to supply the restaurant and buy dinnerware and various other items related to the food business. She is asking for the loan to do this. She is grateful for and values the loan that will help her meet her goals. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of restaurant utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, el taxista informal en las calles de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos. 

Para tener mas ingresos para su familia el decidió convertirse en taxista informal porque no tenia dinero para inscribirse en una cooperativa de taxis, poco a poco a vendió trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días, haciendo carreras desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 15.00. Pero como el vive en un lugar que recién se esta reestructurando quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques y pinturas. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y poder tener una cooperativa de taxis.
texts.en:
Santiago, 57, lives in a periurban area in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil. He is a taxi driver in Guayaquil and has two children. In order to earn more income for his family he decided to become an informal taxi driver because he didn’t have funds to enroll in a taxi co-op. Gradually he sold his services working from 8am until 6pm every day making trips charging from $1.00 to $15.00. However, because he lives in a house that he’s refurbishing, he wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, cinder blocks and paint. In the future he’d like to improve his house’s construction and have a taxi cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, cinder blocks, paint.

loans.name: Yaklin Yessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yaklin ; ella tiene 28 Años de edad y tiene 1 hijos. La socia alterna sus actividades con el arte ella es conviviente y se dedica a la venta de cuadros hechos en oleo, ella tiene un local frente a la escuela de bellas artes en el segundo piso, hay están expuestas las obras de pintores nuevos hechos en oleo. La socia quiere comprar marcos, pinturas.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pinturas y algunos marcos.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Progreso (Progress) communal bank. This bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Yaklin; she is 28 years old and has one son. The member divides her time between homemaking and art. She has a live-in partner, and her business is selling oil paintings. She has a second-floor shop in front of the fine arts school, where oil paintings by new painters are exhibited. The member wants to buy frames and paints. She is asking for the loan to buy paints and some frames. She is grateful for and values the loan, which will allow her to reach her goals. The member promises to pay off her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paints and frames

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una mujer emprendedora, que gracias a su dedicación al trabajo ha logrado mantener su pequeño negocio venta de mariscos, y que junto AFodenic ha logrado el incremento de su producción.
Desde hace años comenzó vendiendo pequeñas cantidades de pescado, luego logro comprar variedad de punches, camarones, conchas, pulpos productos que son delicados y que se venden en gran cantidad ya que son ricos en fósforos y para una buena salud.
Con este préstamo lograra la compra de: Camarones, grandes y pequeños, chuletas de pescado, pescado entero, conchas. El cual una parte vende en libras y otras son entregadas a los clientes por cantidad. Día a día vende en un mercado de la capital ya que la demanda es mucha y son productos caros y se necesita buen capital en esta inversion.
texts.en:
Dominga is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her dedication to her work, has managed to maintain her shellfish sales business and together with Afodenic has achieved an increase in her production. Some years ago she began selling small amounts of fish. Later she was able to buy a variety of sand crabs, shrimp, conch and octopus, products which are delicate and sell in large amounts because they are high in phosphorus and are healthy. With this loan she will buy large and small shrimp, fish fillets, whole fish, and conch. Some of her products are sold by the pound and others are delivered in bulk to her customers. Everyday she sells at a market in the capital because demand is high there and these are expensive products, and she needs a good amount of capital for this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Large and small shrimp, fish fillets, whole fish, conch, and other shellfish

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; el tiene 69. Años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, el socio es casado;  El socio alterna sus actividades con la atención de su cafetín que está situado frente a la facultad de enfermería en la universidad nacional; El socio atiende todos los días su cafetín en el cual vende pasteles, sándwich, hamburguesas, gaseosas, bebidas calientes, y ahora el necesita implementar y comprar mercadería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su local, como gaseosas, papas, panes, galletas, carne, pollo.

El socio agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite crecer en su negocio, El socio se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Progreso (Progress) communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Feliciano; he is 69 years old, is married and has four children. He divides his time between other activities and working in his little cafe, which is located in front of the nursing school at the national university. He works in his cafe every day, selling cakes, sandwiches, hamburgers, soft drinks, hot drinks, and now he needs to expand and buy merchandise. The member is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for his shop, like sodas, potato chips, bread, cookies, meat and chicken. The member is grateful for and values this loan, which will allow him to reach his goals. He promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Ibet Ojeda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ibet ; ella tiene 30 Años de edad y tiene 1  hijo. La socia es madre soltera y  alterna sus actividades con la labor de ayudante de cocina en un restaurante.  La socia trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante turístico, ella se dedica a lavar los platos y a picar las verduras y hacer todos los preparativos para que el cocinero elabore los platos finales, ella trabaja y recibe al final de cada mes su sueldo, pero ahora ella quiere comprar una refrigeradora para su casa y está ahorrando pero también le falta un poco para cubrir el monto final y comprarlo ella quiere abrir su propio cafetin a futuro.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, PROGRESO. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

The client is Ibet. She is 30 years old and has a son. She is a single mother and alternates her activities with her job as a kitchen helper at a restaurant. Ibet works as a kitchen helper in a touristic restaurant. She works washing the dishes, chopping up the vegetables, and making all of the preparations so that the cook prepares the final dishes. She works and receives her wages at the end of each month, but now she wants to buy a refrigerator for her house and she is saving. However, she is slightly short of being able to pay the full amount and purchase it. She wants to open her own small restaurant in the future. She is requesting the loan to purchase a refrigerator.

She is grateful for and values this loan which will allow her to accomplish her goals. She promises to make her payments according to the determined time table.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 47 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo Víctor de 56 años y su hija Yobana de 17 años en su casa, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica es el arrendar cuartos, que tiene disponible en su domicilio para personas que vienen de otros lugares, mayormente de provincia a encontrar oportunidades laborales o de estudios en la ciudad de Lima. Lleva 5 años y hasta el momento le ha sido muy rentable, actualmente es la encargada de administrar los ingresos de su negocio y con ello poder construir otras habitaciones para ser alquilados en el futuro. Ana se siente contenta con su trabajo pues le resulta muy cómodo realizarlo aunque muchas veces también le han tocado malos inquilinos que malogran la infraestructura y logran irse sin pagar por ello procura ser mas cuidadosa. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, terminará de construir el piso del cuarto que próximamente alquilará.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old and lives with her 56 year-old husband, Victor, and her 17 year-old daughter, Yobana, in a home that they managed to buy with a lot of effort. She makes a living by renting rooms that she has available in her house to people that come from other places, primarily from the provinces to find work opportunities or to study in Lima. She has done this for 5 years and it has been profitable. Currently, she is in charge of managing her business’s income. She is using this income to build additional rooms to rent in the future. Ana is happy with her work, and she is very comfortable with it even though many times she has had bad tenants that have damaged the infrastructure and managed to leave without paying for the damages. For this reason, she is trying to be more careful. This is her first credit with MFP and she promises to be punctual with all of her payments. With the credit that she is requesting, she will finish construction on the floor of the room that she will rent out next.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction on the floor of the room that she will rent

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karina ; ella tiene 21 Años de edad y es soltera;  La socia  a estudiado farmacia en la universidad nacional y ahora ella es graduada, La socia  tiene una botica  y está implementándola poco a poco, ella aún no quiere casarse ni pensar en tener hijos sino hasta pasado los 30 años, tiene el sueño de hacer de su botica una cadena de farmacias a futuro.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Karina, 21, is single and is a member of the “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She studied pharmacy in the university and has now graduated. She has a drug store that she is gradually filling with stock and supplies. She doesn’t want to get married yet nor think about having children until she’s over 30 years old. Her dream is to turn her drug store into a chain of drug stores in the future. She is asking for funding to buy medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam es madre dedicada de tres hermosos hijos, vive junto con su mama quien la apoyado para poder ayudarse económicamente y moral ya que no cuenta con el padre de sus hijos.
Por varios años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, pero ahora esta vendiendo tortillas y nacatamales productos que ve mas rápido su dinero aunque mas cansado. Pero para ella el trabajar mas es la sastifacion de ver a sus hijos bien.
Con este préstamo lograra la compra de tres quintales de maíz, carbón, también se afiliara en Avon para comenzar a vender cosmético,  con el objetivo de circular su capital, teniendo mejores ganancias. Ha trabajado con Afodenic diez ciclos siendo una puerta de apoyo para su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a mother who is devoted to her three beautiful children. She lives with her mother who has helped support her economically and morally since she can’t depend on the father of her children. For several years she has sold clothing but now is selling tortillas and nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) because these products sell more quickly and, although more taxing work, she sees her money sooner. For her, though, work entails the satisfaction of seeing her children be well. She will use this loan to buy three quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn and some charcoal. She will also affiliate herself with Avon to start selling cosmetics and earn better profits. She has collaborated with Afodenic for 8 cycles these being a source of support for her small business

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three quintales (a weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn and some charcoal for her tortilla sales business.  She will also sell Avon cosmetics for better economic results.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia De La Cruz

texts.es: María Eugenia V.  desde que cumplió su mayoría de edad, (18 años en Colombia), está trabajando; su abuela le enseño el arte de confeccionar ropa, tradición familiar, y ella empezó a ayudarla pues trabajaba este oficio desde su casa; justamente fue con ella que María Eugenia  hizo sus primeros intentos de confección  y esta experiencia la llevó a ser empleada de un taller y finalmente de una empresa en  la Zona Franca de Barranquilla, donde funcionan Fabricas de confecciones que producen, transforman o ensambla bienes para su venta en los mercados externos prioritariamente, logrando allí perfeccionar su arte durante 6 años, para luego implementar su taller con sus ahorros y un crédito, con el que logró comprar su primera máquina y algunas herramientas básicas para montaje de su confección . María Eugenia siempre está en la búsqueda de innovar y de aumentar la calidad de sus prendas de vestir, por eso últimamente se ha propuesto comprar una máquina plana, que le ayude en el perfeccionamiento de la prenda y a aumentar el volumen de compras de sus materias primas, para confeccionar nuevos diseños y esto es justamente a lo que ella aspira mediante su credikiva. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y desea con sus financiamientos futuros, lograr su   meta de ampliar su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura para crear fuentes de empleo, que ayuden a resolver necesidades de ingresos de muchas familias.
texts.en:
María Eugenia V. has been working since she came of age (18 in Colombia). Her grandmother taught her how to make clothing, and she began to help her with this work from her home. That is just when María Eugenia began her first attempts at dressmaking. This experience pushed her to work in a shop, and finally in a company in the Industrial Zone of Barranquilla where clothing factories (toll manufacturers) mainly produce, alter, and assemble goods for sale abroad. She succeeded in perfecting her art during those 6 years, and then opened her own shop with her savings and a loan. She was able to buy her first sewing machine and some basic tools for the dressmaking. María Eugenia always is looking to innovate and improve the quality of her clothing. For this she has been able to purchase a machine that helps her in the perfecting of the garments and to increase the volume of her purchases of the basics that she needs to make new designs. And this is just what she plans to do with the Kiva loan. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she would like to have further loans in the future. She wants to enlarge her business and improve the infrastructure to create more employment and help solve the need for income for many families.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine  and basic materials to make new designs.

loans.name: Antonio Francisco

texts.es:
Antonio M., su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 16 años viven en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla, y desde allí él se dedica a la fabricación de accesorios para motos;  actividad que aprendió  desde muy joven hace 25 años trabajando en el taller de fundición de su padre y que desde hace 8 años ya de manera independiente en su propio taller, creo su propia nueva alternativa de ingresos, mediante su montaje;  así fue como, con sus ahorros compró su primer motor, luego un horno, un taladro de banca y a trabajar se dijo con la ayuda de su hijo mayor;  en la actualidad contrata a 4 ayudantes que trabajan por producción;  gradualmente ha ido creciendo su infraestructura de negocio, pues  tiene 2 motores mas y una fragua   un M. que inició en Malambo y ahora está extendido en el Departamento del Atlántico: Barranquilla, malambo, Santo Tomás y Sabanagrande y en el departamento de Bolívar:  Cartagena y  en el departamento del Magdalena en Santa Marta,  lugares atendidos por vendedores, otra muestra de su crecimiento es que  6 meses ubicó un punto de venta en Malambo en la vía principal donde además de sus productos vende otros para motocicletas como chalecos , cascos, mangas y guantes. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con este su credikiva comprará 500 kilos de aluminio y 500 kilos de carbón para adicionar otros elementos a su proceso productivo.
Sus expectativas es continuar ampliando su negocio, especialmente fortaleciendo mas puntos de venta, pues el tener su taller le ha dado buen resultado por su ubicación estratégica,  pero necesita extenderse con puntos de servicios y ser muy reconocido en los alrededores.
texts.en:
Antonio M. lives in the municaplity of Malambo, a metropolitan area of Barranquilla, with his wife and three children who are between the ages of 10 and 16. There he manufactures motorcycle accessories. He learned this trade as a young man 25 years ago working at his father’s foundry. Antonio has now been working independently in his own workshop for eight years. By increasing this new source of income, he was able to buy his first motor and later a furnace and a bench drill. He says he has the help of his oldest son and currently has four employees who handle the production work. By gradually expanding the infrastructure of his business, he was able to acquire two additional motors and a forge at the market.
