Antonio started his business in Malambo and now he has extended to Barranquilla, Santo Tomás, and Sabanagrande in the Department of Atlántico; Cartagena in the Department of Bolívar; Santa Marta in the Department of Magdalena, and other places where vendors gather. Another example of the growth of his business is a vending post he started six months ago, which is located on the main road in Malambo. There he sells other motorcycle accessories such as riding jackets, helmets, ponchos, and gloves.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the Kiva funds he will buy 500kg of aluminum, 500kg of coal, and other materials used in his production process. He expects to continue expanding his business and strengthening his sales locations. His workshop has generated good results because of its strategic location, but he needs to extend his service areas so that he can gain more recognition in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 500kg of aluminum, 500kg of coal, and other materials

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora es una mujer dedicada, trabajadora desde hace diez años como estilista, con 39 años de edad, ha logrado tener su pequeño negocio en su casa, tiene un lugar para atender a sus clientes.
El inicio lo hizo trabajando como aprendiz en un salón, lo que hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos para apoyar  as  familia, un hijo el cual estudia y su esposo que trabaja como conductor siendo su salario bajo.

A través de estos financiamiento ha logrado las mejoras a su vivienda, con el crédito anterior logro hacer su cocina, ahora lo que quiere  hacer y comprar es un inodoro para el servicio de los clientes, ya que abecés pasan mas de dos horas en su limpieza de mano y pies y prestan el servicio.
Los materiales a necesitar: bloques, arena, cemento, zinc, inodoro, lavamanos. 
Logrando así una mejor inversión para su pequeño salón, a si como mejores condiciones personales todo esto lográndolo junto Afodenic.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is a dedicated woman who has worked hard as a stylist for 10 years. At the age of 39, she has succeeded in having her own little business in her house, where she has a place to attend to her customers. She started out working as an apprentice in a salon, and today her work is a source of income to support her family, a son who is a student and her husband, who works as a driver, since his salary is low. Through these loans she has achieved improvements in her house. With the previous loan she constructed her kitchen. Now what she wants is to purchase supplies and construct a bathroom for the use of her customers, since they sometimes spend more than two hours in their manicures and pedicures and they need to use a toilet. The materials she needs are blocks, sand, cement, zinc, a toilet, and a sink. Achieving a better investment in her little salon, like achieving better personal conditions, is all made possible together with Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a toilet and sink to install new facilites in her little salon, thus giving better attention to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María de 23 años, en una zona periurbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  aunque esta divorciada ella sigue trabajando para su hijos dos hijos de 7 y 6 años. 

Realiza su trabajo sola, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ser directora Yambal poder tener su propio local.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old and lives in the periurban area of Orquídeas de Guayaquil. She sells products manufactured by Yanbal, a company that offers women entrepreneurs the opportunity to start their own independent sales businesses. Even though María is divorced, she continues working for her children who are 7 and 6 years of age.

Working alone, she wakes up very early to begin offering products to her neighbors and friends. María sells perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. With this loan, she wants to buy Yanbal products such as perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. In the future she wants to finish the construction of her house, become a Yanbal director, and have her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants

loans.name: Carmen Victoria

texts.es:
Carmen Martínez vive en Bogotá la capital de Colombia y se dedica a la venta de   canela, clavos de olor, bicarbonato y en general condimentos,  que ella misma  empaca en bosas plásticas desde hace 15 años, cuando inició su microempresa con la idea de  generar ingresos y  observando la necesidad que tienen las  familias de comprar condimentos y productos como canela, clavito de olor, en una unidad medida y a un mejor precio, que en ese entonces eran poco usuales, pero que ella podía lograr  un reempacando y vendiendo al detal en los hogares ubicados a su alrededor como mercado inicial.
Con esta ingeniosa idea empezó y justamente este negocio le ha permitido apoyar la gestión de su familia  y también dedicarse con mayor intensidad de tiempo a ella, que está conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos que ahora están en las edades de 16 y 18 años.
Este es su primer crédito con la fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en la compra de condimentos al por mayor y en empaques para aumentar su capital de trabajo, porque últimamente tiene muchos mas pedidos y no es fácil responder a la demanda. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar en los niveles superiores universitarios  y sobre todo abrir un local que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Martínez lives in Bogota, the capital of Colombia, and sells cinnamon, cloves, baking soda, and other condiments. She packs these spices in plastic bags. Carmen started this microenterprise 15 years ago because she needed to generate income for her family. Seeing the need that other families had to buy condiments, she decided to buy cinnamon and cloves. She was able to acquire these spices at the best prices, which was unusual at that time. Carmen repackaged these products and then sold them at retail to homes in the area as her initial market.

With her ingenious idea to start this business, Carmen was able to support her family by dedicating more time to this activity. Her family consists of her husband and her two children, ages 16 and 18.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use her loan to buy condiments in bulk and packaging to increase her operating capital. Carmen has many orders and it is not easy to keep up with demand. Her dream is for her children to finish their studies at the university level. She would also like to open a store that will permit her to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condiments in bulk and packaging

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Alegría, se conformó en fecha 14 de enero del 2.010, con mucho esfuerzo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, y  de apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Clara Jiménez  quien se dedica a venta y elaboración de artesanías, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar su producción y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
 Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró  ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido, con  el ingreso de la venta de sus productos.
 Según la Sra. Clara    mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que mediante ella pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo. 
Solicita la compra de   compra de artesanía como ponchos de lana, frazadas de lana, gorras, y otros.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women named “Alegría” (Joy) was established on January 14, 2010. With great effort, the members joined together in unity to become part of the program. In addition to their independent businesses, the members also develop activities in which they raise funds so that they will have group capital with which they can financially support their families.

A very moving story involves Sra. Clara Jiménez, who sells and produces handicrafts. She says that with this loan she will be able to improve production, her standard of living, and her income. Through her business, Clara claims that her family finances have improved. Her husband also generates an income to supplement the earnings from the sale of her products. She says that that the activities with Fundación Paraguaya have been very important because they have helped her develop in her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts such as ponchos, blankets, caps, and other items made of wool.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts such as ponchos, blankets, caps, and other items made of wool

loans.name: Eliseo Ramon

texts.es:
Don Eliseo tiene la edad de 42 años, comerciante de su propio negocio, venta de chatarra que desde hace cinco años ha venido invirtiendo en este, el cual trabaja con dos hijos. Las dificultades es que a veces no cuenta con mucho capital cuando le sale buena cantidad de chatarra.

Lo que quiere comenzar hacer es un pequeño muro ya que una correntada pasa por su vivienda lo que quiere desviar al levantar las paredes del muro, ya que se le ha hecho muy incómodo por el agua y que luego se convierte en mucho lodo, lo que produce mucho mosquito y mal higiene.

Comprara: bloques, hierro, cemento, estribos, arena, piedrin y lamina de zinc.
Para el ha sido estos financiamientos de gran oportunidad, logrando hacer sus mejoras.
texts.en:
Don Eliseo is 42 years old. He has his own business selling scrap. He has been investing in this business for five years and works with two of his children. The problem is that he does not always have much capital when a good amount of scrap becomes available. He wants to start building a small wall because a current runs by his home, and he wants to alter its course by building walls. Things have become very uncomfortable because of the water and because it creates a lot of mud, which produces mosquitoes and unsanitary conditions. He will buy: blocks, iron, cement, supports, sand, piedrin [a type of building stone] and zinc sheets. These loans have been a great opportunity for him, allowing him to make his improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to build a small wall to prevent water from entering his house

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother, raising her child by herself. She sells clothing at a bus station in the small town of Svalyava, western Ukraine. Silvia has been in this business for six years. This business is the only source of income for her family.

Silvia would like to borrow 11,000 hryvnia (UAH) to increase her assortment of inventory. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income. Silvia is a very active person and has the desire to develop her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es:
Don Marvin de edad de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador, dedicado al comercio desde hace varios años, una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, comenzando con poco y que ha venido creciendo gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo de Afodenic.
Pues lleva once ciclos en donde ha logrado mantener el equilibrio de su negocio como las mejoras a su vivienda.
Lo que quiere hacer es un cuarto,  ya que sus hijos son tres, y el cuarto que tienen están ya muy incomodo, la solución es poder construir otro al fondo del solar.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, hierro, cemento, zinc logrando así hacer su construcción.
texts.en:
Marvin, 45, is a hardworking man who has been a merchant for a number of years. He has a grocery store where he sells a variety of products. Starting out with little, he has managed to grow thanks to his efforts and the support of AFODENIC. He has participated in 11 loan cycles where he has managed to keep his business going and make improvements to his house. What he wants to do is add a room, since he has 3 children, and the room that they have is very uncomfortable. The solution is to build another at the back of the lot. He will buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, iron, cement, and corrugated metal roofing sheets to use in the construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal roofing sheets, and other supplies to build a room at the back of his lot

loans.name: Dora Margarita

texts.es:
Dora de 47 años, ella tiene un local de venta de plásticos como tarrinas, vasos, cucharas. Vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil. 

Empezó vendiendo bebidas, golosinas pero no tenia muchos ingresos así que decidió invertir casi todas sus ahorros y comprar plásticos para vender. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Cada tarrina la vende a $ 0.30, vasos a $ 0.15, platos a $ 0.15 c/u, en ocasiones vende al por mayor. 

Para comprar que su negocio este mas surtido quiere comprar con el préstamo plásticos,bebidas, en el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de plásticos y así dar empleo a jóvenes emprendedores.
texts.en:
Dora is 47 years old and has a store where she sells plastic goods such as bowls, cups, and spoons. She lives in the urban area of Orquídeas de Guayaquil.

Dora started selling beverages and sweets, but this did not generate much income. She then decided to invest almost all of her savings so that she could buy plastics to sell. Now she works every day from 7am to 7pm. Dora sells bowls from $0.30/each, cups for $0.15/each, and plates for $0.15/each. On some occasions she sells in bulk.

She will use her loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing plastic goods and beverages. In the future, Dora wants to have a plastics distribution center and provide employment to young entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic goods & beverages

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene un restaurante y un estadero en el populoso barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio, rodeado de los escenarios de futbol y otros deportes más significativos de la Costa Caribe. Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y justamente  un credikiva con el que  comprará refrescos y bebidas frías al por mayor, además de insumos como arroz y aceite para su restaurante, negocios que funcionan desde el año 1992. 
Para Gregorio sus negocios son  bien importantes, porque le significan los ingresos de su hogar, por eso lo cuida mucho y sus créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo los han aplicado a ellos, logrando aumentar su capital de trabajo y gradualmente   ha visto sus utilidades reflejadas en mejoras para su hogar y en una infraestructura como la que hasta hoy muestra. Así que cualquier persona que pasa para el Estadio Metropolitano y ve su atractivo Kiosco metálico, se acerca y compra, pues está ubicado en un  corredor comercial muy importante y porque también tiene un ritmo de trabajo reconocido, pues Gregorio está allí desde las 7 de la mañana y cierra su negocio no antes de las 10 de la noche y los sábados, domingos y feriados, atiende  hasta las 3 de la mañana respondiendo a sus clientes rumberos que festejan los triunfos y lloran las pocas derrotas de su equipo de futbol del alma:  “el  Junior de Barranquilla”.
texts.en:
Gregorio has a restaurant and tavern in the populous July 20th neighborhood. This area is surrounded by scenes of people playing soccer and other sports that are popular along the Costa Caribe. This is his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and just his first through Kiva. Gregorio will buy refreshments and cold drinks in bulk. In addition, he will purchase supplies such as rice and oil for his restaurant. He has been operating these businesses since 1992.

Gregorio’s businesses are very important to him because they generate household income. For this reason, he is very careful with how he utilizes the loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He was able to increase his operating capital and gradually reap the rewards such as improvements to his home and a better infrastructure for his business. Anyone who passes by the Metropolitan Stadium can see his attractive metal kiosk located nearby and make a purchase. His businesses are located in an important commercial corridor that is well-known for the rhythm in which it works. Gregorio begins working at 7am and closes his business at 10pm. On Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays, he closes at 3am in response to customers who celebrate victories by dancing the rumba and mourning the rare defeats of the local soccer team, “Junior de Barranquilla”.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase refreshments, cold drinks, rice, and oil

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Pora, se conformó en fecha mayo de 2.006, en Hohenau y se encuentran trabajando dentro del  15 ciclo, con 15 integrantes. 

Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo, al comercio, manualidades, modista, entre otros. 
El comité es uno de los más antiguos de la oficina, por lo que ya tienen desarrollado el espíritu solidario entre las compañeras, además de destacarse por el orden en sus finanzas internas. 
Son disciplinadas con el pago, ya que pagan puntualmente sus créditos en todos los ciclos. 

Otra característica de las integrantes es que, son consientes a la hora de solicitar el préstamo y eso va acompañado con la conducta de pago, es decir, que no por tener una línea alta de crédito, retiran el máximo monto, sino, que solicitan el monto cuya cuota van a poder cubrir con sus actividades correspondientes. 

La Sra. Jacinta C. tiene 45 años de edad, es modista y su marido Esteban Florentin (sastre) tienen 3 hijos.

Doña Jacinta tiene un objetivo principal: Ayudar a su hija a terminar sus estudios universitarios, ya que actualmente está estudiando Licenciatura en Contabilidad.
La intención de sus padres es que, gracias al sacrificio que están realizando al solventar a su hija universitaria, el día de mañana ella cubra los estudios de su hermana menor que esta en 8vo grado.

Desean incrementar sus ingresos para adquirir  materiales para ampliar el negocio mediante la fabricación de más variedades de prendas de vestir, teniendo en cuenta la clientela formada y la demanda que posee.
texts.en:
This Committee of Women is called Kuña Pora and was established in May 2006 in Hohenau. The group is working in its 15th loan cycle with 15 members.

These ladies engage in different businesses such as retail, handicrafts, dressmaking, and other activities. This committee is one of the oldest at its branch office. A spirit of solidarity has already developed among its members and the group has succeeded in keeping its internal finances in order. The members are disciplined with their payments and have always paid on time in each of their loan cycles.

Another characteristic of the members is that they are always conscientious when requesting their loans, and as a result they adjust their payment behavior accordingly. Since they do not have a large line of credit, they always request the maximum amount because they claim it will help cover their corresponding business activities.

Sra. Jacinta C. is 45 years old and works as a seamstress. Her husband Esteban Florentin works as a tailor. They have three children.

Doña Jacinta has one main objective – to help her daughter finish her university studies. She is currently earning her degree in Accounting. Being a parent, Jacinta intends to make sacrifices in order to cover her daughter’s education. In the future, she plans to cover the studies of her other daughter who is in eighth grade.

Jacinta wants to increase her income by acquiring materials to expand her business. She plans to produce more varieties of clothing based on the size of her customer base and the level of demand that exists.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Don Salomón es un pequeño comerciante desde hace once años, con una pulpería el cual comenzó con poco, y dinero propio.
He venido aumentando el capital con préstamos que Afodenic ha dado el cual ha logrado la oportunidad del crédito.
Invirtiendo en productos de librería ya que son productos accesibles y de rotación a si como de  gran utilidad durante el año escolar.
Con este financiamiento lograra un anexo a su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones personales. En donde comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, entre otros logrando así la obra.
texts.en:
Don Salomón is a small businessman who opened his store eleven years ago using his own money. He started with very little, but he has been able to increase his capital with the help of credit opportunities with AFODENIC in which he was able to secure loans. Salomón has invested in office supplies since these products are widely used and always in demand, especially during the school year.

With this loan, he hopes to build an extension to his home that will improve his personal living conditions. He plans to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, crossbeams, and other items needed to perform the work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja Wilder de 37 años y sus tres pequeños hijos, en su casa que es propia y que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. Hace más de 3 años se dedica en la venta de cereales, producto que lo adquiere en provincia, posteriormente son ofrecidos a sus amistades que viven dentro de su zona. De esta manera Andrea se desenvuelve y se dedica en dar información de los beneficios que le genera estos productos nutritivos. Gracias al gran carisma de Andrea los clientes siempre prefieren comprarle, pues sabe que es muy honesta y trabajadora. En un futuro desea tener un gran puesto donde ofrecer su mercadería y así llevar mejores ingresos a su hogar. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cereales para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Andrea is 44 years old and lives with her partner Wilder, age 37, and their three small children. She has her own house that she bought after much effort. For more than three years, she has been acquiring grain throughout the province and then selling it to friends who live in her area. By working in this manner, Andrea is able to pass along information regarding the nutritional benefits of these products to her customers. Thanks to her charisma, Andrea has customers who always prefer to buy from her and they know that she is honest and extremely hardworking. In the future, she wants to have a large vending post where she can offer her merchandise and generate more household income.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete all of her payments on time. With the loan she requested, Andrea will buy a larger quantity of grain so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more grain to complete her orders

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina owns a small food store in a village close to Kherson town. She has been in this business for ten years. Her average income is 9,000 UAH per month.

Valentina is a very disciplined and organized person. She keeps track of her business expenses and income to make sure her business is doing well. Her large assortment and low prices always attract many repeat customers. Valentina is a kind and generous person. She helps others in her community with their needs. Valentina lives with her husband in their own house.

Valentina would like to borrow 10,000 Gryvnas (UAH) to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Miriam Gladys

texts.es:
Miriam de 40 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella tiene un taller de costura y confección. 

Empezó trabajando en un taller de confecciones , cuando aprendió decidió independizarse y ganar su propio dinero, poco a poco con esfuerzo, compro una maquina de coser y telas, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener una mayor producción de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo tela y hilos. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de confección completo y así darle trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered. She has a sewing and tailoring workshop.

She began working at a sewing factory. Upon learning the necessary skills, she decided to become independent and earn her own money. With a little bit of effort, Miriam bought a sewing machine and fabric. Now she works every day from 8am to 4pm.

To increase her clothing production, she wants to use this loan to buy fabrics and thread. In the future, Miriam wants to have her sewing workshop completed so that she can provide work to other people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and thread

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de Fátima es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 29 de Enero del 2009, integrado por 19  mujeres. 
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. María Pabla L. quien se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la  misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 6° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comidas en su casa.
Esta actividad lo realiza con su hija ya que requiere de mucha mano de obra para elaboración de comidas y la atención de los clientes. 
La señora Maria comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con su comité y que desea seguir trabajando por el bien común de todas. 
Solicta el préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes, harinas, aceites, condimentos para comidas, bebidas.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee is an excellent committee founded on January 29, 2009 with 19 members. The group organized thanks to Mrs. María Pabla L. who approached the consultant during a loan renewal meeting she was having in the area to ask about the Enterprising Women Committee’s Program. She became very encouraged and anxious to be able to work with this program and they are now very happy being part of the Enterprising Women Committee’s Program’s 6th cycle. The members of the group will use the funds for a variety of different purposes. One of the members, María, sells beverages and prepared meals in her home. Her daughter helps her with this work because she needs a lot of help with the labor involved in preparing the meals and taking care of customers. María tells us that she is very satisfied with her committee and wants to continue working toward the common good of all of them. She is asking for funds to buy vegetables, meats, flours, cooking oil, food condiments and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, flours, cooking oils, food condiments, beverages.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "CORAZON D. JESUS"

La alcancía Comunal "CORAZON D. JESUS" esta formada por 11 socias muy comprometidas, que demuestran puntualidad y responsabilidad, ellas viven en la misma urbanización por lo que las hace participes D. la misma comunidad, ellas son muy trabajadoras y encontraron en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD la oportunidad D. crecer y expandirse.
Tal caso es el D. la señora María que a sus 48 años a demostrado ser una gran madre soltera D. 3 hijos, ella luchó para darles estudios y buenos valores, ahora solo espera que sus negocios brindan los frutos que ella desea cosechar gracias a sus esfuerzos.
María se dedica a dar el servicio D. buffet a los eventos en que la necesiten como cumpleaños, bautizos, matrimoniaos, etc., ella también recibe mucho apoyo por parte D. sus hijos, ya que la mayor D. ellas se encarga D. administrar el negocio D. tipeos, copias e impresiones.
María ve con buenos ojos el crecimiento D. sus negocios pero aun espera implementar más D. lo que tiene ahora, y gracias al préstamo anterior pudo comprarse una computadora  para el servicio D. tipeos e impresiones.
Ella sueña ser conocida por todas como una gran promotora D. servicios D. buffet e implementar al máximo su negocio D. tipeos e impresiones.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Corazon D. Jesus" is composed of 11 highly committed associates who are punctual and responsible. They live in the same neighborhood, which is why they have shared the same community. They are very hardworking and have found EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD an opportunity to grow and expand. One example is María, who at 48 is a single woman with 3 children. She struggled to give her children an education and good values, and now she hopes that her businesses bear the fruit of her labor. María provides catering services for events such as birthdays, christenings, weddings, etc. She also receives a lot of support from her children, since most of them are responsible for managing her typing, copying, and printing business. María welcomed the growth of her businesses but she still hopes to implement more improvements. Thanks to the previous loan she was able to purchase a computer for her typing and printing service. She dreams of becoming well-known as a great caterer and becoming the best in the typing and printing business.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her catering business and aprons to sell

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Maria es madre de familia de tres hijos,  pues siempre ah ayudado a su familia con los gastos, ya que su esposo no ajusta con su salario es bajo ya que se desempeña como conductor.
Primeramente solo vendía tortillas, luego comienza hacer fritanga por las tardes logrando así ganar más. Nace la iniciativa de aumentar las ventas pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente lo que recurre al
Financiamiento logrando Así las mejoras en su pequeño negocio.
Ahora ha logrado poner una pequeña pulpería aunque con poco pero su objetivo es poder comprar productos y lograr hacerla crecer. Con este préstamo comprara: diez cajillas de huevos, dos cajas de sopas maggi, cloro, cuatro quintales de carbón, cinco quintales de maíz, queso entre otros para lograr llenar su venta.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of three children. She has always helped her family with the expenses since her husband does not earn enough money at his job as a driver.

At first Maria only sold tortillas, but she later began selling fried foods in the afternoons so that she could earn more. With her natural born initiative, she was able to increase her sales. However, she was left with insufficient capital, which is why she is resorting to financing in order to make improvements to her small business.

Maria now has a small grocery store. Her goal is to make it grow by acquiring more products a little bit at a time. This loan will be used to buy ten crates of eggs, two boxes of Maggi soup mix, bleach, four quintales (1 quintal = 46kg) of charcoal, five quintales of corn, cheese, and other products she needs to fill her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, soup mix, bleach, charcoal, corn, cheese, and other products

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco P. de 30 años, esta casado con el Sra. Celsa Duarte de 26 años, tienen 2 hijos uno de 9 años y otro de 7 años. 
Don Francisco se dedica a este trabajo hace más de  2 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2008; el con su esposa se fueron a la Argentina durante 3 años juntaron su dinero, luego vinieron y montaron una pequeña despensa, que va creciendo por el ingreso que genera, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada, y su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico. 
Ellos utilizaran este crédito en compra de mercaderias para su local comercial.
texts.en:
Francisco P. is 30 years old. He is married to Celsa Duarte, 26, and have two children aged 9 and 7. Francisco has been in this line of work for over two years, more or less since 2008. He moved to Argentina with his wife for three years and saved money. When they moved back they set up a modest store, which is slowly growing by generating more business. He now has an established customer base and the store is in a good location. They will use the loan to buy goods for their store.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Marbelly Dayana

texts.es:
Marbelly es una joven dedicada al trabajo y comercio pues ambas han sido su fuente de entrada, trabaja como secretaria desde hace nueve años, y vende cosméticos, productos Avon el cual nace la idea para lograr  pagar sus gastos ya que todo ah aumentado, su esposo trabaja como tipógrafo.
A través del financiamiento ha logrado comprar más productos, y una variedad de ropa, lo que ha venido a aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
Su casa es pequeña, y ha ido poco a poco construyendo.
Con este préstamo comprara: cremas para piel, vanidades, maquillaje, perfumes de dama y varón y  unos encargos de ropa.
Su objetivo es lograr la captación de clientes nuevos, colocar todos sus productos, para seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Marbelly is a young woman who is dedicated to both her job and her business since they both give her a source of empowerment. She has been working as a secretary for nine years and then came up with the idea of selling Avon cosmetics and products in order to pay for her expenses which have increased. Her husband works as a typographer.

With the help of financing, she has been able to buy more products and a variety of clothing. As a result, her earnings have increased and her household conditions have improved. Her house is small and she has been able to build a little bit at a time.

This loan will be used to by skin crèmes, compacts, make-up, men’s and women’s colognes, and clothing she has on order. Her goal is to attract new customers and be stocked with all of her products so that she can continue growing her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skin crèmes, compacts, make-up, men’s and women’s colognes, and clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Virtuosas se conformó en fecha 09 de abril del 2.010 gracias  a la Sra. Myrian. 
En la actualidad todos participan activamente en las reuniones semanales, y están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado, y desean seguir trabajando en conjunto ya que alcanzaron buenos resultados hasta ahora.
Una de las integrante es la señora Myrian, una señora muy activa y que trabaja constantemente para su familia.
Ella se dedica  a venta de frutas y verduras, y lo realiza recorriendo las casas de los clientes quienes ya la conocen y la consideran proveedora de frutas y verduras.
Así ella cuenta con clientela formada y cada dia sale a mercado para comprar las mercaderías que posteriormente sale a vender.
Comenta que la actividad es muy sacrificada pero que seguirá trabajando hasta conseguir el capital para abrir un puesto de ventas en el mercado y desde ahí realizar sus ventas.
Ella solicita en esta oportunidad el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras (papaya, plátanos, ananás, naranjas, cebollas, tomates y otros)
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas women committee was founded on April 9 2010 thanks to Myrian. All group members are actively involved in weekly meetings, are very grateful Fundacion Paraguaya for their support, and wish to continue to work together as they have had good results so far. One of the members is Myriam, a very active woman who works hard for her family. She sells fruits and vegetables from door to door. Her customers already know her and see her as their supplier of fruits and vegetables, so she has a good customer base. Every day she goes to market to buy the goods she later sells. She says that it's hard work but she will continue to work until she gets enough capital to open a market stall where to sell from. She would like to take this opportunity to request a loan to buy fruits and vegetables (papaya, bananas, pineapples, oranges, onions, tomatoes, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosalina tiene la edad de 25 años, es una joven con mucha energía al trabajo, un negocio que inicio hace cuatro años, con el objetivo de ayudar a sus padres.
Vende cosméticos, ropa, carteras, ropa interior, perfumenes, prenda de plata. El cual inicio con  dinero propio ya que trabajaba en servicios domésticos.
Su objetivo era cambiar de trabajo y lograr mejores condiciones personales.
Se afilia a la Avon, comenzando con poco, es por eso busca alternativas para lograr mejor inversión. Afodenic ha sido quien ha dado el apoyo mediante el crédito.
Comprara: ropa, prendas de plata, ropa interior para dama y caballeros, para seguir sastifaciendo al cliente con sus variedades de productos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a young woman who is 25 years of age and demonstrates tremendous energy in her work. She started a business four years ago in order to help her parents.

Rosalina sells cosmetics, clothing, handbags, undergarments, perfumes, and silver jewelry. She began using her own money that she earned providing housekeeping services. Her goal was to change jobs so that she could improve her personal living conditions. She started working with Avon because she is always looking for alternatives to improve her investments. AFODENIC is supporting her by providing her with a loan. She will buy clothing, silver jewelry, and undergarments for women and men so that she can continue satisfying her customers with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, silver jewelry, and undergarments

loans.name: Angel Medardo

texts.en:
Angel Medardo B. G. is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Angel is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Angel also works in agriculture and raises pigs and chickens. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Angel plans to use the credit to grow corn and the maracuya fruit. He believes that the loan will help him become more productive in agriculture. His dream is to have his own house. 

After work he likes to play sports.

loans.use: To grow corn and maracuya fruit

loans.name: Gilma Jeannett

texts.es:
Gilma resiD. en san miguel departamento D. san miguel, ella es madres soltera tiene tres hijos (Gerson, Oscar y xiomara) su esposo los abandono hace varios años desD. entonces ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas para la manutención D. sus hijos.
Trabaja en la venta D. tortillas hace 5 años las venD. dos veces al día D. 6 a 7 D. la mañana D. sus tres hijos solo estudian dos varones las niña xiomara D. 17 años no estudia ya que trabaja desD. muy pequeña junto con ella en la venta tortillas porque Vivian en una situación económica muy mal no tuvo otra opción que enseñarle a su hija el mismo oficio que ella para mejorar su condición D. vida,
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. maíz, leña y otros productos para la elaboración D. las tortillas y otra cantidad la utilizara para comprarle a su hijo Gerson un par D. aros o lentes para la vista ya que él tiene problemas D. visión.
Esto le ayudara a tener materia prima para la venta D. tortillas y que su hijo tenga sus lentes para ver mejor y que mejore su rendimiento escolar porque a veces él se siente deprimido por qué no pueD. distinguir lo que le ponen en la pizarra
sus aspiraciones son que su negocio crezca y sacar mejores ganancias y que su hijo Gerson se motive a seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gilma lives in San Miguel, department of San Miguel. She is a single mother and has three children (Gerson, Oscar and Xiomara). Her husband abandoned them several years ago. Since then she has been selling tortillas to support her children. She started selling tortillas 5 years ago and she sells them twice a day, from 6 to 7 in the morning. Out of her three children only the two boys are in school. The girl, Xiomara, who is 17 years old, doesn't, and has been working with Gilma selling tortillas since she was very young. This is because their financial situation was desperate and Gilma had no other option than to show her daughter her skills to help them improve their living conditions. The loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, wood and other products for the preparation of tortillas. With the money she will also buy her son Gerson a pair of glasses because he has sight problems. The loan will enable her to store raw materials for her tortillas and her son to see well and perform better at school; sometimes he feels sad because he can't see what's on the blackboard. She hopes that her business will grow and give better profits and that her son Gerson will find the motivation to continue to study.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood and other products to make tortillas

loans.name: Miguel Isidro

texts.en:
Miguel Isidro G. Beltrán is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Miguel is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Miguel also works in agriculture and raises pigs. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. 

Miguel plans to use the loan to raise more pigs. He says that with the help of the loan, his business will be more productive. His goal is to have his own house within the next five years. 

After work, he likes to play the guitar.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.en:
Rosa Elvira P. P. is 38 years old. She is single and lives with her son, Jonathan, in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. Her son is 8 years old. 

Rosa is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members. The majority of the group works in agriculture.  

Rosa works in agriculture. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Rosa plans to use the loan to improve her house and her agriculture. 

In her free time, she likes to spend time in the house and with her son.

loans.use: To grow corn and maracuya fruit

loans.name: Aida Mercedes

texts.en:
Aida Mercedes Y. C. is 41 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has seven children, ages 4 to 23 years. 

Aida is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Aida also works in agriculture and has been raising farm animals for the past 15 years. She does the buying and selling of her products in the town of Matilde Esther. 

She plans to use the loan to buy agricultural supplies. Her dream is to build a house. 

In her free time she likes to spend time at home. She enjoys the festivals of San Jose.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her crops

loans.name: Wilson Polibio

texts.en:
Wilson Polibio A. C. is 59 years old. He is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has 4 children, ages 35, 32, 18, and 16 years old.  

Wilson is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Wilson works in agriculture and raises pigs. He does the buying and selling of his products weekly in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. 

He plans to use the loan to improve his efficiency in agricultural production. His dream is to improve his house. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports and he enjoys the festivals of his community.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 40 años de edad, madre soltera y vive en compañía de su dos hijos en su casa que es propia, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica es la fabricación y venta de zapatos en un taller que tiene en su domicilio, trabajo por el cual lo hace por medio de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, quienes se dedican a vender calzados. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que este trabajo es muy rentable para solventar los gastos de su familia. En un futuro desea continuar trabajando muy duro para hacer crecer su taller y contratar más personas y así aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar mayor cantidad de materiales como cuero, pegamento para continuar con la fabricación de calzado.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her two children in her own house, which she managed to get thanks to a great deal of effort. She makes and sells shoes in a shop she has in her house. She works by orders that her customers, who sell shoes, make. She has been doing this for three years. She considers her work to be very beneficial in paying the family expenses. In the future she wants to continue working very hard in order to make her shop grow. She also wants to hire more people to increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. She wants to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of materials like leather and glue to continue making footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like leather and glue

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un pequeño comerciante, que ha logrado tener su propio estudio fotográfico desde hace veinte años, iniciando como trabajador de un canal local del país.
Luego decide independizarse para lograr mejores condiciones personales. Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero de su liquidación, luego para comprar más equipos necesarios para realizar su labor, hizo un financiamiento el cual fue aprobado.
Ahora es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic lograra invertir en comprar dos sensores de luz flash para vender calidad de servicios.
Gracias al apoyo de la institución y el esfuerzo ha logrado dar mantenimiento, comprar tecnología de punta. Así como tener su propio local de estudio.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a small businessman who established his own photography studio twenty years ago. He started working at a local station in the country. Alfonso later decided to become independent so that he could improve his personal conditions. When he started his business, he used the money from his severance pay to buy the necessary equipment for his work.

Alfonso is in his second loan cycle with AFODENIC. He will invest the proceeds in the purchase of two flashlight sensors so that he can improve the quality of his services. Thanks to the support from AFODENIC and his own efforts, Alfonso has been able to purchase and maintain the latest technology needed to establish his own studio.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two flashlight sensors

loans.name: Jefferson Orlando

texts.en:
Jefferson Orlando A. S. is 18 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. 

Jefferson is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Jefferson also works in agriculture. He does the buying and selling of his products weekly in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. 

Jefferson plans to use the loan to grow cacao. His dream is to build a house over the next few years. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports and he enjoys the annual festivals that his town sponsors.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria, madre de dos hijos, desde joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para apoyar a su familia, siendo su esposo conductor.
Ha trabajado en cocina de un pequeño negocio, pero también gracias a su tenacidad y empeño comienza  a vender ropa, cosméticos logrando adquirir buenas ganancias y captación de clientes
Han construido su casa de concreto aun falta poner el piso ya que es de tierra y que esperan hacer la mejora para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene.
A través del financiamiento ha logrado mantener el equilibrio de su negocio, tiene poco inventario y con este préstamo comprara: una docena de pantalones, docena de camisas, de varón, ropa interior, a si como domestico de productos Avon.
Doña Ana espera tener resultados positivos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is the mother of two children. From a young age, she has worked to support her family. Her husband works as a driver.

Ana worked in the kitchen of a small business, but thanks to her tenacity, she started selling clothes and cosmetics. She generates a good income and is attracting customers. Ana built a concrete house, but it is currently lacking a floor. She hopes to have one installed in order to provide cleaner conditions.

By utilizing loans she has been able to keep her business in balance. Since she has very little inventory, Ana will use this loan to buy a dozen trousers, a dozen men’s shirts, undergarments, and Avon products. She hopes to have positive results.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dozen trousers, a dozen men’s shirts, undergarments, and Avon products

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa S. R. is 34 years old, married, and lives with her family in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. She has two children named Edison and Kevin and they are 10 and 8 years old. 

Maria is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.   

Maria also works in agriculture and raises pigs. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Maria plans to use the loan to grow cacao. Her dream is to have a house within the next five years. 

In her free time, she likes to help her children with their homework.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto S. is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his family in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. He has 3 children, ages 9, 8, and 5. 

Roberto is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Roberto also works in agriculture. He has been growing cacao, corn, coffee and rice for the past 13 years. He also raises pigs. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Roberto plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops. His goal for the next five years is to have his own house and to keep advancing in his agriculture. 

He enjoys the community festivals of the Patron Saint San Jose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un joven, casado de 29 años de edad, siendo padres de dos hijos, junto a su esposa trabajan para lograr el alimentó diario. Anteriormente se dedicaba a soldar y con sus ahorros comienzan el negocio de venta de tortillas, nacatamales, cuajada.
Son siete años los que llevan en este negocio, los tres tiempos palmean tortillas saliendo a vender ambulantes por las calles del barrio.

Su objetivo con esta solicitud es poder comprar doce sacos de maseca, cuajadas, productos para elaborar más cantidad de nacatamal que se vende los fines de semana. Así como comprar maíz nuevo para hacer yoltamal, elotes cocidos y poder lograr el incremento de sus ventas.
Todos estos productos lo compran en distribuidora para lograr mejor precios y así dar a mejor precios sus ventas.
Contento por que a través de este financiamiento dará otro jiro a su inversión. Como planes es poder hacer su cocina de concreto para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene.
texts.en:
Julio is a young man who is 29 years of age and the father of two children. He and his wife work together to meet their daily needs. Julio previously worked as a welder, but with his savings he started a business selling tortillas, Nicaraguan tamales, and curds. He has managed this business for seven years. Julio makes tortillas three times per day and then sells them as a neighborhood street vendor.

His goal with this loan is to buy twelve sacks of cornmeal, curds, and ingredients needed to make more Nicaraguan tamales that he can sell on the weekends. In addition he will buy new corn for preparing “yoltamales” (tamales made with fresh corn instead of cornmeal) and cooked corn on the cob so that he can increase his sales. Julio buys all of his supplies from a distributor so that he can get the best prices and then sell his products at low prices.

He is pleased with this loan because it provides another source of investment. His plans include building a kitchen made of concrete so that he can have more sanitary conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase twelve sacks of cornmeal, fresh corn, curds, and ingredients for making Nicaraguan tamales

loans.name: Narcisa Beatriz

texts.en:
Narcisa Beatriz G. C. is 42 years old. She lives with her children in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. She has four children, who are ages 25, 23, 16, and 8. 

Narcisa is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Narcisa works in agriculture and has been raising animals for the past 12 years. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Narcisa plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for agriculture. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and keep working in agriculture. 

She likes to play sports and enjoys the festivals for the patron saint San Jose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her crops

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.en:
Maria Natividad G. B. is 35 years old. She lives with her parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 3 children, who are ages 8, 6, and 2. 

Maria is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Maria also works in agriculture and raises pigs. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Maria plans to use the loan to raise pigs. She would like to have a larger farm within the next five years. 

She enjoys her community's festivals for the patron saint San Jose.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to replace the wiring system in her home

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo M. A. is 45 years old. He lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. 

Ricardo is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Ricardo also works in agriculture. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Ricardo plans to use the loan to grow corn. His goal within the next five years is to have his own house. 

When he is not working, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Silvia Natividad

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella vende ropa desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa. 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, aunque no tienen muchos ingresos ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a su hijo de 17 años, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones etc. No tiene horario fijo porque sus ventas las hacen por pedido. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar la situación económica de su hijo. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y poder readecuarla.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 36, lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named Orchids because when it was discovered there were a lot of orchids). She has been selling clothes for years in order to help with the household expenses. She works alone and starts very early. Even though they do not have a lot of earnings, she continues working to give her 17 year old son a better life. She sells blouses, shirts, and pants, etc. She does not have a fixed schedule because her sales are done by order. She wants the loan to be able to buy clothes. The earnings will assure her son’s financial situation. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to be able to remodel it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Mujeres Bienaventuradas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES BIENAVENTURDAS ESTAN CONFORMADA POR PERSONAS MUY TALENTOSAS Y LUCHADORAS, UNA DE ELLAS QUIEN ES LA ENCARGADA DEL GRUPO ES DOÑA VILMA G., QUIEN  TIENE UN PEQUEÑA TORTILLERIA  EN SU CASA.  TIENE DOS TRABAJADORAS LA CUAL LE AYUDAN A QUE EL NEGOCIO CREZCA, CUENTA CON LA AYUDA TAMBIEN DE SU ESPOSO.  NO TIENEN HIJOS PEQUEÑOS TODOS SON MAYORES DE EDAD Y SIGUEN ESFORZANDOSE PARA PODER CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS.  DOÑA EVA KELITA TIENE UNA TIENDA  TIENE 4 HIJOS, Y CUENTA TAMBIEN CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, SU META ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO Y AGRANDAR LA TIENDA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO Y SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA.  LA SEÑORA AURELIA R. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE WAIPE Y DECEA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO A SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJO YA QUE ESTA EN EL ESTUDIO DE SU CARRERA.  SUS SUEÑOS SON QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN UNOS PROFESIONALES Y CON LA AYUDA DE DIOS DECEA SEGUIR VENDIENDO Y POR SUPUESTO NECESITA MAS CAPITAL PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA Y AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Bienaventuras” (Good Luck Women) Communal Bank is comprised of very talented and tenacious people. One of them, the person is charge of the group, is Vilma G.. She has a small tortilla shop in her house. She has two workers who help her so that her business grows. Her husband also helps her. They do not have young children. All of their children are adults who continue putting forth effort to be able to make their dreams and goals come true. Eva Kelita has a store and four children. Her husband also helps her to be able to invest in her business. Her goal is to continue growing and to make the store bigger. She wants to do this to help her husband and to get the family ahead. Aurelia R. sells fabric scraps, which are used mainly as rags. She wants to help her husband get her son ahead. Her son is studying for his career. Her dream is for her children to become professionals. With God’s help she wants to keep selling. Of course, she needs more capital to buy more merchandise and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store

loans.name: Welington Carlos

texts.en:
Welington Carlos C. C. is 43 years old. He lives in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has two children, who are ages 27 and 28. 

Welington is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Welington also works in agriculture and raises animals. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

He plans to use the loan for agricultural purposes and hopes that the loan will help him improve his crops. His goal is to keep progressing with his crops.

He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: To grow crops

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es: Ascensión tiene 62 años de edad, vive sola en su casa propia pues no se caso ni tuvo hijos. Al tener grandes dotes culinarios, Ascensión vio por conveniente sacarle provecho, es por eso que gracias a mucho esfuerzo puso un restaurante en su propia casa, el cual es su principal ingresos económico y el gran motivo para salir adelante. Lleva 8 años trabajando y se siente satisfecha por las rentas que le genera, pues su sazón ha trascendido, eso le ha dado mucha ventaja frente a sus clientes, ahora es muy conocida ella y su establecimiento. En un futuro quiere tener un gran restaurante muy bien implementado y con más empleados que brinden al cliente un mejor servicio, pues siempre fue su gran sueño. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará gran cantidad de ingredientes para preparar mayor cantidad de platillos y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ascension, 62, lives alone in a house that she owns. She has never married or had children. She is a gifted cook and, realizing that she could make a living cooking for others, overcame the obstacles in her way to open a restaurant in her house. The business is her main source of income. She has operated the business for 8 years and is pleased with the income that it generates. Her food is tasty and well-prepared, an advantage for gaining customers, and she and the business are now well known in the area. In the future, Ascension wants to improve the restaurant and add more employees so that she can better serve her customers. This is her first MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She will use the loan to buy wholesale stocks of the supplies she needs to run the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Marcia Felicita

texts.es:
Marcia de 32 años, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, , vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años, vendiendo a sus vecinos víveres completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Ahora vende granos, bebidas, lácteos, etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar bebidas y granos, en el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcia, 32, owns a small corner shop in her house. She lives in the Orquideas neighborhood of Guayaquil (an area of the city that was named for the orquids that used to be common in the area before it was developed). She started the business to support her two children, 4- and 2-years old. She started by selling everyday items to her neighbors and eventually pulled enough money together to set up the shop. She sells basic commodities, cold drinks, dairy products, etc. She works every day from 8:00 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening. To keep her business going, Marcia wants to buy products to stock the store. For the future, she wants to have enough money to set up a store for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: El Aguacate (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Aguacate se encuentra formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres, quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades pero con un solo propósito que es el de salir  adelante con sus familias, viven en la comunidad del Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus paisajes, su gastronomía y su gente que es calida y amable.

La Señora. Mercedes María A. vive en la comunidad del Aguacate, este es el primer crédito que realizar en la fundación, fue invitada por una amiga que era socia de otro banco comunal. Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura,  este  oficio aprendió de sus padres, cría  animales como: chanchos y becerros los mismos que los vende en su comunidad, cuenta con una pequeña tienda  que lleva 5 años en funcionamiento y  labora en ella desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m.
Doña Mercedes tiene de 62 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos son mayores de edad,  4 de ellos son casados y viven de manera independiente y solo uno es soltero que tiene 31 años de edad, es quien vive con ella y le ayuda económicamente, su esposo por su edad pasa en casa, cuentan con su casa propia la cual la construyeron en su juventud con  el trabajo y sacrifico de los dos. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, pollos y cuyes para la cría. Su meta es agrandar su tienda.

La Señora Sonia Beatriz C. vive en la comunidad del Aguacate, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo estudia en la escuela, su esposo no tiene un trabajo fijo por lo labora en el trabajo que le salga en ese momento, no tienen casa propia y por el momento viven en una casa prestada en donde no pagan arriendo. 
Doña Sonia hace un mes se dedica a trabajar en una fabrica de bloques siendo su oficio el de armar los moldes, labora de lunes a sábado desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., pero su verdadera profesión es estilista la cual espera ejercer muy pronto ya que con su crédito va a comprar las herramientas para iniciar su gabinete de belleza. Su sueño es estudiar en la universidad y sacar titulo de  medico.
texts.en:
The El Aguacate community bank has 10 members, all women, who operate different businesses that they started for the purpose of helping their families get ahead. The live in the Aguacate neighborhood of Cuenca, a Peruvian city known for its beautiful architecture, its cuisine, the surrounding countryside and the warm and friendly people who live there. Sra. Mercedes María A. lives in Aguacate. This is her first loan from the foundation. She joined the community bank after a friend told her about it. Dona Mercedes makes a living from farming and raising animals, work that she learned from her parents. She raises pigs and calves and sells them locally. She has also operated a small store for 5 years and she works there from 6:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening. Dona Mercedes is 62 years old, married and has 5 children, four of whom are married and independent. One son, 31, is single, lives at home and helps with the family's expenses. Her husband can no longer work. The couple live in a house that they built together, at some sacrifice, when they were young. Sra. Sonia Beatriz C. also lives in Aguacate. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children, 14- and 6-years old. Her oldest child, a girl, is in high school and her youngest child, a boy, has just started school. Her husband works at odd jobs but he doesn't have a steady income. They don't own a house so they live in one with no rent that has been loaned to them. A month ago, Dona Sonia started a job at a factory making cement blocks. She is responsible for setting up the molds for the blocks, work that she does Mondays to Saturdays from 7:00 to 5:00. She trained as a hair dresser, work that she would like to pursue, and she is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs to stock a salon. Her dream is to go to college and get a degree in medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for multiple businesses.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 60 años, es casado y vive junto a su esposa en el sector José Olaya del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. El suele ganarse la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores como ovejas y pavos para lo que cuenta con unos corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando sus animales  ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la siembra de frutas, especialmente limón y mango. Los productos que logra cosechar los ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras de la zona. Esta actividad solo le provee de ingresos durante algunas temporadas del año. Aun así el trata de obtener buenos resultados brindando todo su esfuerzo en las labores que realiza.

German desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, asimismo desea comprar alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentacion de sus animales. Para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

German es una persona honrada y trabajadora, durante la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado por sacar adelante a su familia y el tener a sus hijos independizados y convertidos en personas de bien lo llena de orgullo.
texts.en:
German, 60, is married and lives with his wife in Tambogrande, an agricultural area of Peru largely given over to growing fruit for export. Tambogrande is a sub-area of the province of Piura and is located in the region of the same name. It's more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. German has been a farmer all of his life. He raises animals like sheep and poultry which he keeps behind his house. When the animals are ready for market, he sells them to the buyers who travel through the area periodically. He also grows fruit, especially lemons and mangoes. He sells the crop that he manages to harvest to local processing plants. He can only collect on his efforts during certain seasons of the year so he tries to get the best results that he can for the difficult work that he does. German wants to improve the corral where he keeps his animals and buy a supply of feed for the animals that will improve their diet. He is applying for his first loan, for 500 new soles, from Edpyme Alternativa to meet his goals. German is an honest, hard-working man. He has spent his life working to support his family and to ensure that his children become good men and women, independent and a source of pride.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for livestock business.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es: Wilberto tiene 45 años de edad, al igual que su esposa Agustina, juntos lograron tener su propia casa a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, además tienen dos hijas que están al cuidado de ellos. Hace más de 6 años, que se dedica en la venta de ropa, negocio en el que su esposa la ayuda. Su forma de trabajo consiste en viajar a provincias para adquirir prendas novedosas y de buena calidad, de esa manera logra vender su mercadería. Con el tiempo han logrado la confianza del cliente y ahora son muy conocidos, no solo por la variedad de prendas que ofrece sino por  los precios cómodos en que pueden adquirir. En un futuro quieren tener un gran puesto en algún mercado muy concurrido donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería y así llevar mejores ingresos a su hogar. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere viajar a provincias para adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilberto and his wife, Agustina, both 45, succeeded in owning their own house after much effort and sacrifice. They have two daughters, both still in their care. With his wife's help, Wilberto has operated a business selling clothing for 6 years. He travels around looking for original clothing items, of good quality, to stock his business and resell. Over time, he has managed to gain the trust of his customers and he is now well known both for the affordable cost of his clothing and for the variety of items he can sell. In the future, he wants to have a large stall at some well-trafficked market where he can sell his merchandise and, in turn, improve his family's income. This is Wilberto's first MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time. He will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of clothing for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Melia Teresa

texts.es:
Melia es una mujer, con mucho deseo de superación, es por eso trabaja con mucho entusiasmo, ha formado su pequeño negocio la venta de nacatamales y venta de tortillas siendo ya ochos años en su negocio. En donde ha crecido y logrado las mejoras de su casa.
Que ha venido construyendo con préstamos que la institución ha financiado.
Para ella ha sido difícil, pero no imposible con la ayuda de su esposo que es albañil lo han logrado ya que no gastan en mano de obra.
Con este préstamo seguirá en la terminación de su casa que ha sido el objetivo como madre de familia para dar un techo digno a sus hijos.
Lo que a través de Afodenic ha sido más fácil por el apoyo en su construcción. Lo que esta contenta.
texts.en:
Melia is a woman who has the drive to succeed, which is why she works with great enthusiasm. Eight years ago, she started a business selling Nicaraguan tamales and tortillas. As a result of the growth of her business, she was able to make improvements to her home. She was able to pursue construction projects with the help of loans from AFODENIC. The projects have been difficult if not impossible. However, since her husband works as a stonemason, she does not have to pay for labor.

With this loan, she plans to finish the construction so that she can provide her children with a decent home. Melia is pleased because the support provided by AFODENIC has made the construction process a little bit easier.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of her house

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Alicia tiene 60 años, es una trabajadora mujer, vive en compañía de su esposo, ya que sus hijos son adultos e independientes. Es una mujer muy activa y siempre debe estar realizando alguna actividad productiva, es por ello que tiene dos trabajos, la primera, es la venta de productos de belleza y la segunda, es la venta de comida en el comedor popular de su barrio, en asociación con sus vecinas. Lleva casi 3 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien gracias a su buen trato con las clientas y la gran administración de sus ingresos. Alicia se siente contenta con sus actividades ya que se siente útil y productiva, espera en un futuro consolidar su negocio poniendo un bazar o un restaurante en su propia casa, ya que las dos actividades le encantan y aún no se ha definido por alguna de ellas. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser puntual como lo fue en su crédito anterior. El crédito que solicita, lo empleará en la compra de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock puesto que ya  tiene varios pedidos, con los cuales debe cumplir y además en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 60, is a hard-working woman. She and her husband live alone now that their children are grown and independent. Alicia is very active and always working at some money-making activity. That's why she has two businesses: the first is selling beauty products and the second, which she operates with some neighbors, is selling the kinds of prepared foods that are popular in the neighborhood. She has 3 years of experience and the businesses are thriving thanks to the level of service she provides to her customers and to her careful administration of the income from the businesses. Alicia is happy with the businesses because they make her feel useful and productive. In the future, she wants to consolidate the businesses by setting up a stall in a market, perhaps, or a restaurant in her house. She likes both businesses so consolidating them makes sense to her. This is Alicia's third MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time, just as she did the loans before. She will use the money to buy beauty products so that she can fill some existing orders and build a stock for future orders. She will also buy ingredients to make the prepared dishes she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es una agradable mujer de 48 años de edad, ella vive con su hija Pamela de 21 años y su nieto Cristopher de tan solo cuatro años de edad. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace ya 3 años en la venta de ropa, actividad que le ha dado grandes gratificaciones pues es una actividad tranquila que puede realizar en sus momentos libres, pues debe cuidar a su nieto. Graciela anteriormente trabajó en la venta de verduras pero enfermó y tuvo que dedicarse a una actividad más tranquila, es por ello que se siente contenta con su nueva actividad.
