Su forma de trabajo consiste en ir de casa en casa a ofrecer su mercadería tanto a vecinas y amigas, de esa manera asegura una buena venta. En un futuro ha pensado poner un bazar en su casa y este proyecto también la ayudará su hija. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de calcetines y otras prendas, para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela, 48, is a friendly woman. She lives with her 21-year old daughter, Pamela, and her grandson, Christopher, who is 4-years old. They live together in a house that Graciela owns. For 3 years, she has operated a business selling clothing, work that gives her a lot of satisfaction because it is relatively relaxed and she can work at it when she is not caring for young Christopher. Graciela once worked selling vegetables but she had to give it up when she became ill. She had to find a new business so she was happy to find this one. She sells by going door to door, to friends and neighbors, because that's the best way to ensure sales. For the future, she is thinking of setting up a stall in her house, a project that will also help her daughter. This is Graciela's second MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of socks and other clothing items to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Esteban Lidovino

texts.es:
Esteban nació en la ciudad de Lares provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate”. Actualmente, Esteban vive en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del mismo departamento, junto con su esposa y su hija Crisanta de 5 años. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Esteban estudiaba la carrera profesional de derecho en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco pero por motivos de dinero no pudo culminar su carrera. Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Esteban se dedicó a ayudar a abogados realizando documentación entones aprendió el oficio de defensor jurídico (Asesora asuntos judiciales: materia penal, civil y laboral y también realiza contratos, transferencias, minutas y otros. Después de trabajar en varias ciudades del departamento del Cusco haciendo documentos se traslado a la ciudad de Ocongate. Actualmente, Esteban trabaja en la ciudad de Ocongate y abrió una oficina de asesoría jurídica. Le pueden encontrar en su oficina de domingos a jueves, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Los días viernes y sábados trabaja en la ciudad de Tinqui como asesor jurídico, la ciudad de Tinqui está ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Ocongate.

Con el próximo préstamo que Esteban que recibirá,  el desea implementar su pequeña oficina, pues va comprar sillas y útiles escritorios. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Esteban was born in the city of Lares in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margarita Ocongate”. Esteban currently lives in the city of Ocongate in the Province and Department of Quispicanchis with his wife and five year old daughter named Crisanta. The city of Ocongate is located two hours away from the city of Cusco.

Esteban studied law at the National University of San Antonio Abad in Cusco, but he was not able to complete his degree because of financial reasons. He decided to help lawyers complete documentation and then trained to become a legal counselor (someone who provides advice on legal matters including criminal issues, civil issues, labor, contracts, transfers, fees, and other cases). After working in different cities within the Department of Cusco providing documentation services, he moved to the city of Ocongate. Esteban currently works in the city of Ocongate where he opened a legal counseling office. His office is open Sunday through Thursday from 8am until 4pm. On Fridays and Saturdays, he works in the city of Tinqui as a legal adviser. The city of Tinqui is located ten minutes from city of Ocongate.

With this next loan, Esteban will furnish his small office by purchasing chairs and office supplies. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs & office supplies

loans.name: José Patrocinio

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el sector Yencala – Garbanzal, una zonarural y agrícola del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace mas de tres años, el suele criar aves de corral y ganado ovino en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente complementa sus ingresos trabajando como obrero agrícola en los campos de cultivo cercanos.

José desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y lograr que se desarrollen de mejor manera, de este modo planea obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José es una persona que brinda todo su esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, de modo que pueda sacar a su familia adelante, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José is a 23-year-old father who lives with his wife and his young son in the area of Yencala-Garbanzaol. It is a rural and agricultural area in the district of Lambayeque, which is located in the province of Lambayeque, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has made a living by raising and selling animals for more than 3 years. He tends to raise poultry and sheep en some corrals near his home. When these have reached a good level of development, he sells them to his neighbors and to businesspeople that always come to the area where he lives. He also complements his income by working as an agricultural worker in the nearby fields. José hopes to acquire nutritionally-balanced feed to improve his animals so they will develop better. In this way, he plans to make better income when it comes time to sell them. To reach his goal, he saw the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 PEN. José is a person who puts all of his effort into the work that he does. In this way, he can take good care of his family. He has previously worked with our institution, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nutritionally-balanced feed for his small animals that he sells

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Inés vive en la ciudad que nació, junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos.  (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 20 años,  Inés vivía en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedicaban a la venta de pan. Mientras Ines vendía en la calle sus hijos vendían en los días de visita en el penal de “Quenqoro”. Inés y sus hijos también vendían empanadas pero no resulto el negocio porque no conseguían obtener el mismo sabor del pan de la zona entonces tuvieron que regresar a Ocongate. 
   
Inés tiene 61 años y se dedica a la venta de comida en la plaza de armas de Ocongate de forma ambulatoria. La pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta todos los días excepto el día sábado. Inés los días sábados lleva comida a un colegio no escolarizado pues tiene contrata con los dirigentes para vender comida en el colegio. Inés en sus horas libres se dedica a la  artesanía como por ejemplo confecciona chompas de lana de alpaca y otras cosas más.  

Con el próximo préstamo que Inés recibirá, ella desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Inés was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She’s a member of Asociación Arariwa Cusco’s “Las Margaritas Ocongate” communal bank. She currently lives in the city of her birth with her husband and five children. (Ocongate is located two hours from Cusco). Twenty years ago she lived in Cusco with her children. She and the children sold bread. While Inés sold in the streets, the children sold during visiting days at “Quenqoro” prison. Inés and her children also sold turnovers but the business didn’t succeed because they just couldn’t get the bread to taste the same in the area so they moved back to Ocongate. Inés is 61 years old and she sells prepared food in an itinerant manner in Ocongate’s main plaza. She can be found tending her food stand every day except Saturday. On Saturdays Inés takes food to an unaffiliated school because she has an agreement with the directors to sell food at the school. In her free time Inés is a craftsperson. She makes Alpaca wool jackets and other items. Inés will use the next loan she’ll get to buy ingredients like: rice, sugar, pasta and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given through this means and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like: rice, sugar, pasta and others.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 58 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en compañía de su hijo Israel de 26 años en su casa propia. El estar solo hizo que él busque una actividad a la cual pueda dedicarle todo su tiempo, puesto que su hijo trabaja independientemente y casi nunca para en casa, es por ello que optó por la venta de calzado. Esta actividad varía según las temporadas, es así que en la actualidad él viene dedicándose a la venta de sandalias con lo cual esta obteniendo buenos resultados. Su forma de trabajo es trasladarse por diferentes zonas del mercado de la zona en la que vive con su triciclo, en el cual pone toda la mercadería que posee para hacerla más vistosa. Manuel se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años por lo que gusta mucho su trabajo, pues gracias a su carisma ha hecho muy buenos amigos. En un futuro el desea tener un negocio más fijo en algún mercado concurrido pero por el momento se siente muy bien con esta actividad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería puesto que tiene las esperanzas de mejorar sus ingresos gracias a las buenas ventas que obtendrá.
texts.en:
Manuel is 58 and a very hard-working man. He lives with his 26-year-old son, Israel, in their own home. Being alone made him look for an activity to which he can dedicate all fo his time. His son works independently and is never home, so he chose to sell shoes. This activity varies according to the seasons. Currently he sells sandals and is seeing good results. He travels to different markets in the area where he lives with his tricycle, in which he puts all of the merchandise he has to make it more eye-catching. Manuel has done this work for 5 years, and he likes it a lot. Thanks to his charisma, he has made some very good friends. In the future, he hopes to have a more established business in a well-visited market, but at the moment, he feels good about his work. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has always characterized himself by being very punctual with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he will purchase more merchandise because he has hopes of improving his income thanks to the sales he will obtain.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more shoes to increase his income

loans.name: Mujeres De Sacsuy Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por  María Juana S. U.  tiene 53 años vive en el caserío lo cux aldea sacsuy, tiene 5 hijos  y se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado en San Juan Sac. Y San Raymundo, , también hace venta de refacciones  en las tardes  los fines de semana, Gloria Esperanza  C. S.  de 25 años,  tiene 1 hijo y  se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado en la ciudad capital, en el trébol , además hace blusas  y los vende desde hace2 años,doña Marta Alicia Vargas S. de 33 años tiene 5 hijos y se dedica a la venta de leña y tiene una pequeña tienda, además tiene animales  domésticos  y los vende, ella es la líder de este grupo con este crédito que está solicitando quiere agrandar su tienda, poner a la venta nuevos productos porque sus clientes le están pidiendo mas cosas, además quiere comprar más leña para tener almacenada  así cuando viene la época en que el precio se eleva, ella puede tener un poco mas de ganancias, ella espera que fape le de la oportunidad de agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
A member of this group is María Juana S. U.. She is 53 and lives in the town of Lo Cux Aldea Sacsuy. She has 5 children, and makes a living by selling pieces of chicken in San Juan Sac. and San Raymundo. She also sells spare parts in the afternoons and on weekends. Gloria Esperanza C. S. is another member. She is 25, has 1 child, and sells pieces of chicken in the capital city. She also makes blouses. She has done these activities for 2 years. Doña Marta Alicia Vargas S. is 33 and has 5 children. She sells firewood and has a small store. She also has domestic animals that she sells. She is the leader of this group. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to expand her store. She will sell new products because her customers are asking her for more items. She also wants to buy more firewood to be better-stocked because the season is coming where the prices are higher. She can make more profit this way. She hopes that FAPE gives her the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Viviana es conviviente, tiene un hijo que estudia en el jardín, Viviana viaja a las ferias de la región tres veces por semana en donde vende abarrotes en general y de las ferias compra cereales que luego los procesa en molino alquilado, producto que comercializa en los mercados.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Viviana son comprar un terreno céntrico para la construcción de su casa en donde pueda establecer un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Communal bank. She has a live-in boyfriend and one son who is in kindergarten. She travels to the markets in the region three times a week where she sells basic supplies. She also buys grains here which she then processes in a rented mill. She then sells the grain at the markets. Viviana needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of sugar and milk. Viviana's dreams are to buy a centrally-located piece of land to build a house where she can establish a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and milk

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Tranca Sasape, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de costura y confección de prendas de vestir, para realizar su trabajo cuenta con una máquina de escribir que le permite realizar su trabajo con mayor facilidad, ella trabaja en base a pedidos y debido al tiempo que lleva en esta actividad se ha podido hacer conocida en la zona y actualmente goza de una clientela fija que siempre acude a ella para solicitar sus servicios.

Marleny desea implementar su negocio con la compra de una remalladora, la cual le permitirá realizar de mejor modo sus trabajos de confección de prendas de vestir, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles.

Marleny es una joven tranquila y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con los gasos familiares. Anteriormente ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marleny is 22, is single, and lives with her parents in the sector of Tranca Sasape, a rural area that belongs to the district of Mórrope. This district is made up of various towns that are far away from each other. The area belongs to the province of Lambayeque, which is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She offers a sewing services and makes garments. To do her job, she has a writing machine that lets her do her work more easily. She works by taking orders, and due to the time she spends on this activity, she has been able to make herself known in the area and currently enjoys a fixed clientele that always turns to her to request her services. Marleny hopes to implement her business with the purchase of a sewing machine, which will let her make her clothing in a better way. To reach her goal, she thinks it is convenient to request a loan of 1300 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Marleny is a calm young lady who likes her work a lot. She uses the income she makes from it to pay for personal expenses and to help her family with their expenses. She has previously worked with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Cristina se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Cristina ayuda en la cocina del jardín de su hijo.
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Cristina vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para la construcción.
texts.en:
Cristina lives with her partner and has three children, who are in school. Cristina sells clothing to order to her friends and family. Most of her sales are made on credit. Additionally, Cristina helps cook for her son’s nursery school. Cristina is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Community Bank, and she needs a loan for 1000 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of pants and jackets. Cristina lives in a rented house, and her biggest dream is to buy land to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es: El solicitante es conviviente hace mas de 1 año vive en casa propia no tiene hijos tiene una movilidad que maneja  y por temporadas se dedica a la mina es por ello que pudo construir su casa de material noble y comprarse su movilidad cuenta con buenas referencias personales , solicita dicho credito para mantenimiento de su movilidad se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
The loan petitioner is in a common law marriage, lives in his own home and doesn't have children. He has a vehicle [taxi] that he drives and occasionally works in a mine. These have enabled him to build a house with quality materials and buy his vehicle. He has good personal references. He is requesting a loan to maintain his vehicle and has approved for his ability and more importantly his willingness to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos que ya son profesionales, ahora vive sola, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada y ropa de cama, negocio que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo hace 15 años y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de cobertores y frazadas.
El único sueño de Julia es ahorrar lo suficiente para su vejez.
texts.en:
Julia is a single mother with six children who are now professionals, and lives alone. Julia has a small shop in the 12 de Abril market where she sells clothing, and bedding. She works there every day with products the gets in Lima. Julia has been a member of the Triunfo community bank for the past 15 years. She is requesting a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles to buy bedspreads and blankets. Julia's biggest dream is to save up enough for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads and blankets

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es: El  SR. VLADIMIR  tiene 38 años vive en casa  de su madre es  separado tiene 1 hijo   de 6 años quien vive con su madre tienen una movilidad  que  lo  administra  su  ex conyuge  es  por ello que no se le esta  considerando en la evalaucion de su carro ,solo  se esta evaluando el ingresos como chofer, cuenta con buenas referencias personales no tiene experiencia crediticia, solicita dicho credito para gastos personales se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo volunta de pago.
texts.en:
Mr. Vladimir is 38 years old, and he lives in his mother’s house. He is separated from his wife and has a six-year-old son, who lives with his mother. His ex-wife manages the vehicle that they share. As a result, he can only count on income from his work as a driver, not from the vehicle itself. He has good personal references, even though he doesn’t have credit history. He is requesting this loan for personal expenses that he plans to use wisely and, above all, plans to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Betzabe Marleny

texts.es:
Betzabe pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año y aprendió a ser responsable.
Betzabe es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Betzabe vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Betzabe junto a su esposo tienen un grifo en la selva ayacuchana.
Betzabe necesita un préstamo de 600 soles para la compra de chompas.
Betzabe vive en casa alquilada y desea tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Betzabe has belonged to the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for a year, and she has learned to be responsible. Betzabe is married and has three children. She sells clothing to order, which she sells to her friends and family. Most of her sales are made on credit. Additionally, Betzabe and her husband have a gas station in the Ayacucho jungle. Betzabe need a loan for 600 nuevos soles to buy sweaters. She lives in a rented house, and wants to own her own home and to have her children be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa alquilada, la mayor estudia en el colegio y el ultimo tiene 6 meses de nacida, Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 3 años.
Rosa tiene un salón de belleza en un local alquilado, hace 2 meses cambio de local y sus ventas están mejorando, también vende cosméticos por catalogo, además tiene una fuente de soda que inicio cuando cambio de local.
Rosa solicita un crédito de 600 soles para la compra de leche, frutas, panes.
Rosa sueña con tener una casa propia, un carro y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and she has 2 children, one in school and the other is 6 months old. Rosa lives in a rented house and she has been a member of the communal bank Sol Radiante for 3 years. Rosa has a beauty salon in a rented space. 2 months ago she moved to a different location and her sales are improving. She also sell cosmetics through a catalog as well as having a soda fountain that she started when she moved. Rosa is requesting a loan of 600 sols to buy milk, fruit and bread. Rosa's dream in to have her own house, a car, and to be able to give her daughters a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, fruit and bread

loans.name: Nilda Rosa

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Pacora, uno D. los distritos que conforman la provincia D. Lambayeque, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura y se encuentra ubicado a mas D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores, especialmente D. cuyes y conejos, ella cría los animales en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y negociantes que visitan la zona esporadicamente. Ella alimenta sus animales con pastos naturales y granos y se vale D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Nilda desea mejorar la alimentación D. sus animales para obtener mayores ingresos al momento D. venderlos, por ello ha creído conveniente colisitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. alimento balanceado y en la mejora D. corrales.

Ella es una mujer hacendosa y trabajadora. Sus hijos ya están independizados y ello la llena D. orgullo. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer honrada y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Nilda, 58 years old, is married and lives with her husband in the Pacora district, one of the districts that make up the province of Lambayeque. Its principal economic activity is agricultural, and it is more that one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She raises and sells small animals, especially guinea pigs and rabbits. She raises them at home and sells them to her neighbors and to business people that sporadically visit the area. She feeds the animals natural grasses and grains, and she does this work to help her husbund, who is a farmer, with household expenses. Nilda wants to improve her animals' diet to get a better sale price for them; therefore, she thought it would be wise to request for the first time a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375) from Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest the loan proceeds in a balanced diet and in improvement of the animals' housing. Nilda is a hard-working woman. Her children are now independent, and she is very proud of them. Neighbors and acquaintances consider her an honorable and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a balanced diet and improve the housing for her animals

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Luzmila vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Luzmila tiene una tienda donde vende productos agro veterinarios como por ejemplo abono que sirve para los terrenos de cultivos y también tiene  un hospedaje con cinco cuartos. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo que Luzmila va recibir S/. 2000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar urea. 

Ya son tres años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas.
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luzmila was born in the city of Ocongate, in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department, and she belongs to the “Las Margarita Ocongate” Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa Cusco. Currently, Luzmila lives in her hometown together with her husband and their four children. (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco). Luzmila has a shop where she sells agricultural and veterinary products like fertilizer, for example, which is for the fields, and she also has a five-room hostel. She can be found at home seven days per week. With this loan, she will receive 2000 new soles. She would like to use the loan money to buy urea. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years now, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the confidence of her companions and the punctuality of the payments. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy urea

loans.name: Marcia Susana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Marcia Susana C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Expansión, vive por un sector muy conocido como es Vizorrey en la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es parte de la belleza cuencana, al igual que sus ríos, su gente, y su gastronomía.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres colaborando en lo que puede en el hogar. Trabaja en el comedor que es de propiedad de su madre en el cual labora hace 18 años, su horario es de 7 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., también se dedica a la venta de los productos de medicina natural Omnilife, sus ventas las realiza de 5 p.m. hasta las 8 p.m.
 
Es el cuarto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga que es socia, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de Omnilife, su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
La Señorita Marcia Susana C. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres en Expansión (Successful Women). She lives in a well-known area: Vizorrey in the city of Cuenca. This area, as well as its rivers, people, and food, is part of the beauty of Cuenca. Our member is 28 years old, single, and lives in her parent's house. She assists with various jobs in the home. She has worked in her mother's dining room since she was 18. She begins work at 7 a.m. and ends at 4 p.m. She also sells Omnilife natural medicines from 5 in the evening until 8 p.m. This is her fourth loan with the communal bank. A friend invited her to become a member. This new loan will be invested in Omnilife products. Her goal is to promote the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products.

loans.name: Gabriela Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Gabriela inicia ciclo 13 con 18 socias que realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso de Isidora que es fiscal del Banco Comunal y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo del ahorro y distraerse con las socias de su Banco. Isidora es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo de 11 años que esta estudiando, vive en casa alquilada y su sueño es tener casa propia.
Isidora junto a su esposo tienen una tapicería en un local alquilado, negocio que inicio hace un año, anteriormente vendía abarrotes en el mercado Las Americas negocio que dejo de realizar porque las ventas eran bajas.
Isidora solicita un crédito de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de espuma e hilos.
Isidora desea implementar con mas servicios y maquinarias su tapicería.
texts.en:
The Gabriela Community Bank is starting cycle 13 with 18 members who have different businesses. Isidora is a member of the Community Bank and she is most grateful for the incentive to save and being able to spend time with the other Bank members. Isidora lives with her partner. She is 35, married and has one 11-year-old child who is in school. She lives in a rented home and her dream is to have her own house. Isidora and her partner have an upholstery business in a rented location. They started this business a year ago. Previously, she sold groceries in the Las Americas market. She stopped doing this because sales were low. Isidora is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of foam and wire. Isidora wants to have more services and machines in her upholsterer's shop.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of foam and wire

loans.name: Hilda Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda Rosa López es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Expansión, vive por un sector muy conocido como es Vizorrey en la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es parte de la belleza cuencana, al igual que sus ríos, su gente y su gastronomía.
 
Doña Hilda tiene  46 años, es casada  y tiene 4 hijos de 30, 28, 22 y 20 años de edad, todos sus hijos son solteros, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, dos de sus hijos  estudian en la universidad, su esposo es mecánico de profesión y  labora en su propio taller de mecánica industrial, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Hilda se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un puesto en el Terminal terrestre hace 18 años, ella se  levanta  a las 5 a.m. para terminar de  preparar sus productos, los mismos que termina de vender alrededor de las 2 de la tarde, luego  arregla su local y cocina para el día siguiente terminando su trabajo a las 8 de la noche. Hace un mes y medio se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural Omnilife,  este crédito es para comprar estos  productos y también para la compra de víveres para su negocio, este es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación, fue invitada  por su hija quien tambien es miembro del banco comunal por algún tiempo, su meta es crecer en su nuevo negocio de Omnilife.
texts.en:
Hilda Rosa López is a member of the Mujeres de Expansion Community Bank. She lives in a very well-known area, Vizorrey, in the city of Cuenca. This area adds to the beauty of Cuenca; its rivers, its people and its cuisine. Mrs Hilda is 46, married, and has 4 children ages 30, 28, 22 and 20. All of her children are single, work and help her economically. Two of her children are in university. Her husband is a mechanic and works in his own industrial workshop. With their work they have been able to build their own home. Mrs Hilda sells food. She has had a stall in the bus station for 18 years. She gets up at 5 am. to finish making her products, and she finishes selling them around 2 pm. She later organizes her premises and cooks for the next day, finishing her work at 8 pm. For a month and a half she has sold Omnilife natural medicine products. This loan is for the purchase of Omnilife products and also for the purchase of supplies for her business. This is her first loan with the Fundacion. She was invited by her daughter who has been a member of the community bank for some time. Her goal is to expand her new Omnilife business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of meat, potatoes, rice, vegetables, etc, and Omnilife products.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita S. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Rosita is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Rosita provides an entertainment service with video games like Rambo, Pacman, Roadrunner and more. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Un Millon De Amigos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Millón D. Amigos esta conformado por 11 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades como la venta cereales, ropa, comida, calzados.
Como es el caso D. Alejandra que es Fiscal D. su Banco Comunal y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro con lo cual tiene proyectado construir su casa, actualmente vive en la casa D. su hermana. Alejandra en los próximos días comprara un terreno para su casa. Alejandra es soltera, tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 esta a su responsabilidad, Alejandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, negocio que inicio hace 6 meses y le esta yendo muy bien, además Alejandra venD. comida los días sábados y domingos en el mismo lugar.
Alejandra solicita un préstamo que será invertido como parte D. pago para la compra D. un terreno.
Los sueños D. Alejandra son construir su casa y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Millón D. Amigos [A Million Friends] Community Bank has 11 members who have different jobs such as cereal sales, clothing sales, food sales, and shoe sales. Alejandra is a member of this community bank. She is most grateful for the incentive to save money, with which she plans to build her house. She currently lives in her sister's home. In the next few days Alejandra will buy land for her home. Alejandra is single and has 4 children, of whom only 1 is her responsibility. Alejandra has a store in her home where she sells general groceries: meat and vegetables. She started this business 6 months ago and it is going very well. Alejandra also sells food on Saturdays and Sundays. She is requesting a loan which will cover part of the payment for her land. Her dreams are to build her home, and that her daughter will be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of land.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Rachel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rachel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Rachel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Gloria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

To make a living, Laila owns & operates a general retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Laila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Laila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Laila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut N. is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Ketut N. is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sarwa Wiguna (PK-10252).

Ni Ketut N. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut N. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut N. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut N. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut N. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Ketut N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.



"

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Lisbeth vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y su hijo de diez meses de nacido. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 
	
Lizbeth es una mujer joven y humilde que tiene 20 años, ella abrió una pequeña librería. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10  de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo, Lizbeth que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, cuadernos, cartulinas, lapiceros y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es abrir más librerías.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lisbeth was born in the city of Ocongate, which is in Quispicanchis Province of the Department of Cusco. Currently, Lisbeth lives in the city where she was born, together with her husband and their ten-month-old son. (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco). Lisbeth is a humble young woman who is 20 years old. She opened a small bookstore. She can be found in her store seven days per week, from eight in the morning until ten at night. With this next loan, Lisbeth expects to receive 1000 new soles. She would like to use the loan money to buy merchandise like, for example, rice, notebooks, cards, ballpoint pens and many things the store is lacking. For two years now she has been a member of the “Las Margarita Ocongate” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa Cusco, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the confidence of her companions and punctuality of the loan payments. This member's dream is to open more bookstores. Lisbeth is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise like rice, notebooks, cards, ballpoint pens and other items

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie J. is from Banaderos Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old, married, and has 4 adult-aged children. Tessie owns and operates a transportation services business which provides motor transport to clients. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years. In 2006, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so she can provide better service. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

Creselda owns and operates a transportation business which provides "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) services. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Creselda is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Melinda B. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. Melinda owns and operates a transportation business which provides tricycle transport like "habal-habal" (sa motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) services. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

In 2010, Melinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Publo Nuevo uno de los distritos que conforman la provincia de Ferreñafe. Se encuentra ubicado a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a brindar servicio de arado de campos de cultivo, cuenta con un tractor con el que trabaja brindando este servicio a diversos agricultores de la zona. El negocio cuenta con bastante demanda debido a que la zona de Ferreñafe es predominantemente agrícola y se realizan dos campañas de siembra al año. Este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante y trabajar por el bienestar de su familia.

Debido a su continuo uso el vehículo ha sufrido algunas fallas que necesitan repararse para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para realizar esta cción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Manuel es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder otorgarle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen. En la zona, debido a su trabajo, el es bastante conocido y estimado.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 54-year-old father. He lives with his wife and children in the Publo Nuevo district, part of the Ferreñafe province. It is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years he has provided a ploughing service for farmers' fields. He has a tractor with which he offers this service to various farmers in the area. There is plenty of demand for this business, since the Ferreñafe area is predominantly agricultural, and they plant yearly. This business has allowed him to get ahead and work for the well-being of his family. Due to the continual use of this vehicle, it has had some problems which require repairs to guarantee proper functioning. In order to do this, he has decided to request his first loan, 1500 soles, from Edpyme Alternativa. Manuel is a hard-working and very responsible person. His greatest wish is to keep working to be able to offer his family the quality of life that they deserve. In the area, thanks to his work, he is very well-known and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair costs and maintenance for his tractor to offer a ploughing service

loans.name: Rowena's Group

texts.en: Rowena A. is from the village of Taboc Sur Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Rowena is married and has 3 school-aged children. Rowena owns and operates a business in which she makes and sells food in the local community, primarily sea foods such as fish and shrimp. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. Rowena is the group leader. Her group has two members, and the members of the group are responsible for repayment of loans if a member defaults. In 2010, Rowena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Aireen T. is from the village of Taboc Sur Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, single, and has 1 infant-aged child. Aireen owns and operates a specialized retail store which sells dry goods in the local community. Aireen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aireen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Tipan Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old. Rosita is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While the members of the group each receive an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosita is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a business selling charcoal in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy more charcoal. This will be Rosita's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help meet the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut W. is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Ketut W. is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tunjung Wiguna (PK-10254).

Ni Ketut W. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut W. owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut W. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 90,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut W. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut W. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ni Ketut W. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.



"

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Leticia vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos.  (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 19 años, Leticia tiene un restaurante llamado “Kutimuy” (termino en quechua que significa “Regresa”) donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena para a unos 80 clientes cada día. La pueden encontrar en su restaurante, que está equipado con sillas y mesas, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Leticia desprende una imagen de experiencia y profesionalidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su puesto y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del desayuno,  almuerzo y cena. 

Con el próximo préstamo, Leticia que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, arroz, fideos y aceite. 

Ya son tres años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es comprar un carro y una cisterna.  
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leticia was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She belongs to the “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Arariwa Ascociación of Cusco. Leticia currently lives in the city where she was born. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. For 19 years Leticia has had a restaurant named “Kutimuy” (a term in Quechua meaning “Come Back”). She makes breakfast, lunch, and dinner for 80 customers everyday. She can be found in her restaurant, which is equipped with tables and chairs, seven days a week from seven in the morning until nine at night. Leticia is the very image of experience and professionalism. A regular flow of customers visit her restaurant, and business picks up during breakfast, lunch, and dinner times. With the next loan Leticia hopes to receive 1,000 soles. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy supplies like sugar, rice, noodles, and oil. She has participated in the communal bank for three years. It is going very well for her thanks to the reliability of her colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. Her dream is to buy a car and a cistern. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies like sugar, rice, noodles, and oil

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Clorinda vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos de las cuales dos están vivos y uno falleció.  (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 12 años, Clorinda  que se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, ella en su domicilio tiene un galpón donde aproximadamente tiene 300 cuyes, ella vende a S/. 20 nuevos soles cada cuy a las personas que tiene restaurantes y a sus vecinas o amigas.  
Clorinda es una persona muy amigable y carismática también se dedica a preparar cuy al horno a las personas que vistan su domicilio. Al lado de su casa, Clorinda tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra pasto y alfalfa que sirven de alimento para los animales. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo que Clorinda espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar semillas y abono. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es construir un centro recreacional en su domicilio.
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clorinda was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She belongs to the “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Arariwa Ascociación of Cusco. Clorinda currently lives with her husband and children in the city where she was born. She had three children, two are living and one died. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Clorinda has been raising small animals like guinea pigs for 12 years. She has a shed at home with approximately 200 guinea pigs. She sells them to people who have restaurants and her neighbors and friends for .20 soles each. Clorinda is a very friendly and charismatic person. She also sells baked guinea pigs to the people who visit her house. At the side of her house Clorinda has some fields where she plants grass and alfalfa; they serve as feed for the animals. She can be found seven days a week in her home. With the next loan Cloridna hopes to receive 1,000 soles. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She has participated in the communal bank for two years. It is going very well for her thanks to the reliability of her colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. Her dream is to build a recreational area at her house. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Yoni nació en la ciudad de Marcapata provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Yoni vive en la ciudad Ocongate junto con su esposo y su hija de un año de nacida. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Yoni es una mujer joven y humilde que tiene 23 años, que abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en una habitacion alquilada y está ubicado en la calle Libertad de la ciudad de Ocongate. A Yoni la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo, Yoni que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos  y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es abrir más tiendas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yoni was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Yoni currently lives with her husband and one year old daughter in the city where she was born. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Yoni is a humble young woman who is 23 years old. She opened a small grocery store in her rented home. It is located on Libertad street in the city of Ocongate. Yoni can be found in her store seven days a week from eight in the morning until ten at night. With the next loan Yoni hopes to receive 1,000 soles. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and many other things that her store does not have. She has participated in the communal bank for two years. It is going very well for her thanks to the reliability of her colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. Her dream is to open more stores. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and many other things

loans.name: Rosa Grimaldina

texts.es:
Rosa nació en la ciudad de Quiquijana provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Rosa vive en la ciudad Ocongate junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 22 años, Rosa que abrió una tienda que le puso de nombre “ROSSY” donde vende productos de ferretería, mueblería, construcción, librería y cocina  y esta ubicado en su domicilio y se encuentra en la calle Libertad de la ciudad de Ocongate. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo, Rosa que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar palas, picos, muebles, alambres, clavos  y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es abrir mas tiendas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Quispicanchis in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Rosa currently lives with her husband and their five children in the city of Ocongate. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Rosa opened a store named “Rossy” 22 years ago. She sells hardware, furniture, construction, book, and kitchen products in her store. It is located in her house, which is on Libertad street in the city of Ocongate. She can be found in her store seven days a week from eight in the morning until eight at night. With the next loan Rosa hopes to receive 1,000 soles. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy merchandise like shovels, picks, furniture, wires, nails, and many other things that her store does not have. She has participated in the “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Arariwa Ascociación of Cusco for two years. It is going very well for her thanks to the reliability of her colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. Her dream is to open more stores. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila D. is from the village of District 1. She is 40 years old. Nila is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Nila owns and operates a general store. Nila has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Nila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nila is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be Nila's fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. T. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Maloray, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, fish selling, and farming. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7500, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eleventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to stock her general store with a bigger volume of the basic commodities that she sells.  In this way she can continue to save up for future plans for her family. Merlinda D. T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To restock her general store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida F. is a single woman who lives in Prk. 2, Brgy. Inalad, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general (sari-sari) store.  Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks and basic commodities to sell in her general store so that she could continue to save up for the future, improve her living conditions, and have more opportunities for expansion. Aida F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4000. 

Lourdes  is borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can purchase more stock for her general store. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie B. is happy and excited about the support she got from Kiva lenders for a previous loan for her farming business. Reggie prays they will all be blessed. She has a sound and solid relationship with Kiva/ASHI partnership.

She has applied for another Kiva loan of PHP 33,000 to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and other supplies to further improve crop production. She is sure to improve her business due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva Lenders. Reggie does her best to develop her farm and hopes to have a rice production business some day. The sacrifices that she has made give her strength to survive poverty. 

Reggie hopes that the business will continue to succeed; it has been the family's livelihood for more than 10 years and will help them achieve the dream that their children, aged from 18 to 25, will graduate from college and have the best in life.

The picture is of Reggie with her supportive husband, Vicente.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of Manano, Mallig. She is 52 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Lilia has a general store selling a variety of different products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
