loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno nació en la ciudad de Carhuayo y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la Asociación Arariwa. Actualmente, Benigno vive en la ciudad de Ocongate junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos de las cuales dos están vivos y uno falleció.  (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Actualmente, Benigno trabaja en la municipalidad de Ocongate como asistente del teniente alcalde. Ya son 4 años que trabaja en la municipalidad y le va muy bien. Le pueden encontrar en su oficina de la municipalidad, los 6 días de semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Hace 12 años, Benigno que se dedica a la producción de truchas, el tiene 8 pozas de agua en su domicilio donde se encuentra las truchas. La idea de abrir este negocio fue cuando la municipalidad del lugar decidido dar charlas de capacitación acerca de la crianza de truchas. Benigno vio en este tema una gran oportunidad para dedicarse al negocio, al principio le fue complicado pero ahora es un hábil productor de truchas. Benigno vende sus truchas a sus amigos, vecinos, a gente que tiene restaurantes y a otras más. Benigno y su esposa también preparan trucha al horno para las personas que vienen a visitar su granja. Benigno quiere dedicarse solamente a distribución y venta de crías de truchas a diferentes piscigranjas de la zona de Ocongate. 

Con el próximo préstamo, Benigno que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar más crías de truchas. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es construir una centro recreacional en su domicilio.
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Benigno was born in the city of Carhuayo . He belongs to “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Arariwa Ascociación. Benigno currently lives in the city of Ocongate with his wife and their two children. He had three children, but one of them died. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Benigno works in the Ocongate municipality as an assistant to the mayor. He has worked in the municipality for four years, and it is going very well for him. He can be found in his office in the municipality six days a week from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. For 12 years Benigno has devoted himself to trout production. He has eight ponds of water, where the trout can be found, at his house. He got the idea to open this business when his municipality decided to present training talks on how to raise trout. Benigno saw that there was a great opportunity for a business of raising trout. At the beginning it was complicated, but now he is an adroit trout producer. Benigno sells his trout to his friends, neighbors, people who have restaurants, and others. Benigno and his wife also prepare baked trout for the people who come to his farm. Benigno wants to work only with the distribution and sale of young trout to different fish farms in the Ocongate area. With the next loan Benigno hopes to receive 1,000 soles. He would like to use the money from this loan to buy more young trout. He has participated in the communal bank for two years. It is going very well for him thanks to the reliability of his colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. His dream is to build a recreational facility at his house. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more young trout

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa E. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tunga, Mntañeza, Malabuyoc, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food and vegetable vending business. Her husband, Sabiniano E., who is 63 years old, helps his wife operate the business.  They have four children who are 28 to 34 years old. 

Elsa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to purchase additional stock to sell for her general store and food vending business, so that she can continue to save up for their future and to provide her family with additional income. Elsa E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

Remedios C., from the village of Brgy. Tuoa North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios has been raising pigs for breeding for over four years, earning approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Darryl

texts.en:
Darryl L. is from the village of Casusan in the municipality of Aloran in Misamis Occidental Province. He is 28 years old. Darryl is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Darryl works in someone else's service-based business. The main source of income for this business comes from providing general services in "motor repair" to local community members. Darryl has been engaged in this business for over 5 years, and he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Darryl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Darryl is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Darryl from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Estrelita D. is from the village of Barangay Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Estrelita owns and operates a salon providing manicure and pedicure services to the local community. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Estrelita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella’s biggest dream is to have a successful pig farm someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of hog fattening is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of shortage.  Over the years she has provided for her family by being involved in hog fattening.

Hog fattening is a kind of business wherein, after four months of raising or fattening hogs, the hog will be sold to people in their village or in the market, either alive or slaughtered. The larger the volume of hogs being sold, the larger the profit. Therefore, Annabella can put up a savings fund for her four children whose age range is from eight to twenty years old. Through this she hopes to support their education until they graduate from college, and hopefully they will have a better life in the future.

Now she is proposing a new loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos to continue supporting her hog fattening ventures. Annabella will buy additional piglets, sacks of feed, and supplements and vitamins for the pigs. She will raise them for approximately four to six months until they are ready for sale. She is hopeful that her hog fattening business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

Annabella thanks ASHI (a KIVA partner) for providing her with the opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful.

loans.use: To continue supporting her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia J. is a widow who lives in San Roque, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: vegetable vending and a general store. Constancia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Constancia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and vegetable business so that she can continue to save up for the future and to provide her family with their monthly expenses. Constancia J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team page and become a part of our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy B. is from the village of La Paz in the municipality of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur Province. She is 50 years old. Lucy is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Lucy owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products like "sasing" and "bulinaw" in the local community. Lucy has been engaged in her business for over 8 years, and she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna T. is a 46-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: a general store and a pig fattening business. She lives in the village of Batuan in the municipality of Valladolid in Negros Occidental Province.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1984 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 13,000 PHP.

Edna is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to use as additional working capital for her businesses. This will be her fourteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To add working capital to her businesses

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa B. is from the town of Calamagui, San Pablo. She is 47 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tomasa makes and sells candy to members of her community. Tomasa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Tomasa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tomasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Tomasa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Tomasa from ASKI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general Store and a pig fattening business. Her husband Melvin, who is 40 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are aged one to 15 years old. 

Ritchel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,500 PHP, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 21st cycle loan, she is borrowing 49,500 PHP, with which she intends to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store (a neighborhood general store) so that she can continue to save up for the future and the education of her children.  Ritchel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for a small general store.l

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Idalia del Carmen R. D. D. D. 44 años D. edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos, D. 20, 17 y 11 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar, y quien se ha convertido en el gran apoyo D. Idalia, para poder contar con una vida mejor, ya que durante años ella ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, debido a que ella es madre soltera, la cual no había poseído ningún tipo D. ayuda. Idalia trabaja comercializando pollos D. engorD., los cuales cría en su casa D. habitación, y que posteriormente venD. en su puesto el cual se encuentra ubicado en el mercado Municipal D. Usulután, mismo departamento en el cual resiD. junto a su familia. D. esta manera ella se encarga D. alimentarlos y darles todo el cuidado necesario para que los pollos crezcan sanos y gordos, D. manera que sean bastante atractivos para las personas que los compran. Idalia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. pollos pequeños, así mismo para comprar concentrado, el cual es el nombre del alimento para pollos, y D. esta forma poder contar con todo lo necesario para hacer que su negocio prospere y siga siendo rentable para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Idalia del Carmen R. D. D. is 44. She lives with her 3 children, ages 20, 17 and 11. The oldest works and is a great help to Idalia, helping them to have a better life. She has worked very hard for years to get her children ahead, since she is a single mother who has not had any sort of help. Idalia works selling fattened chickens which she raises in her home. She sells them in her stall in the Usulutan Municipal Market; this is the same municipality in which she and her children live. Through this work, she is able to get food and proviD. all the necessary care for her chickens to grow up healthy and fat, so that they are very attractive for her customers. Idalia is requesting a loan through which she will be able to purchase more small chickens, and concentrate to feed them. This way she will be able to have everything necessary to make her business prosper and continue to be profitable for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino G. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte, Ilagan. He is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children.  Severino makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Severino has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest.

In 2010, Severino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Severino is requesting his first loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and seedlings to raise.  He plans to use any additional revenue generated from his farming to improve/expand his enterprise. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds and seedlings for rice farming.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen L. D. Q. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Alegría, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada. La señora Maria del Carmen posee una tienda en la que comercializa diferentes tipos D. productos, ya sea para el cuidado y limpieza del hogar como también alimenticios, dicho negocio  esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que La señora María del Carmen no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda.
texts.en:
María del Carmen L. D. Q., 41, lives in the town of Alegría, located in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company. Maria has a store in which she sells different types of products, both household products and foods. This business is located in her house. She is asking for a loan so she will have enough money to stock her store. María asks this because she does not have the necessary funds to do it, and it is very necessary both for her and for her husband because this business allows them to cover their household expenses. She wants to be able to stock her store with products like detergent, canned foods, bread, snacks, drinks and other products which are basic necessities in a home and which are also asked for most in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products to stock a store

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn M. is from the village of Salay Angadanan, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Joylyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joylyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Joylyn has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Joylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Joylyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dinora Elizabeth H. D. M. D. 43 años D. edad resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, junto a su compañero D. vida, el cual a pesar que es pensionado, trabaja como motorista D. su propio vehiculo, en el cual se encarga D. hacer viajes a diferentes personas, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 11 y 8 años D. edad. Debido a que el sueldo D. su esposo es muy poco, ella decidió hace ocho años iniciar su propio negocio, el cual le permitiera contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Es por lo cual que Dinora invirtió sus ahorros en una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual nació con la iniciativa D. tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Dinora solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando productos como embutidos, detergentes, pan y otros productos más, esto lo espera lograr  por medio D. dicho préstamo, ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años D. poseer la tienda no ha contado con el dinero necesario para invertir más en ella debido a que la mayoría D. las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Dinora Elizabeth H. D. M., 43, lives in the town of Soyapango with her life partner, who despite being retired uses his own vehicle to work as a driver, giving rides to different people. She also lives with their two children, ages 11 and 8. Since her husband's salary is very low, Dinora decided eight years ago to open her own business, which allows her to contribute to all the household expenses along with her husband. This is why she invested her savings in a perishable goods store, which was born from her initiative to have more economic stability. Dinora is asking for a loan so she can invest more in her store, buying products like sausages, detergents, bread and other products. She hopes to do this with the loan, since although she has had the shop for several years she has not had the money to invest in it because most of her earnings go toward household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products to stock store

loans.name: Werner Eduardo

texts.es: Werner Eduardo A. de 31 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual trabaja como taxista durante ciertas horas o también alquila el taxi para obtener mayores ingresos, de esta misma forma posee una tienda de productos perecederos en su hogar, la cual esta ubicada en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su esposa la cual es ama de casa y así mismo vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Werner se divide durante el día ya sea trabajando en el taxi o en la tienda, la cual se encarga de atender su esposa cuando él esta fuera trabajando. Werner es un hombre de familia muy trabajador quien desea brindarle todo lo mejor a su hijo y esposa, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para invertir en la tienda comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad, sobretodo productos alimenticios, ya que cerca de su negocio se encuentra un fabrica de zapatos bastante grande de donde muchos de los empleados consumen los productos de la tienda de Werner, situación la cual el desea aprovechar al máximo.
texts.en:
Werner Eduardo A., 31, is a very responsible and hardworking person who works as a taxi driver at certain times or also rents the taxi out to earn more income. He also has a perishable goods store in his home, which is located in the town of Soyapango, in the department of San Salvador, where he lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and with their one-year-old son. Werner divides the day between working in the taxi or in the store, which his wife tends when he is working outside the home. Werner is a very hardworking family man who wants the best for his son and wife. For this reason he is asking for a loan so he will have the necessary resources to invest in the store. He will buy greater quantities of staple products, above all food items, since near his home there is a fairly large shoe factory where many of the employees buy products from Werner's store, and he wants to take maximum advantage of this situation.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perishable products

loans.name: Julieta

loans.name: Sandra Moraima

texts.es: Sandra Moraima Z. P. de 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante, y junto a sus tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Sandra posee una venta de frutas la cual esta ubicada a las afueras  del mercado regional de San Martín. Desde hace 2 años que ella cuenta con este negocio, el cual les ha permitido tener una vida llena de todo lo básico necesario para sobrevivir. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se dedica a su negocio de lunes a domingo durante todo el día, esto lo hace con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales son tan necesarias para su hogar. Por esta razón ella solicitan un préstamo, ya que Sandra desea poder comprar frutas al por mayor con el fin de poder comprar a menor precio y de esta forma ofrecer su productos a menores precios que su competencia. Tanto Sandra como su esposo son un matrimonio muy trabajador, los cuales se esfuerzan por una vida mejor para ambos pero sobre todo para brindarles todo lo necesario a quienes son su mayor incentivo para trabajar mucho más duro los cuales son sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra Moraima Z. P. is 27 years old and lives in the San Martín municipality located in San Salvador with her merchant husband and 3 children, ages 12, 10 and 8, who are all students. Sandra owns and operates a fruit stand located just outside the San Martín regional market. She’s had her business for two years, which has provided her and her family with all the basic necessities to live. She is a hardworking woman who tends her business from Monday through Sunday, all day long, with the goal to earn bigger profits that are so necessary for her household. This is why she is requesting a loan, as she wishes to be able to purchase more fruits at wholesale and be able to sell at lower costs than her competition. Sandra and her husband are a hardworking couple who do their best to create a better life for themselves and, more importantly, to provide the very best for their children, who are their biggest incentive to work even harder.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits

loans.name: Magie

texts.en:
Magie G. is from the village of Salay Angadanan, Isabela. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Magie owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Magie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Magie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Magie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Magie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine O. is from the village of Lapaz, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling corn and rice in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mr. Khat M. is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. He has a life partner in his wife (appearing in the photograph), who works selling a few cooking ingredients. This couple, who works together in the farming business, has four children, almost all of whom attend school. For the coming farming season, Khat M. requires some supplies but lacks the money to meet his needs. Therefore, he has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. She is 36 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Mary owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Mary has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Mary joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Germeline

texts.en: Germeline operates a rice retail business, which she started only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The business is a big help for the family in covering their expenses and setting aside savings for the future. Germeline is requesting a new loan of PHP 12,000 to buy inventories of rice to sell. Germeline hopes that her business will become successful someday. She also dreams of seeing her six children graduate from college and find stable jobs. Germeline wants to thank ASHI/Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. It is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy inventories of rice to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha V. is from the town of Rizal West in the municipality of San Isidro. She is 24 years old. Editha is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Editha is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: Ana Victoria B. de 23 años de edad, vive junto a su madre, junto a su hermano y un hijo de 1 año de edad, junto a los cuales reside en El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de San Miguel. Ella posee una tortillería y comedor en el cual se encarga de elaborar deliciosos almuerzos, esto lo realiza con la ayuda de su madre quien le ayuda en el negocio, durante 5 años ella  ha trabajado arduamente por el bienestar de su familia y ahora por el de su hijo, ya que Ana es madre soltera, razón por la cual debe esforzarse el doble por poder brindarles todo lo necesario  a su pequeño, el cual se ha convertido en la razón principal de todo para ella. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas, esto debido a que cuenta con muy buena clientela, y ella desea poder atender a más clientes, puesto que en muchas ocasiones por falta de masa no ha podido atender a mas personas, es por ello que solicita el préstamo el cual le permita comprar más materia prima tanto para elaborar las tortillas como también para comprar todo lo necesario para realizar mayor cantidad de almuerzos y así vender más y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Victoria B. is 23 years old and lives with her mother, brother and her 1 year-old son in El Transito, located in San Miguel. She owns a tortilla shop and eatery, where she works at preparing delicious lunches. She does this with the aid of her mother who has been helping her for 5 years now. She’s worked hard for the well being of her family and now for the well being of her son. Since Ana is a single mother she must work doubly hard to provide everything for her little one who has become her all. Ana is asking for a loan to purchase corn for her tortillas so she can increase her customer base, which is already very good. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for both her tortillas as well as for her lunches so she may sell more and earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and ingredients for food
